Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At ING we are looking for a Data Analyst




Your role and work environment:




We are looking for a talented and enthusiastic Data Analyst to join our Human Connection Strategy Team of Human Connection tribe.




If you are passionate about turning data into actionable insights and enjoy working directly with stakeholders to influence strategic decisions, this role is for you.




We are seeking someone who, in additions to being technically proficient, can translate complex data insights into clear business recommendations, communicate effectively with non-technical audiences, and contribute to driving key initiatives within the organization.




Your key responsibilities:




As a Data analyst you will:




Translate data into insights that inform strategic and operational decisions across the business.
Work closely with business stakeholders to understand their needs, co-create analytical approaches, and present results in a way that drives action.
Prepare and deliver high-impact presentations and data-driven narratives for senior leadership and cross-functional teams.
Bridge the gap between data and business, ensuring insights are understandable and actionable.
Collaborate with other teams in an International and agile environment, ensuring alignment and consistent communication.




What are we looking for?




Want to know if this job is made for you? These are some of the qualities that we value the most for this role. And if the shoe fits‚Ä¶ don‚Äôt hesitate to apply!




For us, a Data analyst is someone who:




Knows about:




Bachelor‚Äôs degree in mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Business, Engineering, or similar.
3-4 years of experience in data analytics, business analytics, consulting, or related roles.
Solid knowledge of SQL and data visualization tools (e.g., power BI, Tableau) python or R is a plus but not essential.
Strong experience in data storytelling and creating business presentations.
Fluent English (spoken and written)
Understanding of business strategy and kpis to connect data insights with tangible business outcomes




Can:




Communicate complex data insights clearly and persuasively to non-technical stakeholders.
Proactively identify opportunities where data can add value and influence key decisions.




Loves to:




Collaborate in multidisciplinary teams, contributing to both technical and strategic conversations.
Present and defend your ideas with confidence and openness to feedback.




Defines himself/herself as a:




A team player with excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
Flexible, dynamic, and eager to work in fast-paced changing environments.




What do we offer?




The time you spend at work, the challenges you face or the lessons you get are very important, but‚Ä¶ What about your personal life? At ING we want your work to fulfill you in every way, and that is why we take care of even the smallest details.




Check out what is waiting for you!




Be flexible my friend.

Our model is all about flexibility and accountability. Keeping both our customers and our colleagues‚Äô needs in mind, you determine together which days you work at home and which you come to ING MAD to offer your best self. Do your thing.




Restaurant card.

So that thinking about what to have for lunch doesn‚Äôt take up your time or your cravings.




Our house will be your home.

In our offices you can find electric mobility solutions, doctor, hairdresser, gym, The Good Service (to help you with your errands) and much more!




Health insurance.

For you and all your family (spouse/partner and children).




Life insurance.

We help you protect what matters most to you.




Flexible remuneration.

In addition, you will enjoy our flexible remuneration model, through a more tax-advantaged way, you will be able to access other services such as nursery, transport card, training aids‚Ä¶




Free company shuttle.

It doesn't matter where you live. We have 6 routes (North, Central, South, A5, A42 and A6) to get you to our ING office in Madrid comfortably.




Banking benefits.

Special loans with more beneficial conditions.

Special mortgage conditions after 6 months working at the bank.

And you can benefit from our pension plan after 1 month with us!




More vitality and more belonging

360¬∫ care of the employee (physical, mental, social connection & purpose).

Physiotherapy service on site.

Clinics with professional, world-class athletes.

Gympass service.

Employee Networks: Rainbow Lions (LGBTQI+), Leonas & RI√ëG.

International Remote work program.







Get to know Us




We are a team of more than 1700 people sharing one idea: doing our bit in helping our clients create a better future for themselves, by providing them with the tools they need to get where they want to go.




A fully online bank where technology, innovation, simplicity and transparency are the main ingredients, and the first one to work with agile methodologies.




And although we are based in Spain, we are lucky to work in an international bank with presence in more than 40 countries.




We are proud to have a diverse team, and we are committed to continue developing a culture of Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging to foster a culture of collaboration and innovation that represents all collectives in the society.




And even though we look orange on the outside, we are green on the inside. Our ambition in Sustainability is Empowering (y)our Sustainability journey. We are embarking on our path, for us, but we are also there for when our clients decide to embark on this journey.




Making things happen, helping others be successful, always being one step ahead‚Äîthat‚Äôs our DNA. If you look at yourself in the mirror and your reflection matches our way of being and working‚Ä¶we are looking forward to meeting you!

Title: Data Analyst (Finance)
Description:
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, and more freedom. Since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. Our powerhouse of products ‚Äî including spending, saving, investing, exchanging, travelling, and more ‚Äî help our 50+ million customers get more from their money every day.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‚Äå 2 things are essential to our success: our people and our culture. In recognition of our outstanding employee experience, we've been certified as a Great Place to Work‚Ñ¢. So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our offices and remotely, to help us achieve our mission. And we're looking for more brilliant people. People who love building great products, redefining success, and turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. Our Data Analysts aren‚Äôt kept in the background, doomed to never see the impact of their work. They‚Äôre some of our best and brightest problem solvers, deployed to the front-lines to work in Product Teams and deliver rock star solutions.

We‚Äôre looking for a superstar Data Analysts who don't believe there's a data task that can be too hard. From digging into our complex databases, looking for the root cause of a problem to designing their own solutions and writing their own code to implement them. In this process, they never stop learning, picking up new skills, and delivering value.

Up for the challenge? Get in touch.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing


Supporting the Finance team in controlling market products, including market making and treasury investments
Analysing and optimising financial control and treasury management activities
Understanding business processes through financial data and ensuring accuracy from booking to accounting
Developing Price Verification Models to ensure accurate valuation of financial products
Automating financial controls to improve efficiency and compliance
Designing and implementing reconciliation logic for balance accuracy
Creating and maintaining dashboards to track key financial metrics
Collaborating with Market Making, Treasury, and Financial Control teams to enhance reporting and decision-making


What You'll Need


5+ years of experience working with Data Analysis and creating impactful solutions
Ability to manage a team and stakeholders
Excellent background / education in a quantitative discipline
Great skills with Python, SQL, or other programming languages
Evidence of strong mathematical and statistics knowledge


Nice to have


Advanced degree in a core STEM subject
Previous experience working on a Finance department


Building a global financial super app isn‚Äôt enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that‚Äôs why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We‚Äôre doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That‚Äôs why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Important notice for candidates:

Job scams are on the rise. Please keep these guidelines in mind when applying for any open roles.


Only apply through official Revolut channels. We don‚Äôt use any third-party services or platforms for our recruitment.
Always double-check the emails you receive. Make sure all communications are being done through official Revolut emails, with an @revolut.com domain.


We won't ask for payment or personal financial information during the hiring process. If anyone does ask you for this, it‚Äôs a scam. Report it immediately.

By submitting this application, I confirm that all the information given by me in this application for employment and any additional documents attached hereto are true to the best of my knowledge and that I have not wilfully suppressed any material fact. I confirm I have disclosed if applicable any previous employment with Revolut. I accept that if any of the information given by me in this application is in any way false or incorrect, my application may be rejected, any offer of employment may be withdrawn or my employment with Revolut may be terminated summarily or I may be dismissed. By submitting this application, I agree that my personal data will be processed in accordance with Revolut's <a class="postings-link" href="https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Candidate Privacy Notice

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst ‚Äì Financial Services

Madrid, Spain - office based work.

Full-Time




About the Company:




My client are a leading financial services firm based in Madrid, dedicated to providing innovative financial solutions to a diverse range of clients. We are seeking a highly motivated and skilled Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. If you are passionate about working with data in the financial sector and want to be a key part of our growth, we want to hear from you!




Key Responsibilities:

Data Analysis: Collect, clean, and analyze large datasets related to financial markets, investment portfolios, trading, and economic indicators.
Financial Insights: Provide actionable insights by analyzing market trends, financial products, and client data to support decision-making processes.
Reporting: Develop and maintain automated dashboards and reports to present key financial metrics and trends to stakeholders.
Modeling & Forecasting: Support the development of predictive models, risk assessments, and forecasting tools to enhance investment strategies.
Collaboration: Work closely with teams across trading, risk management, and finance to ensure data-driven decision-making and business alignment.
Compliance & Accuracy: Ensure data integrity and comply with industry regulations, ensuring accuracy in all reporting and analysis.




Qualifications:




Education: A Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a quantitative field such as Finance, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or Data Science from a top-tier university either globally or within Spain (e.g., Universidad de Barcelona, Universidad Aut√≥noma de Madrid, IE University, or similar).

Experience:




A minimum of 2-3 years of experience working as a Data Analyst within the financial services industry (e.g., investment banks, asset management, trading, financial technology).
Solid understanding of financial data, including equity, bonds, derivatives, and market behavior.




Skills:

Proficiency in data analysis tools such as SQL, Excel, and Python or R.
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau).
Familiarity with financial data sources like Bloomberg, Reuters, or similar platforms.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to synthesize complex financial data into clear insights.
Fluent in English (both written and spoken); proficiency in Spanish is a plus.




What We Offer:

Competitive salary and benefits package.
Opportunities for career advancement and professional development.
A collaborative and dynamic work environment.
The chance to work with cutting-edge financial technologies.

Title: Business Intelligence Data Analyst
Description:
GROUP BNP PARIBAS

BNP Paribas Group is the top bank in the European Union and a major international banking establishment. It has close to 185,000 employees in 65 countries. In Spain we are more than 5,100 employees within 13 business lines.




Spain IT Production




Spain IT Production organization consists of CIB ITO & ITG IT Platforms and is responsible for providing IT Production services to our Clients in EMEA, ensuring a Digital Market evolution, in a secured and performant environment, and with a reliable quality. IT Production organisation includes Infrastructure services, Telecom & Workspace, Production Security and Application Production domains and associated transversal services (CTO Office, Control Tower, PMO and IT Continuity). In Spain, IT Production relies on a Platform with over 400 experts that provide full-stack support services ensuring a secure, stable, standardized, and efficient production.




ABOUT THE JOB




MISSION




For the Security Dashboard activities, we are looking for Data Security & Business Intelligence Engineer to support and coordinate the deployment of the Security Dashboard within the security productions of the BNPPARIBAS group




RESPONSIBILITIES




¬∑ Needs analysis for evolution of the current BI solution

¬∑ Provision of solutions in accordance with the company‚Äôs strategy based on (Cyber security Group requirements

¬∑ Coordinate the redesign and Dashboard transformation

¬∑ Deploy the solution within the group‚Äôs ProdSec entities of the group

¬∑ Ensure comitology with stakeholders (Technical Experts, Functional Experts, Product Owner, and customers.)

¬∑ Report to the manager and Team lead on the achievements progress.

¬∑ Ensuring the updating of the documentary heritage corpus




REQUIREMENTS




Studies




Bachelor‚Äôs in computer science or equivalent




Experience




Minimum 5 to 10 years of experience in cybersecurity and production environments




Languages




Fluent English written and spoken. Strong written, oral, and interpersonal communications skills.

French speaking is a plus.




SKILLS




Technical




o PowerBI, SQL, MS SSIS/ SSAS/ SSRS

o Python, PHP/ Symfony

o Systems: architecture, security, etc. to support monitoring and steering actions- d√©finition, production et mise en place de KPI de pilotage et de suivi

o The methodology for monitoring Cybersecurity Control Projects;

o Vulnerability & Patch Management

o Qualys, Tanium is plus




Transversal & Behavioral




o Strong situational analysis and needs identification.

o Proposal force for the most relevant solutions

o Ability to collaborate with different types of profiles. Technical, Functional, Project Leadership. Team leader, etc.

o Ability to share and transmit.

o Rigor, organization and method with a spirit of analysis and synthesis

o Customer orientation: listening, support and understanding of needs.

o Transverse vision to anticipate data correlations / Impacts.

o Good Cyber Security Culture.




BENEFITS

‚Ä¢ Training programs, career plans and internal mobility opportunities, national and international thanks to our presence in different countries.

‚Ä¢ Diversity and Inclusion Committee that ensures an inclusive work environment. In recent years, several employee communities have been created to organize diversity and inclusion awareness actions (PRIDE, We Generations and MixCity).

‚Ä¢ Corporate volunteering program (1 Million Hours 2 Help) in which employees can dedicate time out of their working hours to volunteer activities.

‚Ä¢ Flexible compensation plan.

‚Ä¢ Hybrid telecommuting model (50%).

‚Ä¢ 31 vacation days.







Diversity and inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas Group in Spain is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

Title: Master Data Analyst
Description:
We are seeking a detail-oriented and Master Data Management (MDM) Analyst to join our dynamic team.

The ideal candidate will conduct quantitative and qualitative analysis across various projects to optimise company growth and business. You will manipulate datasets, create financial models, and summarise findings in a succinct manner for client's usage.




Responsibilities




Compile data into actionable reports
Prepare pitch and presentation materials
Work collaboratively with team members
Think strategically about improving company operations




Qualifications




Bachelor's degree in Business or Economics or related discipline 1 - 3 years of experience working with data in a related field
Fluency in Microsoft Office suite (Outlook, Excel, Word, PowerPoint, etc.)
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with attention to detail.
Ability to work with people from many different cultural backgrounds.
Autonomous and organised
Ability to deal effectively with pressure
Be an organised thinker who can create order from complex situation
Fluency in English




If you are a dedicated MDM professional with a passion for data integrity and compliance, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity. Join our team and help us achieve excellence in master data management.




-------

HTML:
We are seeking a detail-oriented and Master Data Management (MDM) Analyst to join our dynamic team.

The ideal candidate will conduct quantitative and qualitative analysis across various projects to optimise company growth and business. You will manipulate datasets, create financial models, and summarise findings in a succinct manner for client's usage.


Responsibilities


  • Compile data into actionable reports
  • Prepare pitch and presentation materials
  • Work collaboratively with team members
  • Think strategically about improving company operations


Qualifications


  • Bachelor's degree in Business or Economics or related discipline 1 - 3 years of experience working with data in a related field
  • Fluency in Microsoft Office suite (Outlook, Excel, Word, PowerPoint, etc.)
  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with attention to detail.
  • Ability to work with people from many different cultural backgrounds.
  • Autonomous and organised
  • Ability to deal effectively with pressure
  • Be an organised thinker who can create order from complex situation
  • Fluency in English


If you are a dedicated MDM professional with a passion for data integrity and compliance, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity. Join our team and help us achieve excellence in master data management.

Title: Analyst, Advanced Data & Insights
Description:
Company Description

Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose ‚Äì to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.

Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.

Job Description

The Global Business Optimisation (GBO) team mission, as part of the Client Services (CS) organization, is to turn massive amounts of data into actionable insights that drive business value while working closely with Visa‚Äôs stakeholders to build creative solutions. Our Advance Data Analytics and Insights analysts are experts in data, coding, payment processing (including authorization and authentication), and creative thinking. We couple in-depth analysis of cardholder behaviour with Visa‚Äôs world-class products to address meaningful business problems.

In this role the analyst interprets and manage data to solve complex problems utilizing skills in data extraction, pre-processing, cleaning, visualization, and the use of tools like python, and Tableau. They are actively involved with all other teams in CS, supporting and developing new insights that help create, manage, and deliver actionable insights to both internal and external stakeholders.

Specific activities may include:


Data extraction: using your payment knowledge you will be responsible for extracting the correct data from numerous databases.
Data cleaning: perform data preprocessing, including cleaning and transforming data into usable information.
Data analysis: apply payments knowledge to interpret data and generate actionable insights.
Data validation: validate data extracted by you and others in the team to control data quality/ reliability.
Data visualization: develop visualizations to make complex analyses accessible to a broad audience.
Provide analytical and support about platforms, tools and data to internal stakeholders including delivering SME training.
Maintain highly strategic reports.
Work with a pan-European team and contribute to local and global projects across Visa.
Work in a Big Data environment with its technical challenges.
Be an out-of-the-box thinker who is passionate about brainstorming and implementing innovative ways to use our unique data to answer business problems.
Keen interest in working with a team of expert‚Äôs data analysts to create Advance Analytics, e.g.: training and deploying Machine Learning models, developing statistical analysis, etc.


This is a hybrid position. Expectation of days in office will be confirmed by your hiring manager.

Qualifications

A genuine passion for data, and about the payment‚Äôs ecosystem.

Intermediate to advance level skills in using data analysis tools and software. Excel, SQL, Python, and Tableau.

Proficient in all MS Office applications.

Confidence working in a high pace and dynamic environment, following several

work streams at the same time.

Experience in a corporate environment with data-based decision-making or quantitative analysis.

Ability to turn complex data subjects into easily understandable concepts.

Desirable

Strong verbal, written, and interpersonal skills (fluency in English is required while knowledge of an additional European language is a plus).

Experience of creating business value from data.

Knowledge of authorisation and/ or authentication processing.

Additional Information

Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

Title: Junior Analytic Consultant
Description:
Job Description

You will MAKE A DIFFERENCE by helping some of the largest FMCG manufacturers make the right choices for their growth strategies. You will partner with our clients and use data to explain what is happening with their brands and what they should do to improve business performance. Simply put, you will transform data into compelling stories. Working with your NIQ colleagues you will build partnerships that allow you to better understand your clients‚Äô business priorities and information needs. You'll use this knowledge to develop in-depth analytics and create insights to drive business growth.

Our Delivery Consultants team combines data and expertise to help our clients become more competitive and efficient through stronger, faster analytics.

With your numerical confidence and ability to translate numbers into insights, you can create a strong aptitude in understanding the needs of clients and build strong relationships with internal and external stakeholders. You have excellent time management and prioritizing skills that will help you be more effective and efficient.

Responsabilities


Earning client trust and building relationships by delivering meaningful analysis
Understanding the business needs of our client and applying solutions, with specific focus on the assortment on the store
Analyzing information creating value stories to help our clients in their daily work
Understanding our tools and systems as well as the NIQ product portfolio
Working closely with all teams to ensure work is connected to meet client business issues


Qualifications


University education in Mathematics, Statistics or ADE (Econometrics / Quantitative Methods for Business) or Business school/Management
High Office management (Excel, Power Point)
Eager to further develop presentations skills
Able to analyze data and summarize into a story
Performs work accurately and effectively with attention to detail
Interest towards FMCG environment


Fluent English: strong verbal and written communication skills in English. French & Spanish will be valuable.

Additional Information

Our Benefits


Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)


About NIQ

NIQ is the world‚Äôs leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights‚Äîdelivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms‚ÄîNIQ delivers the Full View‚Ñ¢. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world‚Äôs population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Want to keep up with our latest updates?

Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion

At Extia, it‚Äôs ‚ÄúFirst who, then what.‚Äù So, let‚Äôs move forward together!

El objetivo del puesto es transformar datos en insights accionables mediante el uso de herramientas avanzadas de visualizaci√≥n, modelado y an√°lisis.

Title: Data Analyst (Product)
Description:
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, and more freedom. Since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. Our powerhouse of products ‚Äî including spending, saving, investing, exchanging, travelling, and more ‚Äî help our 50+ million customers get more from their money every day.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‚Äå 2 things are essential to our success: our people and our culture. In recognition of our outstanding employee experience, we've been certified as a Great Place to Work‚Ñ¢. So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our offices and remotely, to help us achieve our mission. And we're looking for more brilliant people. People who love building great products, redefining success, and turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. Our Data Analysts aren‚Äôt kept in the background, doomed to never see the impact of their work. They‚Äôre some of our best and brightest problem solvers, deployed to the front-lines to work in Product Teams and deliver rock star solutions ü§ò

We‚Äôre looking for a superstar Data Analyst who does not believe there is a data task that can be too hard ü¶¨ From digging into our complex databases, looking for the root cause of a problem to designing their own solutions and writing their own code to implement them. In this process they never stop learning, picking up new skills and delivering value.

Up for the challenge? Get in touch üëá

What You‚Äôll Be Doing


Understanding our business and its processes through our data
Applying this understanding and knowledge of data to help product and service teams
Designing key metrics to measure different aspects of the business
Creating and maintaining new aggregated views and tables to simplify data querying
Maintaining and creating new dashboards to track metrics and visualise insights
Promoting data literacy across the company, organising and holding workshops


What You'll Need


Previous experience in an analytical role, creating impactful solutions
A strong background/education in a quantitative discipline
5+ years of experience with SQL
Great skills with Python or other programming languages
Evidence of strong mathematical and statistics knowledge


Building a global financial super app isn‚Äôt enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that‚Äôs why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We‚Äôre doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That‚Äôs why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Important notice for candidates:

Job scams are on the rise. Please keep these guidelines in mind when applying for any open roles.


Only apply through official Revolut channels. We don‚Äôt use any third-party services or platforms for our recruitment.
Always double-check the emails you receive. Make sure all communications are being done through official Revolut emails, with an @revolut.com domain.


We won't ask for payment or personal financial information during the hiring process. If anyone does ask you for this, it‚Äôs a scam. Report it immediately.

By submitting this application, I confirm that all the information given by me in this application for employment and any additional documents attached hereto are true to the best of my knowledge and that I have not wilfully suppressed any material fact. I confirm I have disclosed if applicable any previous employment with Revolut. I accept that if any of the information given by me in this application is in any way false or incorrect, my application may be rejected, any offer of employment may be withdrawn or my employment with Revolut may be terminated summarily or I may be dismissed. HTML:
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, and more freedom. Since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. Our powerhouse of products ‚Äî including spending, saving, investing, exchanging, travelling, and more ‚Äî help our 50+ million customers get more from their money every day.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‚Äå 2 things are essential to our success: our people and our culture. In recognition of our outstanding employee experience, we've been certified as a Great Place to Work‚Ñ¢. So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our offices and remotely, to help us achieve our mission. And we're looking for more brilliant people. People who love building great products, redefining success, and turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. Our Data Analysts aren‚Äôt kept in the background, doomed to never see the impact of their work. They‚Äôre some of our best and brightest problem solvers, deployed to the front-lines to work in Product Teams and deliver rock star solutions ü§ò

We‚Äôre looking for a superstar Data Analyst who does not believe there is a data task that can be too hard ü¶¨ From digging into our complex databases, looking for the root cause of a problem to designing their own solutions and writing their own code to implement them. In this process they never stop learning, picking up new skills and delivering value.

Up for the challenge? Get in touch üëá

What You‚Äôll Be Doing

  • Understanding our business and its processes through our data
  • Applying this understanding and knowledge of data to help product and service teams
  • Designing key metrics to measure different aspects of the business
  • Creating and maintaining new aggregated views and tables to simplify data querying
  • Maintaining and creating new dashboards to track metrics and visualise insights
  • Promoting data literacy across the company, organising and holding workshops

What You'll Need

  • Previous experience in an analytical role, creating impactful solutions
  • A strong background/education in a quantitative discipline
  • 5+ years of experience with SQL
  • Great skills with Python or other programming languages
  • Evidence of strong mathematical and statistics knowledge

Building a global financial super app isn‚Äôt enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that‚Äôs why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We‚Äôre doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That‚Äôs why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Important notice for candidates:

Job scams are on the rise. Please keep these guidelines in mind when applying for any open roles.

  • Only apply through official Revolut channels. We don‚Äôt use any third-party services or platforms for our recruitment.
  • Always double-check the emails you receive. Make sure all communications are being done through official Revolut emails, with an @revolut.com domain.

We won't ask for payment or personal financial information during the hiring process. If anyone does ask you for this, it‚Äôs a scam. Report it immediately.

Title: Sustainability Data Analyst
Description:
ABOUT US




Konecta is a leading innovative global service provider in customer management business process and digital outsourcing, with 120,000 passionate employees working in 30 languages across 4 continents and 26 countries. Focusing on the unique needs and opportunities of each industry, Konecta offers a full range of end-to-end customer management solutions ‚Äì including acquisition, retention, customer service, technical support, and collection ‚Äì all based on a sustainable business model. These services are built on a portfolio of world-class expertise covering customer experience and process management, digital solutions and cutting-edge technologies. Headquartered in Madrid, Konecta delivers global revenues of ‚Ç¨2 billion with more than 500 clients, covering some of the biggest names in telecoms, energy, banking, mobility, retail, and e-commerce.




MISSION OF THE ROLE




We are looking for a detail-oriented and proactive Sustainability Data Analyst to support the collection, analysis, and reporting of sustainability data across various domains such as environmental management, employee health and safety, training, and other relevant sustainability areas. This role will involve working closely with teams in different countries to gather data, audit it against evidence, and manage the information in a structured repository. The ideal candidate will be responsible for ensuring compliance with timelines and contributing to process optimization efforts.




RESPONSIBILITIES

Data Collection: Gather sustainability data across various areas (environmental, employee health and safety, training, etc.) by requesting data from different countries and business units.
Data Auditing & Validation: Perform audits on the data to ensure its accuracy and consistency with the available evidence. Ensure the data is loaded into the existing data repository in a structured manner.
Monitoring Compliance: Track and ensure compliance with the established deadlines for data submission and reporting.
Reporting & Dashboards: Create and maintain reports and dashboards to effectively communicate sustainability performance to internal stakeholders.
Process Optimization Support: Assist in optimizing the processes related to sustainability data collection, management, and reporting to improve efficiency and effectiveness.




REQUIREMENTS

Strong proficiency in data analysis tools and software (e.g., Excel, Power BI, Google Drive, or other data visualization platforms).
Experience with sustainability data management and reporting tools is a plus.
Knowledge of sustainability-related metrics and frameworks (e.g., environmental impact, health and safety, training metrics) is advantageous.
Fluency in English (both written and spoken) is essential.
Proactivity and the ability to work independently while managing multiple tasks.
Strong analytical skills, with a keen eye for detail and accuracy.
Problem-solving abilities and a solution-oriented mindset.
Effective communication skills to work across different teams and countries.

Title: Data Analyst & Reporting Specialist
Description:
Join Openbank, the 100% digital bank of the Santander Group, where innovation meets opportunity! With over 2 million customers across Spain, Germany, the Netherlands, Portugal, we're leading the way in digital banking. From loans and mortgages to a cutting-edge, fully automated investment platform, our products are transforming the industry.

At Openbank, we pride ourselves on simplicity, agility, and security, earning us the title of the most recommended Spanish bank among our customers. Technology is in our DNA and we are constantly developing new digital solutions and products. And we're not stopping there! At Openbank we are proud to be a bank that is gaining more and more international presence, we have just landed in the United States and Mexico.




If you're passionate about digital innovation, eager to make an impact, and ready to be part of a dynamic and forward-thinking company, then we want to hear from you! Join us and be part of our journey to redefine banking for the digital age!




Mission & Role:

In this role, you will be responsible for analyzing and extracting insights from large datasets from various sources in our AWS Datalake, to solve complex business problems. You will work closely with data engineers to implement scalable solutions and ensure that the data you work with is clean and reliable. You will be expected to create actionable results through statistical analysis, data visualization, and software development, enabling decision-making across different teams. You will also play a key role in supporting the team‚Äôs efforts to use data more effectively and to automate key business processes.




You will work in a transparent environment where knowledge-sharing and open communication are encouraged. As a team player, you‚Äôll engage with others to reach common goals, making sure to balance both the big picture and fine details.




You will apply your knowledge of statistical analysis and experience with tools like Python or Spark to implement solutions and provide clear insights. Additionally, you will help design and produce efficient data pipelines, contributing to the success of the team and its projects.




To be successful in the role you must bring:

At least +3 years of experience in Statistical Analysis: Strong knowledge of basic statistical concepts and the ability to implement them in programming languages such as Python or Spark. You know when to use different statistical indicators and have experience summarizing insights from data.
Experience with Large Datasets: Familiarity with working on large datasets and implementing scalable solutions. You understand data cleaning, and you know how to collaborate effectively with data engineers.
Problem-Solving with Data: Ability to break down complex problems into manageable analytical components and reuse existing solutions from previous projects.
Software Development Knowledge: Understanding of software development practices, including using Git, writing and testing your code, and leveraging it to produce meaningful results. If you're an open-source enthusiast, we'd love to see your GitHub contributions!
Proficiency in Data Visualization: Experience with tools like ggplot, matplotlib, Tableau, or similar. Bonus points for experience with Microstrategy or QuickSight.
SQL Expertise: You are an SQL ninja, and writing both exploratory and efficient queries is second nature to you.
STEM Background: A degree in a STEM field (Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics) is highly desired due to the strong software development component of the role.
Emotional resilience: You can give and take criticism well. You don‚Äôt get defensive when your ideas are challenged, and you‚Äôre polite enough to challenge others‚Äô ideas when necessary.
Confidence without arrogance: You are confident but not arrogant. You ask for help when needed and openly admit when you don‚Äôt know something. You value and celebrate the contributions of others.
Exceptional communication skills: You explain your ideas clearly and succinctly, ask for input, and listen carefully. You build on the ideas of others, and your presentations are impactful without being overwhelming.
Transparency: You value transparency, always willing to share your knowledge and ideas with the team.
Team collaboration: You are a strong team player, supporting and collaborating with others to achieve common goals.




What do we offer?

Joining a dynamic and agile company undergoing international expansion.
Working in start-up mode with the support of the Santander Group.
Competitive remuneration and attractive benefits package.
Possibility of growth within the company and the Group.
Collaborating on international projects in different countries.
Excellent work environment, social clubs and frequent events.




Would you like to grow with us? Join our team!

Title: CS Insights Analyst
Description:
Job Description

ABOUT THIS JOB

Our Analysts are vital to NielsenIQ‚Äôs success. They work every day with our client base, which includes most of the major brands you see in the supermarket. We also work with most of the supermarkets and other retailers where you‚Äôll find these products. If you saw it the last time you did your weekly shop, they‚Äôre probably a NielsenIQ client, as is the shop. They all rely on our Senior Analytics Executives.

Our clients trust our Insights Analysts, coming to them when they have challenges and questions. These questions range from deciding on new product development, designing a new price strategy, and much more! NielsenIQ‚Äôs Analysts work with our clients to create and present analyses based on the world‚Äôs best datasets. Our insights team support clients in Health and Beauty, Beers, Wine and Spirits or Grocery.

We are confident and capable crafters of compelling insights and deliver clear and actionable recommendations to our clients, helping them grow their business.

A successful candidate for this role will be someone who can establish strong relationships with both our clients and our colleagues. You will quickly become a trusted partner, working with many of our clients‚Äô teams, including marketing, sales, category, and many more. You will be expected to understand our clients‚Äô needs and then create and present solutions that help those clients achieve their strategic and tactical goals.

Our team has a wide range of backgrounds and skill sets. Some of us have backgrounds in data, some in marketing, and others in sales. We are looking for someone who is keen to bring their excellent story-telling skills to a modern, data environment.

If telling stories through data excites you but you‚Äôre uncertain whether you have the data knowledge: get in touch. We have an excellent training program, ensuring you understand all our products and how we create analyses.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Understanding Client Needs:


Understanding client business priorities and the role we can play in supporting these goals
Understand the impact we can have on personal objectives of individuals at our clients
Responsible for setting up client onboarding for analytics & insights services and conducting tactical client training for Guided Analytics & NielsenIQ tools such as Connect Express and Discover


Delivering Insight:


Become a category expert; be curious and engage with the client industry, their categories and key market trends
Being prepared to challenge client hypothesis and bring a new perspective
Make recommendations based on rigorous analysis leveraging multiple data sources, sound business understanding and commercial awareness.


Workload Management and Prioritization:


Manages workload independently and effectively prioritizes client commitments alongside internal commitments.
Maintains a clear communication pathway with the key stakeholders
Maintains and delivers work log trackers and project plans where applicable


REQUIREMENTS


Engaging presenter with 5-7 years of experience
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Excellent time management and prioritization skills with a proven track record of delivering projects on time
Confident numerically
Ability to analyze data confidently
Problem solving and solutions orientated
Performs work accurately and effectively with attention to detail
Good at building relationships, internally and with clients
Experience of working in an analytical environment
An understanding of the FMCG industry and trends
Capable of leveraging tools such as Microsoft excel and PowerPoint
Experience in using Home Panel data is a plus
Native in Spanish and good level of English


WHAT WE CAN OFFER

We provide the most complete and trusted view of consumers and markets in 90 countries covering 90% of the world‚Äôs populations. Focusing on consumer-packaged goods manufacturers and retailers, we combine unparalleled datasets, pioneering technology, and the industry‚Äôs top talent to create insights that unlock innovation and redefine what‚Äôs possible.

Working with our Customer Success team gives you access to:


Our amazing 'people first' culture with plenty of flexibility
Career & Learning development
Making an impact on biggest FMCG manufacturers' growth
Becoming an expert in categories that shape Spanish retail


Additional Information

This is a full time role based in Madrid offering a hybrid working mode combining working from home, office and visiting clients.

Additional Information

Our Benefits


Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)


About NIQ

NIQ is the world‚Äôs leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights‚Äîdelivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms‚ÄîNIQ delivers the Full View‚Ñ¢. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world‚Äôs population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Want to keep up with our latest updates?

Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion

Additional Information

Our Benefits

  • Flexible working environment
  • Volunteer time off
  • LinkedIn Learning
  • Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)

About NIQ

NIQ is the world‚Äôs leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights‚Äîdelivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms‚ÄîNIQ delivers the Full View‚Ñ¢. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world‚Äôs population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Nexthink is the leader in digital employee experience management software. The company provides IT leaders with unprecedented insight allowing them to see, diagnose and fix issues at scale impacting employees anywhere, with any application or network, before employees notice the issue. As the first solution to allow IT to progress from reactive problem solving to proactive optimization, Nexthink enables its more than 1,200 customers to provide better digital experiences to more than 15 million employees. Dual headquartered in Lausanne, Switzerland and Boston, Massachusetts, Nexthink has 9 offices worldwide.

Job Description

We are seeking a highly analytical and data-driven Data Analyst to join our team. In this role, you will transform raw data into actionable insights, helping optimize operational efficiency and support decision-making processes. You should be passionate about metrics, monitoring, and automation‚Äîalways looking for ways to improve efficiency through data.

Key Responsibilities

Data Collection & Processing


Gather and integrate data from multiple sources into complex models.
Ensure data accuracy, completeness, and consistency through validation and cleansing.
Automate data extraction and transformation processes to enhance efficiency.


Data Analysis & Visualization


Conduct in-depth analysis to identify trends, patterns, and correlations.
Apply statistical and predictive modeling techniques to generate insights and forecasts.
Develop interactive Power BI dashboards and reports for clear, impactful data communication.


Performance Monitoring & Reporting


Track key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics.
Generate regular performance reports to highlight progress and opportunities for improvement.
Optimize Power BI reports for scalability and sustainability across large datasets.


Cross-Functional Collaboration


Work closely with different teams to deliver data-driven solutions.
Participate in interdisciplinary projects requiring analytics and actionable insights.
Act as a subject matter expert in data analytics, supporting and guiding colleagues.


Qualifications


Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel & Power BI, including:
Report development
Data modeling & dataflows
DAX calculations & Power Query
Experience creating interactive Power BI reports from multiple data sources.
Knowledge of Microsoft Fabric (preferred).
Data & metrics-driven mindset ‚Äì comfortable with both qualitative and quantitative analysis.
Strong analytical background, capable of working in ambiguous situations.
Strong business communication skills, with the ability to write compelling proposals.
Fluency in English (additional languages are a plus).


If you are a proactive, results-oriented data analyst with a passion for transforming data into strategic insights, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!

Additional Information

We are the pioneers and trailblazers of a global IT Market Category (DEX) that is shaping the future of how the world works, giving our customers‚Äô IT Teams total digital visibility across their enterprise. Our innovative solutions integrate real-time analytics, automation, and employee feedback across all endpoints. This enables our IT teams to solve complex technical challenges, create ever more productive workplaces, and deliver happy, satisfied employees in the digital workplace.

With over 1000 employees across 5 continents, Nexthink operates as One Team, connecting, collaborating and innovating to continuously grow. We call our employees ‚ÄòNexthinkers‚Äô and our commitment to diversity, inclusion, and equity is second to none. We currently have over 75 nationalities working with us, from all cultures and backgrounds, speaking many different languages.

If you are looking for a change and like a nice atmosphere, lots of challenges, and having fun while working, this is a great opportunity for you! Check what we offer:


üíº Permanent Contract and a competitive compensation package (Stock Options also included).
üìç Amazing centrally located offices near the Bernabeu Stadium.
ü©∫ Private Health Insurance (Sanitas) and daily meal vouchers of 11 EUR will be entirely covered by us.
üè° Hybrid work model balancing office and remote work, with a structured approach for new hires to foster connections and onboarding.
üèñÔ∏è Flexible Hours and unlimited vacation (employees have unlimited paid time off on top of the 23 days of holidays we offer) plus 3 company-paid volunteer days.
ü§∏ Up to 25 EUR per month for a gym subscription.
üõ¥ Flexible retribution plan for kindergarten & transport tickets.
üßë‚Äçüè´ Reimbursement of up to 50% of the cost of English & Spanish classes.
üçâ Fresh fruit, cookies, soft drinks and protein shakes at the office.
üçï Regular company and team events like Pizza talks, Team Building activities, Christmas parties, hosting Meetups at the office and more!
üì£ Bonuses for referring successful hires after three months of continuous employment.
üöö We offer a relocation package to people who are coming from another country.


Please note that not all the benefits listed above are available for temporary, contract, and internship roles. To ensure you have the most up-to-date information, we recommend checking with your Recruitment Partner.

Dual headquartered in Lausanne, Switzerland and Boston, Massachusetts, Nexthink has 9 offices worldwide.

Job Description

We are seeking a highly analytical and data-driven Data Analyst to join our team. In this role, you will transform raw data into actionable insights, helping optimize operational efficiency and support decision-making processes. You should be passionate about metrics, monitoring, and automation‚Äîalways looking for ways to improve efficiency through data.

Key Responsibilities

Data Collection & Processing

  • Gather and integrate data from multiple sources into complex models.
  • Ensure data accuracy, completeness, and consistency through validation and cleansing.
  • Automate data extraction and transformation processes to enhance efficiency.

Data Analysis & Visualization

  • Conduct in-depth analysis to identify trends, patterns, and correlations.
  • Apply statistical and predictive modeling techniques to generate insights and forecasts.
  • Develop interactive Power BI dashboards and reports for clear, impactful data communication.

Performance Monitoring & Reporting

  • Track key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics.
  • Generate regular performance reports to highlight progress and opportunities for improvement.
  • Optimize Power BI reports for scalability and sustainability across large datasets.

Cross-Functional Collaboration

  • Work closely with different teams to deliver data-driven solutions.
  • Participate in interdisciplinary projects requiring analytics and actionable insights.
  • Act as a subject matter expert in data analytics, supporting and guiding colleagues.

Qualifications

  • Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel & Power BI, including:
  • Report development
  • Data modeling & dataflows
  • DAX calculations & Power Query
  • Experience creating interactive Power BI reports from multiple data sources.
  • Knowledge of Microsoft Fabric (preferred).
  • Data & metrics-driven mindset ‚Äì comfortable with both qualitative and quantitative analysis.
  • Strong analytical background, capable of working in ambiguous situations.
  • Strong business communication skills, with the ability to write compelling proposals.
  • Fluency in English (additional languages are a plus).

If you are a proactive, results-oriented data analyst with a passion for transforming data into strategic insights, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!

Additional Information

We are the pioneers and trailblazers of a global IT Market Category (DEX) that is shaping the future of how the world works, giving our customers‚Äô IT Teams total digital visibility across their enterprise. Our innovative solutions integrate real-time analytics, automation, and employee feedback across all endpoints. This enables our IT teams to solve complex technical challenges, create ever more productive workplaces, and deliver happy, satisfied employees in the digital workplace.

With over 1000 employees across 5 continents, Nexthink operates as One Team, connecting, collaborating and innovating to continuously grow. We call our employees ‚ÄòNexthinkers‚Äô and our commitment to diversity, inclusion, and equity is second to none. We currently have over 75 nationalities working with us, from all cultures and backgrounds, speaking many different languages.

If you are looking for a change and like a nice atmosphere, lots of challenges, and having fun while working, this is a great opportunity for you! Check what we offer:

  • üíº Permanent Contract and a competitive compensation package (Stock Options also included).
  • üìç Amazing centrally located offices near the Bernabeu Stadium.
  • ü©∫ Private Health Insurance (Sanitas) and daily meal vouchers of 11 EUR will be entirely covered by us.
  • üè° Hybrid work model balancing office and remote work, with a structured approach for new hires to foster connections and onboarding.
  • üèñÔ∏è Flexible Hours and unlimited vacation (employees have unlimited paid time off on top of the 23 days of holidays we offer) plus 3 company-paid volunteer days.
  • ü§∏ Up to 25 EUR per month for a gym subscription.
  • üõ¥ Flexible retribution plan for kindergarten & transport tickets.
  • üßë‚Äçüè´ Reimbursement of up to 50% of the cost of English & Spanish classes.
  • üçâ Fresh fruit, cookies, soft drinks and protein shakes at the office.
  • üçï Regular company and team events like Pizza talks, Team Building activities, Christmas parties, hosting Meetups at the office and more!
  • üì£ Bonuses for referring successful hires after three months of continuous employment.
  • üöö We offer a relocation package to people who are coming from another country.

Please note that not all the benefits listed above are available for temporary, contract, and internship roles. To ensure you have the most up-to-date information, we recommend checking with your Recruitment Partner.

Title: Insights Analyst - Temporary
Description:
With two centuries of family heritage, Suntory Global Spirits is a world leader in premium spirits. As a truly global business, we bring together the best of our culturally diverse heritage. We value both agility and long-term thinking; we share a collective commitment to excellence and a dedication to craftsmanship. Across borders and roles, we collaborate to delight our consumers responsibly whilst contributing to a more sustainable society for all our stakeholders.




Our Vision is Growing for Good, and our mission is to be the world‚Äôs most admired, fastest-growing premium spirits company. We‚Äôre a business that runs on responsibility, integrity, ambition and drive, and we celebrate exceptional performance. We welcome our people to dream big and tenaciously pursue ambitious goals ‚Äì we call it our Yatte Minahare Spirit.







Insights Analyst (Temporary)

This role is open in Madrid, Spain.







What makes this a great opportunity?

The Insights Analyst skillfully creates appropriate methodologies, execute primary research (quantitative and qualitative), to vividly bring alive consumer understanding / insight that inspires big ideas and delivers profitable brand growth. Equip the marketing/trade teams with an understanding of their performance. Bring the consumer to life as part of the activity development process (e.g. creative briefing) and is a key contributor to the Consumer Planning & Insights team, looking for ‚ÄúSimpler, Faster, Better‚Äù ways to deliver value to the business.







Role Responsibilities

Consumer understanding: Delivering the learning plan for the brand. Accountable for identifying and driving the brand consumer agenda. Conducts insights and research for Spain Market: qualitative fieldwork and quantitative studies; running projects end-to-end (many times with minimal supervision). Support the day-to-day project management needs across a wide variety of research methodologies and suppliers.
Category & brand strategy and activity planning: Leads, in partnership with the marketing team, a robust situation assessment for the Brand as input into the annual strategy process and activity planning. Provide day-to-day consumer insights and business intelligence consulting support for brand and sales team members. Ensuring the brand / trade teams understand consumer reasons for performance (using tracker, sales data, trends data etc), and act on the implications of that understanding.
Integrated brand communication: Supports the development of creative and media briefing process alongside the brand and agency partners. Ensures that the consumer programs and creative assets are informed by the most current and relevant Insights and testing protocols.
Insights & resource management: Responsible for designing and executing consumer and market research in connection with the marketing teams to: identify emerging consumer behaviors, wants, and needs; new consumer segments (now, next and future); market trends (micro, macro and mega), and analyzing competitive activity. Partner with local data and key platform providers (e.g. Nielsen) for brand/market -specific projects as needed ‚Äì as well as leveraging the global insight tools, platforms and data, where possible. Accountable for managing brand research spend to deliver targeted savings and on budget Ensures that the consumer programs and creative assets are informed by the most current and relevant Insights and testing protocols.
Business performance management: Builds an extensive understanding of Measure & Evaluation for the brand to drive more effective marketing planning. Integration of CMI sources in to Quarterly/Monthly Business Reviews. Management of relationship and day to day interaction with external partners (Nielsen, etc...). Responsible for training new users and the ongoing capability building for users in CMI tools (Nielsen, Answers, Clickview, Kantar)







Qualifications

5+ years of experience of commercial/ business analytics with strong application experience (Client Side)
Bachelor‚Äôs degree (Masters preferred) in Business Analytics, Data Science, Applied Mathematics / Statistics /Computer Science
Proven experience in synthesizing and driving business impact utilizing information from multiple disparate sources (including but not limited to Nielsen NIQ data, distributor data, first-party retailer data)
Passionate about Consumer Insights, data and Market trends
Analytical and strategic mindset to think about the near- and longer-term team and evolution of analytics capabilities
Proficiency visualization tools / BI / analytics tools (e.g., Excel, Power BI) is required
Strong communication and presentation skills with proven track record of using insights to influence executive sand colleagues to action
Ability to work independently and strong sense of individual accountability. Works with fair level of autonomy, is able to prioritize, but knows when to escalate problems
High degree of numeracy and analysis
Experience of managing multiple projects simultaneously / multi-tasking .
Industry experience in AlcBev is a plus







At SGS, people are our number one priority! We are an equal opportunity employer and committed to promoting a diverse and inclusive environment. All recruitment and hiring decisions are based on an applicant‚Äôs skills and experience.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Landbot is the most powerful no-code chatbot builder. Our platform helps thousands of companies convert leads, capture data, and personalize customer journeys in real time.

Our Core Values

üéØ The Role

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our team!! üöÄ

As a Data Analyst, you will play a key role in shaping our product's data strategy, ensuring high-quality data analysis, visualization, and modeling to support data-driven decisions across the company. This position is ideal for someone passionate about data analytics, product insights, and problem-solving in a fast-paced SaaS environment.

üîç Your Main Tasks & Responsibilities


Insight Generation & Experimentation:
Collaborate with product development teams to ensure the product is correctly instrumented, and that the operational data models allow the exploitation of our data for analytics purposes.
Analyze data from various sources to draw insights and support decision-making.
Collaborate with business and product teams to identify key metrics and derive actionable insights.
Collaborate with product managers in identifying opportunities, formulating hypotheses and validating them via experimentation.
Analytics Engineering:
Ensure data freshness, integrity and consistency within the data warehouse.
Develop & Maintain ELT processes to extract, transform, and load data from various sources into the warehouse.
Define and maintain usable reports and metrics, enabling self-service from the stakeholders.
Design, develop or help develop visualizations and dashboards tailored to the needs of different teams.
Data Activation:
Integrate data warehouse with third-party tools to activate the data for marketing, customer success, and/or sales.
Ensure the accuracy and timeliness of data feeds to these tools.
Promote data literacy and data informedness with stakeholders



üåü What Makes This Role Exciting?


Work on end-to-end data flow, influencing key product and business decisions.
Gain visibility into all company departments, learning from a variety of business areas.
Be part of a fast-growing, international company with a strong tech focus.



üõ† Must-Have Requirements


2-3 years of experience in data analysis within a digital product start-up or SaaS company
Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or a related field.
Analytical Thinking
Description: Ability to break down complex problems or datasets and derive meaningful insights.
Example: Identifying trends in user behavior from product data and suggesting actionable strategies for the product team.
Technical Proficiency:
Description: Proficient in data warehousing technologies, ETL/ELT processes, SQL, Python, git and data visualization tools. Familiar with development tools (CI/CD, version control, testing).
Example: Successfully integrating a new data source into the warehouse without disrupting existing processes or data. Proficiency in SQL, Excel, and data visualization tools (e.g., Looker, Amplitude).
Collaboration:
Description: Ability to work seamlessly with both business and product teams, understanding their unique requirements and delivering tailored insights.
Example: Collaborating with the marketing team to identify key performance indicators (KPIs) and designing a custom dashboard to track these metrics in real-time.
Delivery:
Description: Assumes responsibility for the priorities assigned and ensures tasks are completed end-to-end. If obstacles arise, proactively seeks assistance rather than letting tasks linger incomplete.
Example: When tasked with a critical data analysis project for the sales team, the data analyst encountered issues with data inconsistency. Instead of delaying the report, she collaborated with developers to address the data issues, ensuring the project was completed on time and met the sales team's requirements.
Excellent communication skills ‚Äì ability to present data clearly and concisely.
Fluency in English & Spanish.
Eligibility to work in Spain.
Attention to detail ‚Äì high level of accuracy and commitment to data integrity.
Strong project management and cross-functional collaboration skills.


üéØ Nice-to-Have Requirements


Experience with dbt, Airflow
Fan of generative AI, especially LLMs
Familiarity with BigQuery, Google Cloud or other data warehousing solutions.
Understanding of machine learning techniques and their applications.
Experience in product development, SaaS, or tech industry.



Hiring Process

1Ô∏è‚É£ HR Interview ‚Äì 20 min

2Ô∏è‚É£ Interview with Hiring Manager - 40 min

3Ô∏è‚É£ Challenge

4Ô∏è‚É£ Team Interview & Challenge Discussion ‚Äì 60 min

5Ô∏è‚É£ CEO

Benefits


Hybrid culture or full remote (or both!).
Great company culture, we have a young, upbeat, and international work environment.
Flexible schedule.
Open vacation policy and flexible holidays so you can take time off when you need it.
Training budget üìö üìñ

HTML:
Landbot is the most powerful no-code chatbot builder. Our platform helps thousands of companies convert leads, capture data, and personalize customer journeys in real time.

Our Core Values

üéØ The Role

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our team!! üöÄ

As a Data Analyst, you will play a key role in shaping our product's data strategy, ensuring high-quality data analysis, visualization, and modeling to support data-driven decisions across the company. This position is ideal for someone passionate about data analytics, product insights, and problem-solving in a fast-paced SaaS environment.

üîç Your Main Tasks & Responsibilities

  • Insight Generation & Experimentation:
  • Collaborate with product development teams to ensure the product is correctly instrumented, and that the operational data models allow the exploitation of our data for analytics purposes.
  • Analyze data from various sources to draw insights and support decision-making.
  • Collaborate with business and product teams to identify key metrics and derive actionable insights.
  • Collaborate with product managers in identifying opportunities, formulating hypotheses and validating them via experimentation.
  • Analytics Engineering:
  • Ensure data freshness, integrity and consistency within the data warehouse.
  • Develop & Maintain ELT processes to extract, transform, and load data from various sources into the warehouse.
  • Define and maintain usable reports and metrics, enabling self-service from the stakeholders.
  • Design, develop or help develop visualizations and dashboards tailored to the needs of different teams.
  • Data Activation:
  • Integrate data warehouse with third-party tools to activate the data for marketing, customer success, and/or sales.
  • Ensure the accuracy and timeliness of data feeds to these tools.
  • Promote data literacy and data informedness with stakeholders


üåü What Makes This Role Exciting?

  • Work on end-to-end data flow, influencing key product and business decisions.
  • Gain visibility into all company departments, learning from a variety of business areas.
  • Be part of a fast-growing, international company with a strong tech focus.


üõ† Must-Have Requirements

  • 2-3 years of experience in data analysis within a digital product start-up or SaaS company
  • Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or a related field.
  • Analytical Thinking
    • Description: Ability to break down complex problems or datasets and derive meaningful insights.
    • Example: Identifying trends in user behavior from product data and suggesting actionable strategies for the product team.
  • Technical Proficiency:
    • Description: Proficient in data warehousing technologies, ETL/ELT processes, SQL, Python, git and data visualization tools. Familiar with development tools (CI/CD, version control, testing).
    • Example: Successfully integrating a new data source into the warehouse without disrupting existing processes or data. Proficiency in SQL, Excel, and data visualization tools (e.g., Looker, Amplitude).
  • Collaboration:
    • Description: Ability to work seamlessly with both business and product teams, understanding their unique requirements and delivering tailored insights.
    • Example: Collaborating with the marketing team to identify key performance indicators (KPIs) and designing a custom dashboard to track these metrics in real-time.
  • Delivery:
    • Description: Assumes responsibility for the priorities assigned and ensures tasks are completed end-to-end. If obstacles arise, proactively seeks assistance rather than letting tasks linger incomplete.
    • Example: When tasked with a critical data analysis project for the sales team, the data analyst encountered issues with data inconsistency. Instead of delaying the report, she collaborated with developers to address the data issues, ensuring the project was completed on time and met the sales team's requirements.
  • Excellent communication skills ‚Äì ability to present data clearly and concisely.
  • Fluency in English & Spanish.
  • Eligibility to work in Spain.
  • Attention to detail ‚Äì high level of accuracy and commitment to data integrity.
  • Strong project management and cross-functional collaboration skills.

üéØ Nice-to-Have Requirements

  • Experience with dbt, Airflow
  • Fan of generative AI, especially LLMs
  • Familiarity with BigQuery, Google Cloud or other data warehousing solutions.
  • Understanding of machine learning techniques and their applications.
  • Experience in product development, SaaS, or tech industry.


Hiring Process

1Ô∏è‚É£ HR Interview ‚Äì 20 min

2Ô∏è‚É£ Interview with Hiring Manager - 40 min

3Ô∏è‚É£ Challenge

4Ô∏è‚É£ Team Interview & Challenge Discussion ‚Äì 60 min

5Ô∏è‚É£ CEO

Benefits

  • Hybrid culture or full remote (or both!).
  • Great company culture, we have a young, upbeat, and international work environment.
  • Flexible schedule.
  • Open vacation policy and flexible holidays so you can take time off when you need it.
  • Training budget üìö üìñ
  • Ticket transport üöã
  • üèñ 26 days of paid vacation (23 regular days + December 24th & 31st ) üèñ + One day for your birthday üéÇ
  • English & Spanish lessons üá¨üáß üá™üá∏
  • Flex compensation with Cobee
  • Team building activities üé≥üçªüçï
  • Referral Bonus if you bring other talented people like you.


If you‚Äôre ready to take on the challenge and join an industry-leading tech company, we look forward to your application!

Construcci√≥n, Maquetaci√≥n y Publicaci√≥n de informes para visualizaci√≥n de datos

M√°s de 2 a√±os de experiencia en roles con responsabilidades similares.

Que tengas experiencia con Python.

Que seas una persona con buenas habilidades de comunicaci√≥n, que sepa trabajar en equipo.

Permiso para trabajar en el pa√≠s y dominio del espa√±ol.

Cuentes con alguno/s de estos conocimientos: Power Automate, Power Apps, Data Flows, Machine Learning y/o DevOps.
Te defiendas con el ingl√©s (B2).




¬øQu√© ofrecen? üç¨




Modalidad H√≠brida: 2 d√≠as de teletrabajo y 3 en oficina por semana.

Ticket Restaurant.

Formaci√≥n a demanda en funci√≥n de tu inter√©s/necesidades. Son una compa√±√≠a abierta a sugerencias de formaci√≥n, recursos y tecnolog√≠a. No cuentan con restricciones en este aspecto.
