Caso pr√°ctico: En caso que ambas partes consider√©is que hay encaje, te enviaremos un caso pr√°ctico para que podamos verte en acci√≥nüë©üèª‚Äçüíª.
Entrevista con Ufinet: Si has bordado el caso, agendaremos una entrevista con la compa√±√≠a para que puedas entrevistar a tus potenciales empleadores y para que ellos puedan entrevistarte a ti.
Durante todo el proceso tendr√°s contacto directo con tu Talent Agent para poder resolver cualquier duda o inquietud.

Title: Associate Consultant, September 2025
Description:
Who are we?



We are Analysys Mason ‚Äì an award winning global management consulting firm helping clients to make and act on the decisions that steer their progress and connect our world.



Specialising in technology, telecoms, media and space sectors, we provide bespoke transformation, value creation, transaction, strategy and regulation and policy consulting, combined with research and insights. We help clients navigate complex transformation journeys, always shaping the next.



Since 1985, our team has expanded to 400+ professionals across 16 offices in 12 countries and our experts have taken on work in over 140 countries, making us a truly global company.



Our vision is to be the leading authority and catalyst for digital change, connectivity and inclusion. We are committed to a sustainable, connected future ‚Äì contributing to a world where technology delivers for all.





Job Description



Our graduate opportunities have a strong record of establishing early career foundations and developing well-rounded industry skills in our associate consultants.



You will work on a diverse mix of international projects with the best-known brands in the industry, applying our deep domain expertise and methodology to solve complex business issues.



You will attend our three-week comprehensive training programme where you will learn essential consulting skills and industry knowledge through courses, networking and teamwork.



After completing the training, you will join project teams and provide strategic advice and high-quality analysis on all aspects of strategy planning, transaction support, regulation and transformation while continuing your professional development.



Because our project teams are small, you will regularly get direct exposure to our world-class TMT experts, not only in your office, but also across our global locations. You will receive hands-on mentoring from experienced members of the team, including our Partners.



Our culture is collaborative and team-oriented, and you will have an impact on project delivery from an early stage, which will provide a steep learning curve and a structured career progression.



Your day-to-day responsibilities will include:



conducting high-quality research
offering quantitative and qualitative analysis of that research
gathering and interpreting numerical data
modelling and forecasting using various pieces of software
presenting your main findings in written, graphical and live form
contributing to proposal creation and client meetings
collaborating with other teams across our global locations
developing deep sector knowledge
and more.


Qualifications



If you are a problem-solver who is critical and analytical in your approach, then this is the right job for you.



You must have graduated by September 2025, or earlier, and you must have a degree from any academic background (including STEM, Humanities and others).



You must enjoy working with numbers as we are a quantitative data-driven business.



As long as you are keen to learn about the sector, you do not need to have a TMT background. As a matter of fact, many of our consultants only became TMT experts after joining us.



You must be fluent in English and Spanish.





Additional Information



On top of an exciting opportunity, we offer many attractive benefits, including:



an annual bonus
private health and dental care
flexible working
your birthday off
2 promotion cycles a year
stepped career progression
continuous training for professional and personal development
career coaching programmes
volunteering days.

We are proud to be an equal-opportunities employer and ensure fair work practices for all our employees, clients, candidates and other associated persons.







Our values



Excellence | We are passionate and aspire to be the industry benchmark.



Partnership | We are one team, and we inspire, motivate and coach each other.



Innovation | We are problem-solvers, and we do not share away from a challenge.



Integrity | We treat people with dignity and respect.



Empowerment | We motivate, inspire and train our people to be the best they can be.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you looking for the next challenge in your career? Would you like to be part of an exciting, highly qualified team of professionals in an international environment?




We are currently looking for a qualified Data Analyst.




Join an international division and work alongside some of the most talented engineers and technicians from all over the world.




Your benefits:

Competitive Salary.
Long-term secure contract.
International Project with top technologies.
Possibility of working remotely with a flexible schedule.
Integration in a highly qualified team of professionals.
Travel abroad with your project.
Specialized training and continuous professional development.
Social benefits and flexible compensation plan.




Responsibilities:




Analyze and interpret complex data sets to identify trends, patterns, and insights.
Develop and maintain data models, reports, and dashboards to support business decision-making.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand their data needs and provide actionable insights.
Ensure data quality and integrity by performing regular data validation and cleansing.
Stay up-to-date with the latest data analysis tools and techniques to continuously improve our data analytics capabilities.
Participate in the deployment of data solutions, all the way to production.
Ensure the quality of data analysis and reporting based on transparent metrics.
Act as a technical leader for data analysis, assisting and leading more junior analysts.




Requirements:




Minimum 3-5 years of experience in data analysis.
Proficiency in Python, SQL, and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Experience with CI/CD pipelines and working with Gitlab.
Experience working with Docker, Kubernetes, and microservices architectures is a plus.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.




We positively value all work or study experience abroad.

All positions require a high level of English (at least B2) - please send your detailed CV in English.

Title: Data Analyst (Engineer)
Description:
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, and more freedom. Since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. Our powerhouse of products ‚Äî including spending, saving, investing, exchanging, travelling, and more ‚Äî help our 50+ million customers get more from their money every day.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‚Äå 2 things are essential to our success: our people and our culture. In recognition of our outstanding employee experience, we've been certified as a Great Place to Work‚Ñ¢. So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our offices and remotely, to help us achieve our mission. And we're looking for more brilliant people. People who love building great products, redefining success, and turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

We approach data science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. Our Data Analysts aren‚Äôt kept in the background, doomed to never see the impact of their work. They‚Äôre some of our best and brightest problem solvers, deployed to the front-lines to work in product teams and deliver rock star solutions.

We‚Äôre looking for a Data Analyst who can dig into our complex databases, look for the root cause of a problem, and design their own solutions by writing code to implement them.

This is an opportunity to apply your skills while picking up new ones and delivering value for millions of customers around the world.

Up to shape the future of finance? Let's get in touch.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing


Understanding our business and its processes through data
Applying this understanding and knowledge of data to help product and services teams
Developing documentation and data governance
Owning the entire ETL process
Designing key metrics to measure different aspects of the business
Creating and maintaining new aggregated views and tables to simplify data querying
Providing clean data sets, modelling data in a way that empowers end users to answer their own questions


What You'll Need


5+ years of experience in an analytical role, creating impactful data-driven solutions
Excellent background/education in a quantitative discipline
Great skills with Python, SQL, or other programming languages
Evidence of exceptional mathematical and statistics knowledge


Nice to have


An advanced degree in a core STEM subject
Solid experience with additional programming languages (Java, Scala, C++, etc.)
School/university Olympic medal competitions in physics, maths, economics, or programming


Building a global financial super app isn‚Äôt enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that‚Äôs why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We‚Äôre doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That‚Äôs why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Important notice for candidates:

Job scams are on the rise. Please keep these guidelines in mind when applying for any open roles.


Only apply through official Revolut channels. We don‚Äôt use any third-party services or platforms for our recruitment.
Always double-check the emails you receive. Make sure all communications are being done through official Revolut emails, with an @revolut.com domain.


We won't ask for payment or personal financial information during the hiring process. If anyone does ask you for this, it‚Äôs a scam. Report it immediately.

By submitting this application, I confirm that all the information given by me in this application for employment and any additional documents attached hereto are true to the best of my knowledge and that I have not wilfully suppressed any material fact. I confirm I have disclosed if applicable any previous employment with Revolut. I accept that if any of the information given by me in this application is in any way false or incorrect, my application may be rejected, any offer of employment may be withdrawn or my employment with Revolut may be terminated summarily or I may be dismissed. By submitting this application, I agree that my personal data will be processed in accordance with Revolut's <a class="postings-link" href="https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Candidate Privacy Notice

Title: Marketing Data Analyst (Remote)
Description:
We're looking for a Marketing Data Analyst who is passionate about their work, adapts easily, and shares our company values!

A Little Bit About Us

Leadtech has been fostering and developing innovative digital businesses across several industries since 2009. It has since then expanded to a team of over 500 committed employees working all over Spain. We are thrilled to have more than 23 nationalities working together and very proud to see that our products and services are enjoyed by millions of users monthly around the globe.

How you will make a difference:


Measure the performance of marketing campaigns, build ad hoc custom reports, and analyze anomalies and trends
Preparation of analytical reports and dashboards (including visualization) for the marketing team
Creation of Google Sheets scripts to connect data from different reports and Google Sheets
High experience and skill level in Microsoft Excel / Google Sheets
Analysis of product & marketing metrics correlation and identification of their drivers
Analysis and identification of user behavior patterns based on product & marketing analytics and forming hypotheses for the marketing team based on these insights
Develop the SKAN measurement approach for Google, Meta and Tiktok
Deeply understand the process of acquisition of users in order to analyze/provide valuable proposals
Manage MMP Tools (Adjust), and provide technical support and troubleshooting for the marketing team, specifically related to app attribution, event tracking, and callback implementations
Analyze performance impact of any product and marketing strategy changes
Cooperate with Marketing and Product teams to actively increase project profitability
Collaborate with the BI department to create and maintain data visualization dashboards



Requirements


Bachelor degree in STEM field or similar
Experience working as Analyst of at least 3 years
Strong knowledge of app attribution tools commonly used in the mobile advertising industry
Strong knowledge of machine learning and statistics techniques
Strong communication skills and the ability to translate technical findings into clear business recommendations
In-depth understanding of digital marketing strategies including down funnel analysis, as well technical knowledge of iOS and Android marketing analysis to tailor strategies for both platforms
Experience working with data visualization tools
Experience with setting up and managing event tracking in mobile apps. Especially with a focus on SKAN, Firebase, Meta etc
Teamwork and collaboration skills to work closely with other data professionals and cross-functional teams
Proactive attitude and results-oriented



Benefits

Perks of being one of us


Full-time, permanent contract
Flexible time off, no blackout dates, plus your birthday, Christmas' Eve and New Year's Eve off
Remote work
Flextime (7 - 9:30 a.m. / 3:30 - 7:30 p.m)
Free Friday afternoons (a 7-hour workday!) + 35-hour week in July and August (free afternoons here we come!)
Enhanced career path designed just for you
External training budget
We celebrate all company landmarks


Sounds good? Apply now! We're looking forward to getting to know you.

Equal Employment Opportunity Employer

Leadtech is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer, which means we encourage applications from people with different backgrounds, interests, and personal circumstances. Our team welcomes applicants regardless of their race, gender, age, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expressi√≥n and/or disabilities. All we need is your high energy, skills, and willingness to be a part of a great project!

Location

You'll have the flexibility to choose whether you'd like to come to the office every day, from time to time, or work fully remote. We want you to find the best combination for you.

If you prefer to be surrounded with amazing people, our exceptional office is in Barcelona's Blue Building, located right on the city's seafront. Besides our stunning views, you'll enjoy our office perks such as free fruit, snacks, and coffee and you'll also be able to take part in our Mario Kart and table tennis competitions.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Veeva Systems is a mission-driven organization and pioneer in industry cloud, helping life sciences companies bring therapies to patients faster. As one of the fastest-growing SaaS companies in history, we surpassed $2B in revenue in our last fiscal year with extensive growth potential ahead.

At the heart of Veeva are our values: Do the Right Thing, Customer Success, Employee Success, and Speed. We're not just any public company ‚Äì we made history in 2021 by becoming a public benefit corporation (PBC), legally bound to balancing the interests of customers, employees, society, and investors.

As a Work Anywhere company, we support your flexibility to work from home or in the office, so you can thrive in your ideal environment.

Join us in transforming the life sciences industry, committed to making a positive impact on its customers, employees, and communities.

The Role

Veeva Link‚Äôs vision is to become the global leader for deep data in life sciences. We are looking for a detail-oriented and experienced Data Analyst to join our product team.

In this role, you will play a key part in developing and implementing a data governance framework, ensuring data accuracy, completeness, and integrity. Your main responsibilities include establishing data quality monitoring processes, identifying root causes of inconsistencies, and collaborating with cross-functional teams to resolve data gaps.

To thrive in this role, you need expertise in SQL and Python for data manipulation and automation. You should be comfortable working with large datasets, designing dashboards with actionable recommendations, and applying statistical techniques to assess and enhance data quality.

The ideal candidate has experience in creating documentation (process documentation, data collection guidelines) and in contributing to data governance policies and best practices.

What You'll Do


Implement a data governance framework
Establish and maintain robust processes for tracking and assessing data quality
Develop automated checks to proactively detect data inconsistencies
Apply statistical techniques to enhance data quality
Create customized reports and dashboards
Extract data from databases (e.g., Redshift, MongoDB)
Identify and resolve root causes of quality issues
Collaborate in cross-functional teams of product managers, engineering, and operations
Create and maintain documentation


Requirements


3+ years of work experience in data analysis or data quality role
Strong technical skills in data analysis, with proficiency in SQL and Python
Experience in data storage and processing on cloud platforms such as AWS, GCP, or Azure
Strong problem-solving skills and experience working with cross-functional teams
Experience writing process documentation and data collection guidelines


Nice to Have


University degree in medicine or life sciences
Understanding of healthcare, life sciences, or pharmaceutical industry data
Experience with data visualization tools to create dashboards and reports
Understanding of data engineering concepts (ETL, data pipelines)
Experience with workflow automation tools such as Apache Airflow
Experience working in an Agile or product-driven environment
Familiarity with data privacy and compliance regulations (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA)


Perks & Benefits


1% charitable giving program
Medical private insurance
Private pension plan
Life insurance
Fitness reimbursement


#RemoteSpain

Veeva‚Äôs headquarters is located in the San Francisco Bay Area with offices in more than 15 countries around the world.

As an equal opportunity employer, Veeva is committed to fostering a culture of inclusion and growing a diverse workforce. Diversity makes us stronger. It comes in many forms. Gender, race, ethnicity, religion, politics, sexual orientation, age, disability and life experience shape us all into unique individuals. We value people for the individuals they are and the contributions they can bring to our teams.

If you need assistance or accommodation due to a disability or special need when applying for a role or in our recruitment process, please contact us at talent_accommodations@veeva.com.

Title: Associate Consultant, September 2025
Description:
Who are we?



We are Analysys Mason ‚Äì an award winning global management consulting firm helping clients to make and act on the decisions that steer their progress and connect our world.



Specialising in technology, telecoms, media and space sectors, we provide bespoke transformation, value creation, transaction, strategy and regulation and policy consulting, combined with research and insights. We help clients navigate complex transformation journeys, always shaping the next.



Since 1985, our team has expanded to 400+ professionals across 16 offices in 12 countries and our experts have taken on work in over 140 countries, making us a truly global company.



Our vision is to be the leading authority and catalyst for digital change, connectivity and inclusion. We are committed to a sustainable, connected future ‚Äì contributing to a world where technology delivers for all.





Job Description



Our graduate opportunities have a strong record of establishing early career foundations and developing well-rounded industry skills in our associate consultants.



You will work on a diverse mix of international projects with the best-known brands in the industry, applying our deep domain expertise and methodology to solve complex business issues.



You will attend our three-week comprehensive training programme where you will learn essential consulting skills and industry knowledge through courses, networking and teamwork.



After completing the training, you will join project teams and provide strategic advice and high-quality analysis on all aspects of strategy planning, transaction support, regulation and transformation while continuing your professional development.



Because our project teams are small, you will regularly get direct exposure to our world-class TMT experts, not only in your office, but also across our global locations. You will receive hands-on mentoring from experienced members of the team, including our Partners.



Our culture is collaborative and team-oriented, and you will have an impact on project delivery from an early stage, which will provide a steep learning curve and a structured career progression.



Your day-to-day responsibilities will include:



conducting high-quality research
offering quantitative and qualitative analysis of that research
gathering and interpreting numerical data
modelling and forecasting using various pieces of software
presenting your main findings in written, graphical and live form
contributing to proposal creation and client meetings
collaborating with other teams across our global locations
developing deep sector knowledge
and more.


Qualifications



If you are a problem-solver who is critical and analytical in your approach, then this is the right job for you.



You must have graduated by September 2025, or earlier, and you must have a degree from any academic background (including STEM, Humanities and others).



You must enjoy working with numbers as we are a quantitative data-driven business.



As long as you are keen to learn about the sector, you do not need to have a TMT background. As a matter of fact, many of our consultants only became TMT experts after joining us.



You must be fluent in English and Spanish.





Additional Information



On top of an exciting opportunity, we offer many attractive benefits, including:



an annual bonus
private health and dental care
flexible working
your birthday off
2 promotion cycles a year
stepped career progression
continuous training for professional and personal development
career coaching programmes
volunteering days.

We are proud to be an equal-opportunities employer and ensure fair work practices for all our employees, clients, candidates and other associated persons.







Our values



Excellence | We are passionate and aspire to be the industry benchmark.



Partnership | We are one team, and we inspire, motivate and coach each other.



Innovation | We are problem-solvers, and we do not share away from a challenge.



Integrity | We treat people with dignity and respect.



Empowerment | We motivate, inspire and train our people to be the best they can be.

Title: Analyst, Analytics & Insights Delivery
Description:
Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose ‚Äì to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.



Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.





Job Description



The Global Business Optimisation team has a simple mission: we turn massive amounts of data into actionable insights that drive business value. Our analytic consultants and data analysts work with Visa‚Äôs clients, partners, and staff to improve portfolio performance, program profitability, and cardholder experiences. By coupling in-depth analysis of cardholder behaviour with Visa‚Äôs world-class products, digital offerings, and marketing capabilities, we ensure our clients‚Äô programs operate at their peak potential and that cardholders have seamless commerce experiences in both the physical and digital world.



As part of the Client Services organisation, this role will take ownership of this vision and deliver with excellence for our organisation and our clients. The successful candidate will use strong big data and analytical skills, contextual business sense, and a creative flair to solve real-world business challenges for Visa issuing banks, acquirers, merchants, and processors. In addition, your analytic expertise will directly impact the strategic direction of the organisation and how we deliver value from our data assets.



The successful candidate will be a key member in Global Business Optimisation, within Client Services, supporting all aspects of improving and optimising payment success, including but not exclusive to authentication and authorisation. Responsible for building and deploying a single source of truth on insights, facts, and reporting related to the Visa Europe Regions payment processing.



Responsibilities



Assist other team members in deriving analytic insights on client performance and deliver findings to external and internal stakeholders, by proactively advising on how to improve performance.
Formulate and source necessary datasets from internal tools and platforms, rendering insights in compelling presentations and visualizations.
Create and present analytic deliverables to external Visa clients, colleagues in the analytics team, and other internal stakeholders with varying degrees of analytical and technical expertise.
Develop specific knowledge on authentication and/or authorisation, with active monitoring and client meetings to help them improve and optimise performance.
Identify and understand the root cause of problems, define analytical objectives, and formalise data requirements for various types of analyses.
Combine and analyse disparate data sources and derive insights in a Big Data environment.
Work with a pan-European team located in multiple locations and contribute to global projects.
Proactively facilitate the overall analytic delivery strategy for the organisation.
Compare client performance against industry best practices to identify performance and/or profitability improvement opportunities.
Present complex data and content to clients in an accurate, understandable, and engaging manner, considering stakeholders' varying degrees of analytical and technical expertise by translating analysis and insights into stakeholder & client language.

This is a hybrid position. Expectation of days in office will be confirmed by your hiring manager.





Qualifications



2+ years of working experience in a corporate environment.
Visa experience or knowledge of the payments industry is highly preferable.
Knowledge of the Authorisation/ Authentication process is highly preferable.
Strong verbal, written, and interpersonal skills required.
Proven client presentation skills.
Proactive, curious, problem solver with experience of being a self-starter and a willingness to learn.
Experience working in data analysis and/or insight delivery with a proven record of creating business value from data.
Basic level of manipulating data from a variety of sources - Big data skills (Hadoop, Hive, Spark) and/or SQL skills is an advantage.
Experience visualizing data with tools such as Tableau or Power BI.
Must be proficient in all MS Office applications with advanced Excel spreadsheet skills.
Excellent spoken and written command of English.
Knowledge of additional European language(s) is an advantage.





Additional Information



Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

Visa is an EEO Employer. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Nexthink is the leader in digital employee experience management software. The company provides IT leaders with unprecedented insight allowing them to see, diagnose and fix issues at scale impacting employees anywhere, with any application or network, before employees notice the issue. As the first solution to allow IT to progress from reactive problem solving to proactive optimization, Nexthink enables its more than 1,200 customers to provide better digital experiences to more than 15 million employees. Dual headquartered in Lausanne, Switzerland and Boston, Massachusetts, Nexthink has 9 offices worldwide.

Job Description

We are seeking a highly analytical and data-driven Data Analyst to join our team. In this role, you will transform raw data into actionable insights, helping optimize operational efficiency and support decision-making processes. You should be passionate about metrics, monitoring, and automation‚Äîalways looking for ways to improve efficiency through data.

Key Responsibilities

Data Collection & Processing


Gather and integrate data from multiple sources into complex models.
Ensure data accuracy, completeness, and consistency through validation and cleansing.
Automate data extraction and transformation processes to enhance efficiency.


Data Analysis & Visualization


Conduct in-depth analysis to identify trends, patterns, and correlations.
Apply statistical and predictive modeling techniques to generate insights and forecasts.
Develop interactive Power BI dashboards and reports for clear, impactful data communication.


Performance Monitoring & Reporting


Track key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics.
Generate regular performance reports to highlight progress and opportunities for improvement.
Optimize Power BI reports for scalability and sustainability across large datasets.


Cross-Functional Collaboration


Work closely with different teams to deliver data-driven solutions.
Participate in interdisciplinary projects requiring analytics and actionable insights.
Act as a subject matter expert in data analytics, supporting and guiding colleagues.


Qualifications


Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel & Power BI, including:
Report development
Data modeling & dataflows
DAX calculations & Power Query
Experience creating interactive Power BI reports from multiple data sources.
Knowledge of Microsoft Fabric (preferred).
Data & metrics-driven mindset ‚Äì comfortable with both qualitative and quantitative analysis.
Strong analytical background, capable of working in ambiguous situations.
Strong business communication skills, with the ability to write compelling proposals.
Fluency in English (additional languages are a plus).


If you are a proactive, results-oriented data analyst with a passion for transforming data into strategic insights, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!

Additional Information

We are the pioneers and trailblazers of a global IT Market Category (DEX) that is shaping the future of how the world works, giving our customers‚Äô IT Teams total digital visibility across their enterprise. Our innovative solutions integrate real-time analytics, automation, and employee feedback across all endpoints. This enables our IT teams to solve complex technical challenges, create ever more productive workplaces, and deliver happy, satisfied employees in the digital workplace.

With over 1000 employees across 5 continents, Nexthink operates as One Team, connecting, collaborating and innovating to continuously grow. We call our employees ‚ÄòNexthinkers‚Äô and our commitment to diversity, inclusion, and equity is second to none. We currently have over 75 nationalities working with us, from all cultures and backgrounds, speaking many different languages.

If you are looking for a change and like a nice atmosphere, lots of challenges, and having fun while working, this is a great opportunity for you! Check what we offer:


üíº Permanent Contract and a competitive compensation package (Stock Options also included).
üìç Amazing centrally located offices near the Bernabeu Stadium.
ü©∫ Private Health Insurance (Sanitas) and daily meal vouchers of 11 EUR will be entirely covered by us.
üè° Hybrid work model balancing office and remote work, with a structured approach for new hires to foster connections and onboarding.
üèñÔ∏è Flexible Hours and unlimited vacation (employees have unlimited paid time off on top of the 23 days of holidays we offer) plus 3 company-paid volunteer days.
ü§∏ Up to 25 EUR per month for a gym subscription.
üõ¥ Flexible retribution plan for kindergarten & transport tickets.
üßë‚Äçüè´ Reimbursement of up to 50% of the cost of English & Spanish classes.
üçâ Fresh fruit, cookies, soft drinks and protein shakes at the office.
üçï Regular company and team events like Pizza talks, Team Building activities, Christmas parties, hosting Meetups at the office and more!
üì£ Bonuses for referring successful hires after three months of continuous employment.
üöö We offer a relocation package to people who are coming from another country.


Please note that not all the benefits listed above are available for temporary, contract, and internship roles. To ensure you have the most up-to-date information, we recommend checking with your Recruitment Partner.

  • Knowledge of Microsoft Fabric (preferred).
  • Data & metrics-driven mindset ‚Äì comfortable with both qualitative and quantitative analysis.
  • Strong analytical background, capable of working in ambiguous situations.
  • Strong business communication skills, with the ability to write compelling proposals.
  • Fluency in English (additional languages are a plus).

If you are a proactive, results-oriented data analyst with a passion for transforming data into strategic insights, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!

Additional Information

We are the pioneers and trailblazers of a global IT Market Category (DEX) that is shaping the future of how the world works, giving our customers‚Äô IT Teams total digital visibility across their enterprise. Our innovative solutions integrate real-time analytics, automation, and employee feedback across all endpoints. This enables our IT teams to solve complex technical challenges, create ever more productive workplaces, and deliver happy, satisfied employees in the digital workplace.

With over 1000 employees across 5 continents, Nexthink operates as One Team, connecting, collaborating and innovating to continuously grow. We call our employees ‚ÄòNexthinkers‚Äô and our commitment to diversity, inclusion, and equity is second to none. We currently have over 75 nationalities working with us, from all cultures and backgrounds, speaking many different languages.

If you are looking for a change and like a nice atmosphere, lots of challenges, and having fun while working, this is a great opportunity for you! Check what we offer:

  • üíº Permanent Contract and a competitive compensation package (Stock Options also included).
  • üìç Amazing centrally located offices near the Bernabeu Stadium.
  • ü©∫ Private Health Insurance (Sanitas) and daily meal vouchers of 11 EUR will be entirely covered by us.
  • üè° Hybrid work model balancing office and remote work, with a structured approach for new hires to foster connections and onboarding.
  • üèñÔ∏è Flexible Hours and unlimited vacation (employees have unlimited paid time off on top of the 23 days of holidays we offer) plus 3 company-paid volunteer days.
  • ü§∏ Up to 25 EUR per month for a gym subscription.
  • üõ¥ Flexible retribution plan for kindergarten & transport tickets.
  • üßë‚Äçüè´ Reimbursement of up to 50% of the cost of English & Spanish classes.
  • üçâ Fresh fruit, cookies, soft drinks and protein shakes at the office.
  • üçï Regular company and team events like Pizza talks, Team Building activities, Christmas parties, hosting Meetups at the office and more!
  • üì£ Bonuses for referring successful hires after three months of continuous employment.
  • üöö We offer a relocation package to people who are coming from another country.

Please note that not all the benefits listed above are available for temporary, contract, and internship roles. To ensure you have the most up-to-date information, we recommend checking with your Recruitment Partner.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description



We‚Äôre looking for a Data Analyst to join our team in Madrid and help shape the future of contextual advertising as we continue to expand globally.

Who We Are
At Seedtag, we lead the way in contextual advertising with our machine learning-powered platform. Our technology provides superior brand safety, human-like content understanding, and advanced cookieless targeting, making ads more engaging and respectful. Founded by two ex-Googlers in 2014, we‚Äôve grown to over 600 Seedtaggers across 18 countries, raising ‚Ç¨250M to revolutionize digital advertising.

Your Challenge

You will propose a new analysis to get the most out of our current data and define what additional data will be needed to improve our current Contextual Understanding.
Your data visualization skills will be key to grasping the attention of the public and transmitting complex information into simple explanations.
You will get full ownership of our contextual data to offer insights and communication strategies to our most relevant clients.
You will present your results internally and externally, co-creating contextual strategies with big clients (from Nissan to Coca-Cola, Heineken, Tag Heuer, etc).
You will help us build contextual tools that would allow the democratization of data inside the company: from sales to marketing to operations, the different teams should be using contextual data in their day-to-day.
Some experience building extract, transform, load (ETL) data pipelines will be needed here.
You will analyze the performance of our current Contextual products and actively propose improvements together with the Product Team.
Finally, you will build a strong knowledge of the ecosystem and sector to develop a strong instinct of how to improve our products and positioning. Creativity here will also be a must!
During all these tasks, you will be using the latest technologies developed by our Machine Learning Engineers: amazing NLP and CV models to get the most out of massive amounts of data!

What You‚Äôll Need to Succeed
You have a relevant degree in engineering, mathematics, statistics or an analytics-related field.
You have between 1 and 3 years of work experience in Data Analysis or a related field.
You are proficient in SQL and Python: data treatment and data visualizations are a must.
You have an analytical mind capable of structuring complex problems into simple, iterative solutions.
You have full proficiency in Spanish and English.
You are energetic, proactive and eager to work in a dynamic environment.
You are a real team player with good communication and cooperation skills.
You have proven ability to work in a fast-paced, informal, dynamic and exigent environment.
You like to have fun while working and don‚Äôt take yourself too serious!
It would be a big plus if you
Have previous experience in a startup or have a background in consulting.
Have previous experience in presenting and communicating data analysis results and insights to external stakeholders.

Why Join Seedtag?
Growth & Opportunity: A key moment to join with vast career development prospects.
Flexibility: At Seedtag, we trust you to balance work and life effortlessly with the option to work from home, the office, or even the beach in our hybrid mode.
Learning & Development: Online courses in ODILO and optional English or Spanish group classes.
Inclusive Culture: We foster a supportive environment that values personal growth.
Fun & Connection: Participate in team activities, company off-sites, and more!

Additional Perks
Flexible benefits plan: Restaurant, transportation, and kindergarten vouchers.
Health insurance: Comprehensive coverage is included.
Gympass: Access to wellness programs and fitness classes.
Seedsave Program: Exclusive discounts to help you save for the future.

Ready to join the Seedtag adventure? Send us your CV, and let‚Äôs grow together!

At Seedtag, we‚Äôre committed to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive. We welcome diverse perspectives as they fuel our innovation and growth. Please let us know if you require accommodations during the hiring process, and we‚Äôll ensure a positive and accessible experience.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Wood Mackenzie is the global data and analytics business for the renewables, energy, and natural resources industries. Enhanced by technology. Enriched by human intelligence. In an ever-changing world, companies and governments need reliable and actionable insight to lead the transition to a sustainable future. That‚Äôs why we cover the entire supply chain with unparalleled breadth and depth, backed by over 50 years‚Äô experience. Our team of over 2,400 experts, operating across 30 global locations, are enabling customers‚Äô decisions through real-time analytics, consultancy, events and thought leadership. Together, we deliver the insight they need to separate risk from opportunity and make confident decisions when it matters most.

WoodMac.com

Wood Mackenzie Brand Video

Wood Mackenzie Values


Inclusive ‚Äì we succeed together
Trusting ‚Äì we choose to trust each other
Customer committed ‚Äì we put customers at the heart of our decisions
Future Focused ‚Äì we accelerate change
Curious ‚Äì we turn knowledge into action


Job Description

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join Wood Mackenzie‚Äôs Power and Renewables Data team.

This role will focus on the analysis, programmatic acquisition, and preparation of data for delivery to our customers and research teams.

Wood Mackenzie Produces Research And Data That The Energy Industry Relies On To Understand And Navigate The Energy Transition. Examples Of Products That You Will Contribute To Include


Power supply and demand long-term outlooks
Power market pricing history and long-term outlooks
Renewable technology supplier leaderboards


Responsibilities


Own the quality and delivery timeline of critical datasets
Obtain, transform, and deliver information from our databases to support industry analysis using Excel, PowerQuery, PowerBI, GraphQL, SQL, Sisense, Python, and Snowflake
Create and maintain workflows for internal stakeholders
Create and maintain data pipelines to feed customer facing products
Identify and assess opportunities for optimization of our systems, processes, and datasets
Monitor and resolve alerts in production environments to preserve the integrity of our products
Identify internal and external sources of data that will support customer needs
Collaborate with colleagues across multiple time zones and disciplines to uncover pain points, process improvements, and product requirements


About You


At least 2 years of experience in a data analyst or data engineering role
Experience working in environments reliant on SQL, Python, and Snowflake
Experience with ETL processes and APIs for data integration
Hands on approach to problem solving that delves into the details while maintaining the ability to succinctly propose solutions to steer management decisions
Independently completes projects given time and platform constraints
Desire to play a key role in the energy transition by delivering the data and research that catalyzes progress
Intellectual curiosity about the provenance of data and journey it makes to arrive at a destination
Passionate ownership of projects and excitement to share accomplishments with fellow Woodmackers
Preferred: Experience in the energy industry or power modelling domain
Fluent in English. Bonus language skills: Mandarin, Spanish


Equal Opportunities

We are an equal opportunities employer. This means we are committed to recruiting the best people regardless of their race, colour, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. You can find out more about your rights under the law at www.eeoc.gov

Wood Mackenzie is the global data and analytics business for the renewables, energy, and natural resources industries. Enhanced by technology. Enriched by human intelligence. In an ever-changing world, companies and governments need reliable and actionable insight to lead the transition to a sustainable future. That‚Äôs why we cover the entire supply chain with unparalleled breadth and depth, backed by over 50 years‚Äô experience. Our team of over 2,400 experts, operating across 30 global locations, are enabling customers‚Äô decisions through real-time analytics, consultancy, events and thought leadership. Together, we deliver the insight they need to separate risk from opportunity and make confident decisions when it matters most.

WoodMac.com

Wood Mackenzie Brand Video

Wood Mackenzie Values

  • Inclusive ‚Äì we succeed together
  • Trusting ‚Äì we choose to trust each other
  • Customer committed ‚Äì we put customers at the heart of our decisions
  • Future Focused ‚Äì we accelerate change
  • Curious ‚Äì we turn knowledge into action

Job Description

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join Wood Mackenzie‚Äôs Power and Renewables Data team.

This role will focus on the analysis, programmatic acquisition, and preparation of data for delivery to our customers and research teams.

Wood Mackenzie Produces Research And Data That The Energy Industry Relies On To Understand And Navigate The Energy Transition. Examples Of Products That You Will Contribute To Include

  • Power supply and demand long-term outlooks
  • Power market pricing history and long-term outlooks
  • Renewable technology supplier leaderboards

Responsibilities

  • Own the quality and delivery timeline of critical datasets
  • Obtain, transform, and deliver information from our databases to support industry analysis using Excel, PowerQuery, PowerBI, GraphQL, SQL, Sisense, Python, and Snowflake
  • Create and maintain workflows for internal stakeholders
  • Create and maintain data pipelines to feed customer facing products
  • Identify and assess opportunities for optimization of our systems, processes, and datasets
  • Monitor and resolve alerts in production environments to preserve the integrity of our products
  • Identify internal and external sources of data that will support customer needs
  • Collaborate with colleagues across multiple time zones and disciplines to uncover pain points, process improvements, and product requirements

About You

  • At least 2 years of experience in a data analyst or data engineering role
  • Experience working in environments reliant on SQL, Python, and Snowflake
  • Experience with ETL processes and APIs for data integration
  • Hands on approach to problem solving that delves into the details while maintaining the ability to succinctly propose solutions to steer management decisions
  • Independently completes projects given time and platform constraints
  • Desire to play a key role in the energy transition by delivering the data and research that catalyzes progress
  • Intellectual curiosity about the provenance of data and journey it makes to arrive at a destination
  • Passionate ownership of projects and excitement to share accomplishments with fellow Woodmackers
  • Preferred: Experience in the energy industry or power modelling domain
  • Fluent in English. Bonus language skills: Mandarin, Spanish

Equal Opportunities

We are an equal opportunities employer. This means we are committed to recruiting the best people regardless of their race, colour, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. You can find out more about your rights under the law at www.eeoc.gov

If you are applying for a role and have a physical or mental disability, we will support you with your application or through the hiring process.

Title: Data Analyst/ Data Management
Description:
Job Summary

We are seeking a highly skilled Data Analyst/ Data Management professional with 8 to 11 years of experience. The ideal candidate will have expertise in Azure Conversational Language AWS CodePipeline AWS CodeDeploy AWS CodeCommit and AWS CodeBuild. This hybrid role requires a strong technical background and the ability to manage data effectively. The position operates during the day shift and does not require travel.

Responsibilities


Analyze and interpret complex data sets to identify patterns and trends.
Develop and maintain data management systems to ensure data integrity and security.
Utilize Azure Conversational Language to enhance data processing and analysis.
Implement and manage AWS CodePipeline for continuous integration and delivery.
Oversee AWS CodeDeploy to automate application deployments.
Manage AWS CodeCommit repositories to ensure efficient version control.
Utilize AWS CodeBuild to automate the build process.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather and analyze data requirements.
Provide insights and recommendations based on data analysis to support business decisions.
Ensure data quality and consistency across various data sources.
Create and maintain documentation for data management processes and procedures.
Monitor data management systems to identify and resolve issues promptly.
Stay updated with the latest industry trends and technologies to improve data management practices.


Qualifications


Possess strong analytical skills and attention to detail.
Demonstrate proficiency in Azure Conversational Language.
Have hands-on experience with AWS CodePipeline AWS CodeDeploy AWS CodeCommit and AWS CodeBuild.
Exhibit excellent problem-solving abilities.
Show strong communication and collaboration skills.
Have a solid understanding of data management principles.
Be able to work independently and as part of a team.
Display a proactive approach to identifying and addressing data-related issues.
Hold a relevant certification in AWS or Azure technologies.
Demonstrate the ability to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously.
Show a commitment to continuous learning and professional development.
Have a strong understanding of data security and privacy regulations.
Be able to adapt to a hybrid work model and manage time effectively.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Who We Are

Cint is a pioneer in research technology (ResTech). Our customers use the Cint platform to post questions and get answers from real people to build business strategies, confidently publish research, accurately measure the impact of digital advertising, and more. The Cint platform is built on a programmatic marketplace, which is the world‚Äôs largest, with nearly 300 million respondents in over 150 countries who consent to sharing their opinions, motivations, and behaviours.

We are feeding the world‚Äôs curiosity!

Job Description

We are looking for a Data Analyst to support our Data Science & Analytics team in delivering high-quality insights through data exploration, analysis, and reporting. The ideal candidate is a self-starter, comfortable working with large datasets, automating processes, and supporting internal stakeholders with data-driven recommendations.

Responsibilities


Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights, ensuring quality and reliability of results.
Respond to ad hoc client-specific requests including performing analyses, data manipulation and producing summary results.
Generate reports and visualizations to effectively communicate findings to stakeholders to support decision making
Support campaign performance analysis and contribute to benchmark development and optimization.
Design scripts and tools to automate and streamline data extraction processes using Python, SQL, and APIs.
Develop interactive dashboards and reporting tools (such as Power BI, Tableau, Streamlit) to provide a clear overview of key metrics and insights.
Collaborate with stakeholders to enhance data collection processes.


Qualifications

Required:


Master‚Äôs degree or Bachelors in a quantitative field (e.g., Data Analytics, Statistics, Mathematics or a related discipline).
1-2 year(s) of experience in a data analysis role, preferably in market research, or advertising analytics.
Proficiency in Python (especially pandas and NumPy) for data manipulation.
Strong experience with MS Excel for analysis and reporting.
Experience working with large datasets and performing complex data transformations.
Strong analytical skills with a focus on data validation and accuracy.
Excellent communication skills to present findings and collaborate with internal teams and customers.
Self-starter with ability to work independently.


Additional Information

Nice to Have:


Experience in media measurement analytics.
Ability to write and optimize SQL queries.
Familiarity with Streamlit, Power BI, or Tableau for dashboarding.
Understanding of Databricks or similar cloud-based analytics platforms.


Our Values

Collaboration is our superpower


We uncover rich perspectives across the world
Success happens together
We deliver across borders.


Innovation is in our blood


We‚Äôre pioneers in our industry
Our curiosity is insatiable
We bring the best ideas to life.


We Do What We Say


We‚Äôre accountable for our work and actions
Excellence comes as standard
We‚Äôre open, honest and kind, always.


We are caring


We learn from each other‚Äôs experiences
Stop and listen; every opinion matters
We embrace diversity, equity and inclusion.


More About Cint

In June 2021, Cint acquired Berlin-based GapFish ‚Äì the world‚Äôs largest ISO certified online panel community in the DACH region ‚Äì and in January 2022, completed the acquisition of US-based Lucid ‚Äì a programmatic research technology platform that provides access to first-party survey data in over 110 countries.

Cint Group AB (publ), listed on Nasdaq Stockholm, this growth has made Cint a strong global platform with teams across its many global offices, including Stockholm, London, New York, New Orleans, Singapore, Tokyo and Sydney. (www.cint.com)

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Our Organization

Dow Jones is a global provider of news and business information, delivering content to consumers and organizations around the world across multiple formats, including print, digital, mobile and live events. Dow Jones has produced unrivaled quality content for more than 130 years and today has one of the world's largest news-gathering operations globally. It is home to leading publications and products including the flagship Wall Street Journal, America's largest newspaper by paid circulation; Barron's, MarketWatch, Mansion Global, Financial News, Investor's Business Daily, Factiva, Dow Jones Risk & Compliance, Dow Jones Newswires, OPIS and Chemical Market Analytics. Dow Jones is a division of News Corp (Nasdaq: NWS, NWSA; ASX: NWS, NWSLV).

About The Team

Our Technology team drives the evolution of our Technology, Engineering, Data, Product and User Experience functions. With a keen focus on delivering cutting-edge solutions, we shape the digital landscape for our customers, readers, and users. From revolutionizing visuals to optimizing tools and harnessing the power of data, mobile, video, and social platforms, our team is committed to providing a seamless and immersive experience across all touchpoints. Collaborating closely with our newsrooms and strategic partners, we spearhead the development of groundbreaking products and technologies.

About The Role

The B2C Analytics team focuses on developing analytics solutions to help the organization make better data driven decisions. Our team is passionate about enabling others to use data and analysis to measure and monitor performance, identify risks and opportunities and find ways to continually add value.

You will primarily support the Consumer side of the business, which includes WSJ, Barron's, MarketWatch and more; but may also include exposure to other areas of the business, such as advertising and the professional information business. The ideal candidate will have previous experience in developing datasets, dashboards and data solutions that drive core insights. You will report to the Senior Manager, B2C Analytics.

You Will

Develop Stakeholder Partnerships


Develop strong partnerships with Product, Marketing, Newsroom, Finance, Data Collection, Data Engineering and other B2C Stakeholder Business teams and work across all levels and areas of the organization.
Executie data project roadmaps based on Business teams' priorities.


Understand B2C Data


Build a deep understanding of all the B2C data sources that we leverage in our Analysis projects
Partner with data engineers and data collection colleagues to collect, cleanse and organize data.


Conduct Analysis, Create Dashboards, Improve Processes & Ensure Quality


Analyze large datasets to surface trends and deliver recommendations with tangible business outcomes.
Create intuitive reports, dashboards and data solutions using visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, Looker Studio)
Continuously identify ways to improve and streamline processes around data and reporting
Ensure the quality of data and reporting, and partner with teams to improve accuracy and consistency


Clearly Communicate


Communicate technical information clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences


You Have


Team oriented and collaborative with eagerness to help others, and aspiration to be challenged and learn
Self starter able to work independently, coordinate with multiple partners and complete projects start to finish
Detail oriented with focus on assuring quality, consistency and accuracy in data and processes
Undergraduate degree or equivalent in combination of training and experience, preferably in a quantitative field such as Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or related disciplines.
Experience working with large datasets in a fast-paced and fluid environment with the ability to understand and solve complex non-routine problems.
Experience with SQL and strong knowledge of Excel/Sheets required. Familiarity with Github, Python/R preferred.
Experience with web analytics tools (particularly Google Analytics 4 and Adobe Analytics) is a plus.
Experience with data visualizations tools and techniques, and using data to tell a story (e.g. Tableau, Looker)


Our Benefits


Comprehensive Healthcare Plans
Paid Time Off
Retirement Plans
Comprehensive Insurance Plans
Lifestyle programs & Wellness Resources
Education Benefits
Family Care Benefits & Caregiving Support
Commuter Transit Program
Subscription Discounts
Employee Referral Program


\

Reasonable accommodation: Dow Jones, Making Careers Newsworthy - We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. EEO/AA/M/F/Disabled/Vets. We strongly encourage applications from all qualified individuals, including women, people with disabilities, and those from underrepresented groups. Dow Jones is committed to providing reasonable accommodation for qualified individuals with disabilities, in our job application and/or interview process. If you need assistance or accommodation in completing your application, due to a disability, email us at talentresourceteam@dowjones.com. Please put "Reasonable Accommodation" in the subject line and provide a brief description of the type of assistance you need. This inbox will not be monitored for application status updates.

Title: Data Analyst Trainee
Description:
Ecolab Company has an opening for an Data Analyst Trainee in our Procurement Analytics and Digital Solutions (ADS) team located in Barcelona, Spain. If you are a passionate professional that is seeking opportunity, advancement, and a rewarding learning chance and career we invite you to apply. This is a fantastic opportunity to join a highly recognized global growth company offering competitive compensation and benefits in addition to career growth.

Job Overview

As a part of the Data Operations team in the Global Supply Chain Analytics and Digital Solutions group you will be responsible for continuous improvements in digital capabilities and advanced analytics. You will lead the development of new digital products providing critical insights that help solve business challenges. The successful candidate will lead efforts to improve the chemical data understanding across the organization through improved process, governance, and data management.

Candidates must display a passion for systems, data, operational reporting & advanced analytics. The strong performer can expect further career advancement opportunities with Ecolab and will have the chance to move into other roles within Procurement or the organization, with increasing leadership opportunities. This is an exciting opportunity to advance your career with a stable growing company!

Main Responsibilities


Serve as a liaison among stakeholders to analyze, document, and validate requirements for reporting and changes to business processes
Develop and maintain data products
Develop, test, and operationalize new standardized reporting
Develop and maintain business intelligence dashboards
Lead automation of processes and analyses
Train other teams in systems, tools, and processes owned by ADS
Proactively make recommendations and identify opportunities to solve business problems through new business intelligence reporting
Interface with IT to specify and implement improvements to our data pipelines


Basic Qualifications


Masters in Data Science or Statistics or Computer Science or equivalent advance degree.
Interest in an Artificial Intelligence (AI) and business intelligence (BI) role
Experience with AI and BI data modeling and presenting insights to key stakeholders.
Exceptional analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Proficient in Python, PySpark, SQL, Azure AI, Tenserflow, Streamlit, Flask, Power Apps, Power BI, Snowflake, Azure SQL Database.
Intermediate SQL skills, or willingness to learn.
Fluent English
Full-time availability.
To be eligible for the Traineeship contract you must have completed your bachelor's or master's degree studies.
Work permit in Barcelona.


Preferred Qualifications


Experience designing and building standard reports and dashboards
History of managing and delivering projects, tasks, and initiatives
Ability to create, implement, document, and continuously improve processes in a changing environment
Training or experience in data science areas such as time series analysis, forecasting, classification, and regression analysis
Experience with data analytics tools such as Python, R, SPSS, MATLAB, Stata, and SAS
Experience working with global cross-functional teams and demonstrated ability to work well with people from different disciplines with varying degrees of technical expertise
Microsoft PowerBI experience
Project management experience
Experience in the petrochemical industry a plus
Enrolled in or recently completed degree with emphasis in Chemistry, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Information Technology, or Engineering preferred


Ecolab‚Äôs commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion (DE&I) reflects our longstanding value of working together to integrate diverse perspectives to challenge ourselves, reach our goals and do what‚Äôs right. Disability certificate will be an asset.

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

Ecolab is committed to fair and equal treatment of associates and applicants and furthering the principles of Equal Opportunity to Employment. Our goal is to fully utilize minority, female, and disabled individuals at all levels of the workforce. We will recruit, hire, promote, transfer and provide opportunities for advancement based on individual qualifications and job performance. In all matters affecting employment, compensation, benefits, working conditions, and opportunities for advancement, Ecolab will not discriminate against any associate or applicant for employment because of race, religion, color, creed, national origin,‚ÄØcitizenship status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expressions, genetic‚ÄØinformation, marital status, age, or disability.

Description:
At Roche you can show up as yourself, embraced for the unique qualities you bring. Our culture encourages personal expression, open dialogue, and genuine connections, where you are valued, accepted and respected for who you are, allowing you to thrive both personally and professionally. This is how we aim to prevent, stop and cure diseases and ensure everyone has access to healthcare today and for generations to come. Join Roche, where every voice matters.

The Position

Are you passionate about transforming raw data into powerful insights? As a Data Analyst, you'll navigate through complex data ecosystems from sources like SalesForce Sales & Service and ERP systems, seamlessly integrating them to create a unified data landscape. You'll spearhead the development of scalable data processes, collaborate with cross-functional teams to incorporate cutting-edge analytics tools, and craft insightful dashboards and reports that drive strategic business decisions.

We are seeking an experienced Data Analyst with a minimum of 5 years of experience to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in Business Intelligence (BI) development within a Microsoft SQL environment.

Your role will be critical in partnering with finance, sales, service, and IT teams to align data initiatives with business goals, acting as a data management expert and effectively communicating your findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Additionally, your dedication to data protection and privacy compliance will ensure our business information remains secure and trustworthy.

Your Key Responsibilities

Create, implement, and manage data integration workflows using SQL Integration Services
Develop multidimensional cubes and tabular models in SQL Analysis Services
Generate and distribute reports using SQL Reporting Services
Perform in-depth data analysis and generate insights to support business decisions
Develop and maintain reports and dashboards using Tableau
Work with large datasets and ensure data integrity and quality
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and provide solutions
Create comprehensive documentation and reports to communicate insights and recommendations
Ensure data integrity, accuracy, and security across all BI systems
Continuously improve BI processes and methodologies to enhance efficiency and effectiveness



Who You Are

Minimum of 5 years of experience in a data analysis role
Proven experience with Microsoft SQL Server (SSAS, SSRS, SSIS)
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to manage multiple projects concurrently and meet deadlines
Excellent communication and collaboration skills
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Statistics, or a related field
Preferred: Experience with Snowflake database
Preferred: Experience developing reports and dashboards using Tableau
Preferred: Familiarity with data structures in SAP


Who we are

A healthier future drives us to innovate. Together, more than 100‚Äô000 employees across the globe are dedicated to advance science, ensuring everyone has access to healthcare today and for generations to come. Our efforts result in more than 26 million people treated with our medicines and over 30 billion tests conducted using our Diagnostics products. We empower each other to explore new possibilities, foster creativity, and keep our ambitions high, so we can deliver life-changing healthcare solutions that make a global impact.

Let‚Äôs build a healthier future, together.

Roche is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

THE WORLD OF UBISOFT

Ubisoft‚Äôs 19,000 team members, working across more than 30 countries around the world, are bound by a common mission to enrich players‚Äô lives with original and memorable gaming experiences. Their commitment and talent have brought to life many acclaimed franchises such as Assassin‚Äôs Creed, Far Cry, Watch Dogs, Just Dance, Rainbow Six, and many more to come. Ubisoft is an equal opportunity employer that believes diverse backgrounds and perspectives are key to creating worlds where both players and teams can thrive and express themselves. If you are excited about solving game-changing challenges, cutting edge technologies and pushing the boundaries of entertainment, we invite you to join our journey and help us create the unknown.

Ubisoft Barcelona Mobile‚ÄØbrings together dedicated and experienced professionals that are focused on crafting high-quality F2P games for mobile. We strongly believe in the core values at the centre of our Ubilife, which encourage us to take ownership of our work, continually striving for excellence while promoting the sharing of knowledge across individuals and teams, without losing our sense of enjoyment and fun, while taking care for one another. We strive for a safe and respectful workplace for all team members and we‚Äôre transparent about the measures we are taking to do so. For this reason, Ubisoft‚Äôs Code of Conduct has been released publicly on our corporate website for all current and future team members.

Do you want to join us in the world of mobile gaming? If so, read on!

Job Description

YOUR DAILY ADVENTURE

Ubisoft Barcelona Mobile is currently seeking a Data Analyst to help our team on their next adventure. The Data Analyst will support insight initiatives for our BI team. This person will report to the Live Producer. Your daily adventure:



Turning data into actionable insights, by performing hands-on research, data exploration and analysis, to drive decisions and strategies for user acquisition, retention, and monetization.
Work with the game teams to provide insights into user behaviour, answer key business questions and support in AB test design and analysis.
Carry out projects on machine learning for behavioural segmentation and monetization.
Debugging and problem-solving issues to ensure the delivery of accurate and clear analysis, reports and tools.
Effectively communicate results and insights to senior stakeholders throughout the organization.
Coordinate, challenge and share the best analytical practices and methods within the organization.
Stay up to date with the latest developments in Machine Learning technologies and Data Science trends.
Contribute to the knowledge base and culture of the team.



Qualifications

YOUR SKILLS

Are you serious about fun? Do you consistently seek out learning opportunities and aim to beat your high score? Are you open to new ideas, perspectives and cultures and believe that it takes a world to build a world? At Ubisoft, you‚Äôll work alongside passionate and talented teams who are imagining the future of entertainment.



Master's degree in a quantitative field (i.e. Physics, Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science, Data Science...). PhD in any of these disciplines is a plus.
5+ years relevant work experience in similar positions, ideally in mobile gaming industry.
Highly proficient in SQL as well as Python for data exploratory analysis
Experience with cloud-based big data solutions such as Redshift, BigQuery.
Solid knowledge of data visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker, Microstrategy, etc.
Robust understanding of advanced statistics suitable for analysis of skewed populations.
Experience designing effective ways of communicating, visualising and reporting results/analysis.
Experience in predictive analytics and segmentation.
Excellent problem-solving capabilities with strong attention to details.
Work permit for Spain obtained prior to applying for the position is a must.



What can make you stand out:



Experience with Agile philosophies (e.g.: Scrum, Kanban, XP) and project management tools (e.g.: JIRA)
Software engineering skills, including best practices like CI/CD and Git.
Self-motivation, organization skills, team spirit, proactivity.
Passion for games. Interest in mobile F2P games.



Additional Information

YOUR LIFE AT UBISOFT BARCELONA MOBILE (and PERKS)



Hybrid Work Model
Possibility for new parents to work from home 80% of the time.
Flex working schedule:‚ÄØ40hrs per week with start time between 8 AM ‚Äì 10 AM and leave from 5 PM (Friday from 2 PM).
Reduced schedule‚ÄØ(35 hrs per week) in July and August, Easter, Christmas holidays, and special days like Sant Jordi and Revetlla de Sant Joan.
Personal Matters Hours:‚ÄØ24 hours paid for by Ubisoft that you can use for personal matters.
Holidays:‚ÄØ25 days per year + 1 day in your‚ÄØUbi-Birthday.
5 extra holiday‚ÄØdays‚ÄØon the year you celebrate your 5th/10th/15th/20th year with us.
Ticket Restaurant: 200‚Ç¨ per month, and‚ÄØFlexible compensation plan‚ÄØ(Ticket Transport & Ticket Nursery).
Health insurance‚ÄØwith Cigna, including‚ÄØPhysiotherapist & Psychology sessions‚ÄØwith a reduced price.
Life Insurance‚ÄØwith AXA.
Mobile Device‚ÄØGrant‚ÄØof 400 EUR‚ÄØstarting on your 1st year in the company.
Language trainings‚ÄØin English, Spanish, and French.
Professional development training & programs, based upon request.
Ubisoft games with discount‚ÄØand Uplay PC for free.
Locally roasted craft coffee‚ÄØby INCAPTO (it‚Äôs very, very good).
