  • Realizar entrevistas con usuarios para combinar datos cuantitativos y cualitativos.
  • Proponer nuevas m√©tricas o modelos de seguimiento para funcionalidades nuevas o existentes.
Requisitos


  • Experiencia previa como analista de datos, idealmente en producto digital o app.
  • Dominio de SQL (imprescindible).
  • Conocimiento en visualizaci√≥n de datos (Grafana, Power BI, Appsmith o similares).
  • Experiencia con bases de datos como MySQL, PostgreSQL o BigQuery.
  • Sensibilidad por UX/UI: entiendes c√≥mo los datos impactan la experiencia.
  • Alta atenci√≥n al detalle y precisi√≥n num√©rica.
  • Buenas habilidades de comunicaci√≥n para explicar hallazgos y proponer mejoras.
  • Disposici√≥n para hacer trabajo de campo: entrevistas, observaci√≥n directa, etc.
Plus (no excluyentes)


  • Conocimientos de Python (Pandas, SQLAlchemy, etc.)
  • Experiencia con herramientas de tracking (Firebase, Mixpanel, Amplitude)
  • Haber trabajado en startups o con equipos de producto √°giles



Perfil ideal


  • Mentalidad anal√≠tica y obsesi√≥n por entender al usuario
  • Aut√≥nomo/a, con capacidad para proponer y ejecutar sin supervisi√≥n constante
  • Proactivo/a y con iniciativa para plantear nuevas formas de medir y mejorar
  • Buena comunicaci√≥n y ganas de aportar en un entorno colaborativo y en crecimiento

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Position Summary

The Business Unit Printing & Converting (BUPC) is looking for a Data Analyst.

Your main mission will be to translate data into valuable information and actionable recommendations for the business. This global position will be a key enabler for the BU in the achievement of our 2025 profitability.

You will be a key member of the BUPC Finance team with the role to manage and enhance our reporting capabilities while working closely with the Data Engineering team. This role involves gathering business requirements, developing insightful reports, and ensuring data accuracy and consistency across various dashboards. The ideal candidate will be proficient in analytics tools and have a deep understanding of business needs.

The BU Printing & Converting includes 11 Manufacturing sites in a context of a new ERP harmonization across all entities, and covers the following main streams Finance & Controlling, Operations, Sales & Marketing, R&D.

Main Responsibilities

Report Development:


Design, develop, reports and dashboards
Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and reliability
Translate complex data into actionable insights for business stakeholders.
Work closely with business teams to understand reporting requirements and translate them into technical solutions.
Plan data source acquisition ahead with data engineers to deliver reports in a timely manner
Propose and maintain UX / UI best practices


Continuous Improvement & Documentation:


Document reporting processes, methodologies, and data definitions.
Recommend improvements to reporting tools and workflows to enhance efficiency.
Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in analytics and visualization.


Data Quality & Validation:


Identify and escalate data inconsistencies or anomalies to the data engineering team.


Support the Finance team‚Äôs evolution from basic reporting to new state of the art business intelligence tools

Accompany users to change

Process changes and corrective maintenance

Support IT Data & Analytics operating model

Create Data Analytics key users‚Äô community within the BU

Professional Experience

You have a Bachelor Data Analytics, Business Intelligence, or a related field.

3+ years of experience in data analysis, reporting, and visualization.

Proficiency in BI tools such as Tableau¬Æ (certification), Power BI, and Excel.

Knowledge of SAP HANA, Anaplan / OneStream is a plus

Experience working with large datasets and data warehouses.

Personal Attributes

Innovative spirit and interest in company processes

Solution oriented mindset

Drive to continuously improve your area

High sense of responsibility and independent working practice, showing initiative and high level of reliability

Great data visualization skills by presenting analytical findings in a clear and concise manner

Adaptable to work to both technical and non-technical audiences

Team player with good communication skills

Excellent level in English (French is a plus)

For more than 130 years, and over 50 countries, BOBST has always been at the forefront of innovation and we want to accelerate connectivity, digitalization, automation and sustainability to make packaging better than ever.

BOBST is one of the world‚Äôs leading suppliers of equipment and services to packaging and label manufacturers in the folding carton, corrugated board and flexible materials industries. Join our highly qualified staff and together, let‚Äôs shape the future of the packaging world.

Title: Product Analyst, Chat
Description:
Department: Customer Happiness, Analytics

Employment Type: Full Time

Location: Remote/Barcelona

Reporting To: Stanislav Fedyakov

Description

Tabby creates financial freedom in the way people shop, earn, and save, by reshaping their relationship with money.

The company‚Äôs flagship offering allows shoppers to split their payments online and in-store with no interest or fees. Over 32,000 global brands and small businesses, including Amazon, Noon, IKEA, and Shein, use Tabby to accelerate growth and gain loyal customers by offering easy and flexible payments online and in stores.

Tabby has generated over $7 billion in transaction volume for its partner brands and is the highest-rated, most reviewed, largest, and fastest-growing app of any fintech in the GCC region.

Tabby launched operations in 2020 and has raised +$1 billion in equity and debt funding from global and regional investors.

We are looking for a Product Analyst to contribute to the evolution of Tabby. This Product Analyst will join our Customer Happiness team and focus on enhancing the customer support experience. This includes optimizing chat tools, AI-driven chatbots, and other self-service solutions.

You'll collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including Design, Customer Experience, and Product teams.

Key Responsibilities


Provide analytical support to the product and business teams across all facets of their work, including evaluation of new product features in terms of revenue and cost
Generate hypotheses, conduct research and A/B tests, and present your findings clearly and compellingly highlighting the importance of your insights.
Support and monitor existing metrics related to chat, identify areas for improvement, and develop new metrics that inform decision-making across the organization.
Develop data visualizations and reports that are informative and easily understood by business and product teams.
Assist in the planning of necessary data structures.



Skills, Knowledge & Expertise


Minimum of 2 years of work experience as a Product / Data Analyst.
Proficiency in SQL and relational databases.
Proficiency in data visualization tools, particularly Tableau.
Experience in planning data structures for new products and features.
Experience in designing and conducting A/B tests.
Knowledge of Python (Pandas, Numpy, Statsmodels, Matplotlib, etc.) is a plus.
Strong quantitative skills and a structured approach to problem-solving. Ability to analyze issues, identify root causes, and recommend solutions.
Passionate about ensuring the quality of the products your team would deliver.
Strong English speaking skills, both verbally and writing.



Job Benefits

Relocation and Employment

We offer remote work from anywhere in the world (our schedule is based on Dubai time though) and are happy to work out an individual relocation plan for you.

Our employees have the opportunity to choose a country for registration; at the moment, those are Armenia, Georgia, Serbia, Portugal, Spain, the UAE, and Remote.


We offer flexible working hours and trust you to work enough hours to do your job well, at times that suit you and your team.
A working environment that gives you autonomy and responsibility from day one.
You should be comfortable with the idea that the quality of your work will influence the shape of your career.
Participation in the company‚Äôs employee stock options program.
Health Insurance



We are passionate about creating an inclusive, high-performing workplace that gives people from all backgrounds the support they need to thrive, grow, and meet their goals (whatever they may be).

If this sounds exciting to you, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!
Show more

Title: Data Analyst with Python
Description:
Smadex is a leading advertising technology company founded in Barcelona in 2011 and sold to American-based and stock-listed Entravision in 2018 (NYSE::EVC). We are a fully transparent platform built with top technology, countless programmatic management features and powerful machine learning algorithms to help advertisers grow their business at scale. We are currently considered one of the top mobile ad-tech companies in the world.

We are looking for a Data Analyst¬†with proven experience in Python,¬†SQL, analytics and knowledge of statistics to join our Data Science Team. Working alongside our Data Engineers, the candidate should be communicative and analytical, in order to answer the complex questions that Product and Campaign performance are facing.¬† For this purpose we use tons of data available to get powerful insights to resolve them, creating effective strategies to help improve the Smadex platform!¬†

This is a full-time position based in Barcelona!

Your tasks and responsibilities:

Analyze large, complex data sets containing the behaviour of millions of mobile users and Apps worldwide to address strategic questions
Obtain and Report insights from our Product¬¥s performance (ML, Audiences, Creatives, Supply, etc) in order to make decisions that will impact revenue.¬† Have one¬¥s say!
Develop automated dashboards and processes to ensure data influence decisions at all levels of the company
Working cross-functionally with business and technical teams to support product performance

Skills and requirements:

+2 years of experience as a Data Analyst / Data Scientist
Proven working knowledge of Python, SQL and large data sets, understanding of analytic methodologies for data evaluation
Bachelor's or Master's Degree in Engineering or Business
Strong knowledge of basic statistics concepts
Strong analytical skills with the ability to get insights
Outstanding communication and reporting skills
Excellent command of Microsoft Excel (Power Pivot & Power Query)¬†
Excellent communication skills in English both written and spoken are mandatory
Strong experience with SQL for data exploratory analysis
Experience with A/B testing
R, Superset, PowerBI experience is a plus
Knowledge of the ad-tech industry is a plus.

Please note that we do NOT provide VISA sponsorship. Candidates without a legal permit to work in Spain won't be considered.

What is in it for you:

Integrate a highly motivated and young team
Great compensation package
Top location at the heart of Barcelona with a rooftop terrace, Barbeque, and a fully stocked fridge
Great work-life balance: work from home (2 days per week), flexible hours
LinkedIn Learning and training opportunities
Meal vouchers - Ticket¬†Restaurant monthly allowance
Monthly gym allowance to use in up to 30 DIR gyms around the city
Monthly TGIF events
Regular team-building events
Fun and friendly work environment with talented marketers and engineers from over 28¬†countries
And more!

Title: Compliance Data Analyst
Description:
ADP is hiring a Compliance Data Analyst

ADP has adopted a set of privacy principles that serve as the foundation for our global privacy program, which is designed (i) to assist our Clients in meeting their privacy obligations wherever they do business and (ii) to ensure the personal data of our clients and their employees are safely handled by ADP and its third-party payroll providers and other vendors.

In this context, ADP has dedicated Compliance and Legal teams to oversee and support ADP business to comply with all aspects of data privacy laws and regulations that apply to its business operations.

In this role, you will be part of the Compliance team and will assist ADP with continuously complying with its privacy program and specifically, with its Records Information Management (RIM) Policy. More specifically, you will provide data analytics support with identifying risks and gaps in the retention and disposal of our client‚Äôs employees data by monitoring and reporting on the organization's data retention performance, under the supervision of the Compliance Director.

What You'll Do

What you can expect on a typical day:

1 ‚Äì ADP‚Äôs End-to-end Data Disposal Process Is Handled Via a Complex Ticketing System, Involving Various Data Disposal Scenarios, Process Steps And Stakeholders. In This Context


You will identify and track accuracy issues with the tickets related to data retention queries, and you will recommend solutions.
You will monitor the ticket queue relating to data retention and data disposal requests and track the progress.
You will collaborate with the relevant support team to ensure timely and accurate ticket resolution.
You will report regularly to management on ticket volume, response times, ticket status and more.
You will recommend improvements to enhance efficiency and effectiveness for quicker resolutions of the tickets.
You will maintain accurate records and documentation associated with data retention compliance.
You will create periodic data retention statistics for relevant stakeholders & executive board
You will support with regular data audits to ensure the organization is compliant with its data retention policy.


Requirements

2- You will be supporting with compliance assessment activities on our third-party payroll providers to ensure they meet regulatory privacy requirements as well as ADP‚Äôs RIM program. More specifically:


You will support with the review of our third-party payroll providers‚Äô annual data retention audit and their subsequent remediations until full completion.
You will perform annual re-certification activities on our third-party payroll providers to ensure their continuous compliance with ADP‚Äôs RIM program and will help delivering and tracking annual data retention training for our third-party payroll providers.
You will assist on an ad hoc basis on other compliance related data analytic tasks that may arise within the business as necessary.


To Succeed In This Role


You have a bachelor's degree in data analytics or related fields; and/or, between 1-2 years of proven experience as a compliance-oriented data analyst.
You have good technical and IT infrastructure understanding and are familiar with data governance, data quality, and data management principles.
You have a proficient knowledge of MS Office (especially in Excel), as you will need to use these tools on a daily basis to ensure that you can handle all the above.
You are fluent in English (oral and written).


In Addition


You have analytical mindset with the ability to assess complex information and identify potential compliance risks. We need someone able to understand problems, identify cause-and-effect relationships and potential solutions.
You have a strong attention to detail and a methodical approach to data analysi. We are looking for someone who is able to notice patterns, catch errors, inconsistencies and discrepancies that others may overlook.
You have strong administrative and organizational skills. The role requires performance of various administrative compliance-related tasks such as safekeeping important documents, organizing files, managing databases, tracking activities and report generation. We therefore need someone who:
Has a methodical approach, ensuring that no task is left incomplete, or instructions misunderstood.
Has effective organization and time management skills.
Has the flexibility to manage a variety of tasks and adapt to changing priorities.
You have experience in working in an multinational environment involving multiple stakeholders


A little about ADP: We are a comprehensive global provider of cloud-based human capital management (HCM) solutions that unite HR, payroll, talent, time, tax and benefits administration and a leader in business outsourcing services, analytics, and compliance expertise. We believe our people make all the difference in cultivating a down-to-earth culture that embraces our core values, welcomes ideas, encourages innovation, and values belonging. We've received recognition for our work by many esteemed organizations, learn more at ADP Awards and Recognition.

Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Equal Employment Opportunity at ADP: ADP is committed to an inclusive, diverse and equitable workplace, and is further committed to providing equal employment opportunities regardless of any protected characteristic including: race, color, genetic information, creed, national origin, religion, sex, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, lawful alien status, ancestry, age, marital status, protected veteran status or disability. Hiring decisions are based upon ADP‚Äôs operating needs, and applicant merit including, but not limited to, qualifications, experience, ability, availability, cooperation, and job performance.

Ethics at ADP: ADP has a long, proud history of conducting business with the highest ethical standards and full compliance with all applicable laws. We also expect our people to uphold our values with the highest level of integrity and behave in a manner that fosters an honest and respectful workplace. Click https://jobs.adp.com/life-at-adp/ to learn more about ADP‚Äôs culture and our full set of values.

Title: Internship, Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

We are looking for a Data Analyst Intern for our dynamic market Intelligence team.

Responsibilities


Search for opportunities for business development and increase of company's market share in different services
Regular analysis of the company's performance
Convert the information into knowledge in order to increase company's competitiveness
Develop and maintain regulatory databases
Create, update and organize database of potential international customers
Support regional teams across the globe
Attend meetings with sales and business development managers based internationally


Qualifications


Degree in Business Administration / Data Analysis / Economics/ International Business.
Knowledge in Big Data a plus.
Fluent in English, Intermediate in Spanish.
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft windows applications (Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint)
MI tools such as Power Bi, MACRO, Data Scrapping tools are preferred.
Able to communicate effectively at all levels.
Willing to learn.
Proactive, organized, and multitasking with great team spirit.
Mission: At UL, we know why we come to work. Shape the way we approach and deliver our solutions to have a meaningful contribution to society.
People: Be part of our global team and do your best work! Teamwork, open-feedback and our diversity are our drivers to reach our common mission.
Interesting work: The work that goes on inside UL is fuelling the future. It challenges you to try fresh approaches, work autonomously, drive change and gain in-depth experience in your field.
Grow & achieve: Growth and development are part of our DNA. Grow & achieve with targeted development, reward and recognition programs as well as your very own UL University.
This is our normal: Competitive remuneration, annual bonus, flexible hours, home office options, paid annual leave.


About Us

A global leader in applied safety science, UL Solutions (NYSE: ULS) transforms safety, security and sustainability challenges into opportunities for customers in more than 110 countries. UL Solutions delivers testing, inspection and certification services, together with software products and advisory offerings, that support our customers‚Äô product innovation and business growth. The UL Mark serves as a recognized symbol of trust in our customers‚Äô products and reflects an unwavering commitment to advancing our safety mission. We help our customers innovate, launch new products and services, navigate global markets and complex supply chains, and grow sustainably and responsibly into the future. Our science is your advantage.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are growing our teams and this is an opportunity for you to join our Barcelona office as a Data Scientist / Analyst within the Analytics Performance Marketing team.

You will collaborate closely with Data Analysts, Data Scientists, UA Managers and other Marketing roles to analyse and interpret data that drives our marketing strategies.

Your insights will play a key role in shaping campaign optimization, identifying growth opportunities, and ultimately contributing to the company's success in a competitive gaming market.

As a Data Scientist / Analyst you will have a key role in defining, extracting and actioning data from big and complex datasets from a variety of analytical solutions from simple to complex.

Key Responsibilities:
Data Analysis & Reporting:
Gather, clean, and analyze marketing data from multiple sources to provide actionable insights.
Produce ad hoc analyses to support decision-making for campaigns and product launches.
Monitor and evaluate the performance of marketing campaigns ( paid ads, organic TV, brand) and provide recommendations for optimisation.
Develop actionable insights from user data that inform marketing targeting, acquisition and retention strategies.
Data Modelling - Time Series forecasting, A/B Testing
Collaboration:
Collaborate with cross-functional teams including Data Science, Data Engineer, to integrate marketing data with overall product and business objectives.
Communicate findings and insights to non-technical stakeholders through clear and concise visualizations and presentations.
Data Quality & Governance:
Ensure the accuracy and integrity of all marketing data through regular data audits and validation processes.
Help set and maintain data tracking standards across marketing channels, ensuring consistency and reliability.







What We're Looking For

Required Qualifications:
3 to 5 years of experience as a Data Analyst / Scientist or in a similar analytical role, preferably within the gaming / tech / financial industry.
Strong proficiency in data analysis tools (SQL, Python, Excel, etc.).
Experience with data modelling, time series analysis, A/B testing, Difference in Difference
Ability to identify trends, extract insights, and communicate findings in a clear and actionable manner.
Strong attention to detail and ability to work with large datasets.
Ability to present complex data in an easy-to-understand format to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Nice-to-Have Skills:
Familiarity with game-related metrics, mobile apps such as daily active users (DAU), in-app purchases (IAPs), and retention/engagement metrics.


Why Product Madness?

As part of the Aristocrat family, we share their mission of bringing joy to life through the power of play, with a world-class team who creates top-grossing, leading titles in the social casino genre, including Heart of Vegas, Lightning Link, Cashman Casino.

With 800 team members across the globe, Product Madness is headquartered in London, with offices in Barcelona, Gda≈Ñsk, Lviv, Montreal and a remote team spanning the USA, making us a truly global powerhouse.

We live by our People First principle. Regardless of where, when, or how they work, our team members have opportunities to elevate their careers, and grow alongside us. We take pride in fostering an inclusive culture, where our people are encouraged to be their very best, every day.

But don‚Äôt just take our word for it. In 2024, we made the Global Inspiring Workplace Awards list, and won a bronze award at the Stevies for Great Employers in the ‚ÄòEmployer of the Year - Media and Entertainment‚Äô category.

So, what‚Äôs stopping you?

Our Values
People First
We have the deepest respect for our people and their well being. We know they are exceptionally talented and will always have a choice. We want them to re-choose us every day. We are committed to building a culture where each person's voice will always be heard and addressed.
MAD for More
Always improving, innovating and never settling for the existing. We push all boundaries with courage and ambition to become the world‚Äôs best games company.
Champion Together We excel at what we do but yet remain humble and helpful to our teammates. We champion one another and hold each other to high standards without any egos.
Globally Inclusive
We are all Equal - regardless of the language we speak, where we live, our gender, religion or culture we come from. We want to build a global home, where everyone has the equal opportunity to make an impact.
Customer Focused
We always think from the customer's perspective - be it players or internal customers.

Improving their experience and joy is what drives us. Every client's success is our big win!

Travel Expectations

None

Additional Information

At this time, we are unable to sponsor work visas for this position. Candidates must be authorized to work in the job posting location for this position on a full-time basis without the need for current or future visa sponsorship.

We are growing our teams and this is an opportunity for you to join our Barcelona office as a Data Scientist / Analyst within the Analytics Performance Marketing team.

You will collaborate closely with Data Analysts, Data Scientists, UA Managers and other Marketing roles to analyse and interpret data that drives our marketing strategies.

Your insights will play a key role in shaping campaign optimization, identifying growth opportunities, and ultimately contributing to the company's success in a competitive gaming market.

As a Data Scientist / Analyst you will have a key role in defining, extracting and actioning data from big and complex datasets from a variety of analytical solutions from simple to complex.

Key Responsibilities:
  • Data Analysis & Reporting:
    • Gather, clean, and analyze marketing data from multiple sources to provide actionable insights.
    • Produce ad hoc analyses to support decision-making for campaigns and product launches.
    • Monitor and evaluate the performance of marketing campaigns ( paid ads, organic TV, brand) and provide recommendations for optimisation.
    • Develop actionable insights from user data that inform marketing targeting, acquisition and retention strategies.
    • Data Modelling - Time Series forecasting, A/B Testing
  • Collaboration:
    • Collaborate with cross-functional teams including Data Science, Data Engineer, to integrate marketing data with overall product and business objectives.
    • Communicate findings and insights to non-technical stakeholders through clear and concise visualizations and presentations.

Title: Data Analyst EMEA, Retail Media
Description:
What You'll Do:

The Retail Media EMEA Analytics team, part of the rapidly expanding Criteo Retail Media business, leverages our grand set of shopper data to design and develop actionable insights for our Retailer and Brand clients. We bring the analytical perspective onto the business and provide recommendations based on high quality data analysis and strong understanding of our industry and products. We leverage our unique position to provide our commercial teams and clients with visibility into shopper behavior, market trends and product performance that can't be found anywhere else.

Criteo‚Äôs high-growth business model brings both opportunities and challenges. This position requires working with large sets of data and a variety of stakeholders to solve complex business problems by thinking strategically and proposing innovative solutions. The ideal candidate functions with minimal oversight and has the ability to learn new concepts quickly.


Mine massive data sets and turn them into understandable and actionable insights
Build scalable analytic solutions using state of the art tools of Criteo analytics stack (Hadoop, Vertica, PySpark‚Ä¶)
Develop innovative analytical approaches to measure Brands & Retailers‚Äô performance from design to presentation of results, leveraging all our expertise in Data Science (statistical thinking, A/B testing, bootstrapping, data visualization‚Ä¶)
Frequently interact with other teams (R&D, product, commercial teams‚Ä¶) and clients to share data-driven recommendations and insights
Develop and maintain deep knowledge of Criteo Retail Media products and technologies as they evolve



Who You Are:

You are passionate about data and want to work with leading edge technologies in online industry:


You have at least 2 years‚Äô experience in Data Science or Data Analytics
A Master‚Äôs degree or higher in a quantitative field (Engineering, Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics, etc.) is preferred, but equivalent practical experience will also be considered.
Fluency in the core toolkit of Data Science/Data Analytics: SQL is required, Python is a real asset (master most common data libraries: pandas, numpy‚Ä¶)
Outstanding analytical skills: passion for translating data-speak into relevant, compelling stories
A background in the digital industry or consulting is a plus
You have the combination of technical skills, passion for learning, and the soft skills to work with all personality types in a dynamic environment
You are fluent in English



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we‚Äôd love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world‚Äôs marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
üöÄAt Capgemini Invent, we drive change through inventive transformation consulting, blending strategic, creative, and scientific capabilities to deliver cutting-edge solutions. Join us to tailor transformations to our clients' challenges, validated by science and data, powered by creativity and design, and underpinned by purposeful technology.




Your Role

As a Junior Data Analyst professional, you will guide organizations in managing and leveraging their data assets to drive strategic business outcomes. Your focus will be on data quality, security, governance, and metadata management among others fields of practices.




üåêKey responsibilities:

Advising clients on data governance frameworks, data ethics policies, metadata management strategies, and master data management (MDM) solutions.
Integrating cutting-edge technologies into data management processes, leveraging machine learning and advanced analytics.
Shaping and executing engagements in Data Management, including Data Governance, Data Ethics, Data modeling, Data Architecture, Data Quality, and standards implementation.
Conducting assessments of clients' data maturity using frameworks like DCAM and DAMA.
Cultivating trusted client relationships to address key challenges in data management, analytics, and AI delivery.
Providing strategic counsel on maximizing the value of data-driven insights for business decision-making.
Supporting large-scale data transformations from conceptualization to implementation.
Collaborating with stakeholders to facilitate innovation initiatives.
Establishing robust data capabilities within client organizations, including process optimization and skills development.
Contributing to the development of our practice by identifying new market opportunities and creating thought leadership content.




üí°Your Profile:

Innovation: Ability to drive innovation in data management using cutting-edge technologies as Informatica or Collibra.
Value-Creation: Creating tangible value through effective data management and utilization of data assets.
Leadership: Potential as a leader in data management with relevant experience and success.
Strategic Thinking: Providing strategic guidance on data management and roadmap creation.
Stakeholder Management: Strong engagement skills with diverse stakeholders, discovering business needs.
Communication Skills: Effective communication to represent the company in data strategy discussions.
Continuous Learning: Commitment to staying abreast of advancements in data strategy and management.
Delivery: Track record of delivering within agile working environments.




üåüWhat You'll Love About Working Here

Join our rapidly growing Data & AI Strategy team at Capgemini Invent, where we design and build strategies to transform how organizations leverage data. Our commitment to innovation and AI-driven solutions creates unparalleled value for clients.




We offer flexibility, a positive work-life balance, through hybrid working (80%) and wellbeing options for our employees.




üìçLocation: Barcelona




Are you ready to take your career to the next level and drive the future of innovation with data?

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Who We Are

Cint is a pioneer in research technology (ResTech). Our customers use the Cint platform to post questions and get answers from real people to build business strategies, confidently publish research, accurately measure the impact of digital advertising, and more. The Cint platform is built on a programmatic marketplace, which is the world‚Äôs largest, with nearly 300 million respondents in over 150 countries who consent to sharing their opinions, motivations, and behaviours.

We are feeding the world‚Äôs curiosity!

Job Description

We are looking for a Data Analyst to support our Data Science & Analytics team in delivering high-quality insights through data exploration, analysis, and reporting. The ideal candidate is a self-starter, comfortable working with large datasets, automating processes, and supporting internal stakeholders with data-driven recommendations.

Responsibilities


Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights, ensuring quality and reliability of results.
Respond to ad hoc client-specific requests including performing analyses, data manipulation and producing summary results.
Generate reports and visualizations to effectively communicate findings to stakeholders to support decision making
Support campaign performance analysis and contribute to benchmark development and optimization.
Design scripts and tools to automate and streamline data extraction processes using Python, SQL, and APIs.
Develop interactive dashboards and reporting tools (such as Power BI, Tableau, Streamlit) to provide a clear overview of key metrics and insights.
Collaborate with stakeholders to enhance data collection processes.


Qualifications

Required:


Master‚Äôs degree or Bachelors in a quantitative field (e.g., Data Analytics, Statistics, Mathematics or a related discipline).
1-2 year(s) of experience in a data analysis role, preferably in market research, or advertising analytics.
Proficiency in Python (especially pandas and NumPy) for data manipulation.
Strong experience with MS Excel for analysis and reporting.
Experience working with large datasets and performing complex data transformations.
Strong analytical skills with a focus on data validation and accuracy.
Excellent communication skills to present findings and collaborate with internal teams and customers.
Self-starter with ability to work independently.


Additional Information

Nice to Have:


Experience in media measurement analytics.
Ability to write and optimize SQL queries.
Familiarity with Streamlit, Power BI, or Tableau for dashboarding.
Understanding of Databricks or similar cloud-based analytics platforms.


Our Values

Collaboration is our superpower


We uncover rich perspectives across the world
Success happens together
We deliver across borders.


Innovation is in our blood


We‚Äôre pioneers in our industry
Our curiosity is insatiable
We bring the best ideas to life.


We Do What We Say


We‚Äôre accountable for our work and actions
Excellence comes as standard
We‚Äôre open, honest and kind, always.


We are caring


We learn from each other‚Äôs experiences
Stop and listen; every opinion matters
We embrace diversity, equity and inclusion.


More About Cint

In June 2021, Cint acquired Berlin-based GapFish ‚Äì the world‚Äôs largest ISO certified online panel community in the DACH region ‚Äì and in January 2022, completed the acquisition of US-based Lucid ‚Äì a programmatic research technology platform that provides access to first-party survey data in over 110 countries.

Cint Group AB (publ), listed on Nasdaq Stockholm, this growth has made Cint a strong global platform with teams across its many global offices, including Stockholm, London, New York, New Orleans, Singapore, Tokyo and Sydney. (www.cint.com)

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At ING we are looking for a Data Analyst




Your role and work environment:




We are looking for a talented and enthusiastic Data Analyst to join our Human Connection Strategy Team of Human Connection tribe.




If you are passionate about turning data into actionable insights and enjoy working directly with stakeholders to influence strategic decisions, this role is for you.




We are seeking someone who, in additions to being technically proficient, can translate complex data insights into clear business recommendations, communicate effectively with non-technical audiences, and contribute to driving key initiatives within the organization.




Your key responsibilities:




As a Data analyst you will:




Translate data into insights that inform strategic and operational decisions across the business.
Work closely with business stakeholders to understand their needs, co-create analytical approaches, and present results in a way that drives action.
Prepare and deliver high-impact presentations and data-driven narratives for senior leadership and cross-functional teams.
Bridge the gap between data and business, ensuring insights are understandable and actionable.
Collaborate with other teams in an International and agile environment, ensuring alignment and consistent communication.




What are we looking for?




Want to know if this job is made for you? These are some of the qualities that we value the most for this role. And if the shoe fits‚Ä¶ don‚Äôt hesitate to apply!




For us, a Data analyst is someone who:




Knows about:




Bachelor‚Äôs degree in mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Business, Engineering, or similar.
3-4 years of experience in data analytics, business analytics, consulting, or related roles.
Solid knowledge of SQL and data visualization tools (e.g., power BI, Tableau) python or R is a plus but not essential.
Strong experience in data storytelling and creating business presentations.
Fluent English (spoken and written)
Understanding of business strategy and kpis to connect data insights with tangible business outcomes




Can:




Communicate complex data insights clearly and persuasively to non-technical stakeholders.
Proactively identify opportunities where data can add value and influence key decisions.




Loves to:




Collaborate in multidisciplinary teams, contributing to both technical and strategic conversations.
Present and defend your ideas with confidence and openness to feedback.




Defines himself/herself as a:




A team player with excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
Flexible, dynamic, and eager to work in fast-paced changing environments.




What do we offer?




The time you spend at work, the challenges you face or the lessons you get are very important, but‚Ä¶ What about your personal life? At ING we want your work to fulfill you in every way, and that is why we take care of even the smallest details.




Check out what is waiting for you!




Be flexible my friend.

Our model is all about flexibility and accountability. Keeping both our customers and our colleagues‚Äô needs in mind, you determine together which days you work at home and which you come to ING MAD to offer your best self. Do your thing.




Restaurant card.

So that thinking about what to have for lunch doesn‚Äôt take up your time or your cravings.




Our house will be your home.

In our offices you can find electric mobility solutions, doctor, hairdresser, gym, The Good Service (to help you with your errands) and much more!




Health insurance.

For you and all your family (spouse/partner and children).




Life insurance.

We help you protect what matters most to you.




Flexible remuneration.

In addition, you will enjoy our flexible remuneration model, through a more tax-advantaged way, you will be able to access other services such as nursery, transport card, training aids‚Ä¶




Free company shuttle.

It doesn't matter where you live. We have 6 routes (North, Central, South, A5, A42 and A6) to get you to our ING office in Madrid comfortably.




Banking benefits.

Special loans with more beneficial conditions.

Special mortgage conditions after 6 months working at the bank.

And you can benefit from our pension plan after 1 month with us!




More vitality and more belonging

360¬∫ care of the employee (physical, mental, social connection & purpose).

Physiotherapy service on site.

Clinics with professional, world-class athletes.

Gympass service.

Employee Networks: Rainbow Lions (LGBTQI+), Leonas & RI√ëG.

International Remote work program.







Get to know Us




We are a team of more than 1700 people sharing one idea: doing our bit in helping our clients create a better future for themselves, by providing them with the tools they need to get where they want to go.




A fully online bank where technology, innovation, simplicity and transparency are the main ingredients, and the first one to work with agile methodologies.




And although we are based in Spain, we are lucky to work in an international bank with presence in more than 40 countries.




We are proud to have a diverse team, and we are committed to continue developing a culture of Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging to foster a culture of collaboration and innovation that represents all collectives in the society.




And even though we look orange on the outside, we are green on the inside. Our ambition in Sustainability is Empowering (y)our Sustainability journey. We are embarking on our path, for us, but we are also there for when our clients decide to embark on this journey.




Making things happen, helping others be successful, always being one step ahead‚Äîthat‚Äôs our DNA. If you look at yourself in the mirror and your reflection matches our way of being and working‚Ä¶we are looking forward to meeting you!

Get to know Us


We are a team of more than 1700 people sharing one idea: doing our bit in helping our clients create a better future for themselves, by providing them with the tools they need to get where they want to go.


A fully online bank where technology, innovation, simplicity and transparency are the main ingredients, and the first one to work with agile methodologies.


And although we are based in Spain, we are lucky to work in an international bank with presence in more than 40 countries.


We are proud to have a diverse team, and we are committed to continue developing a culture of Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging to foster a culture of collaboration and innovation that represents all collectives in the society.


And even though we look orange on the outside, we are green on the inside. Our ambition in Sustainability is Empowering (y)our Sustainability journey. We are embarking on our path, for us, but we are also there for when our clients decide to embark on this journey.


Making things happen, helping others be successful, always being one step ahead‚Äîthat‚Äôs our DNA. If you look at yourself in the mirror and your reflection matches our way of being and working‚Ä¶we are looking forward to meeting you!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
¬øTienes ganas de dar forma al futuro de los seguros?

En Prima, podr√≠as asumir un reto totalmente nuevo. Como parte de nuestra comunidad global, estar√°s en el asiento del conductor de tu carrera, aprendiendo y creciendo con un equipo de primer nivel a tu alrededor. Prima es un lugar en el que, independientemente de qui√©n seas o cu√°l sea tu funci√≥n, se valora tu voz.

En 2015, nos embarcamos en una misi√≥n: ofrecer un seguro de coche de gran valor dise√±ado para todos. Y hemos recorrido un largo camino, hemos creado una cultura en la que podemos impulsar el √©xito de los dem√°s. Pero necesitamos tu experiencia, ya que dirigimos las cosas en una direcci√≥n nueva y emocionante.

Probablemente est√©s pensando... "Esto suena muy bien". Estamos de acuerdo.

Adem√°s de grandes compa√±eros y proyectos interesantes, hay muchas maneras de ayudarte a hacer el mejor trabajo de tu vida. Hemos configurado nuestra oferta para centrarnos en el bienestar, la autonom√≠a y el desarrollo. Consideramos que los beneficios son el combustible que te permitir√° alcanzar el √©xito si decides embarcarte en este viaje con nosotros.

ü§∏üèΩ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Trabajar de la mejor manera para ti

Creemos en la conciliaci√≥n y la flexibilidad. Tanto si te gusta trabajar desde la oficina, desde casa o una mezcla de ambas. Te ayudaremos a encontrar el equilibrio que mejor se adapte a ti. Incluso tenemos una pol√≠tica que te permite trabajar desde cualquier lugar durante 30 d√≠as al a√±o. Confiamos en ti para que nos ayudes a avanzar.

üèÅ La libertad de explorar las posibilidades

En Prima nos movemos r√°pido, pero nos movemos juntos. Invertimos en tu crecimiento; por eso te daremos acceso a un mercado de ense√±anza y aprendizaje. Y tendr√°s sesiones regulares con tu manager para establecer un plan de crecimiento personal.

üåà Nuestra f√≥rmula ganadora: felices y de alto rendimiento

Desde seguros m√©dicos privados hasta descuentos en gimnasios e iniciativas de bienestar: estamos aqu√≠ para ayudarte. Sabemos lo importantes que son tu salud y tu bienestar, as√≠ que haremos todo lo posible para ayudarte.

Si te parece que tenemos algo para ti, veamos si tienes las aptitudes que buscamos

Te incorporar√°s como Data Analyst en el equipo de Online Sales & Marketing para apoyar a identificar y mejorar iniciativas de crecimiento y de eficiencia del negocio, analizando los principales factores que est√°n afectando y/o condicionando nuestro desempe√±o y resultados en ventas y en retenci√≥n de p√≥lizas.

En concreto, trabajar√°s con los diferentes equipos de Prima, con las siguientes responsabilidades:

Conversi√≥n online


Analizar los factores que impactan la conversi√≥n del funnel de los usuarios que llegan a nuestra p√°gina web por los diferentes canales, apoy√°ndote en el an√°lisis detallado de datos y en las herramientas de an√°lisis web como Google Analytics y Content Square e interactuando con equipos de Product y de UX para identificar mejoras.
Crear y mantener dashboards en Tableau para respaldar las decisiones estrat√©gicas del equipo de Online Sales y dar soporte a los equipos de Product y Product Analytics.
Implementar un sistema de intercambio de datos con otros equipos locales y globales de la compa√±√≠a.
Fomentar iniciativas destinadas a aumentar la conversi√≥n online y mejorar la experiencia de usuario.
Trabajar con nuestros partners externos como Comparadores para mejorar nuestro posicionamiento y darles soporte en desarrollos que mejoren la experiencia de los usuarios y su potencial de conversi√≥n.


Eficiencia operativa


Analizar oportunidades para mejorar la eficiencia del equipo de Atenci√≥n al Cliente, dando soporte al Team Leader, a partir de los datos de las interacciones con clientes.
Fomentar iniciativas destinadas a mejorar los resultados y la contribuci√≥n de los agentes.
Crear dashboards de monitoreo y an√°lisis de desempe√±o con respecto a la fuente, el tipo de interacciones y actividades del cliente para mejorar la eficiencia.


Otras √°reas


Trabajar con otros Data Scientists y Data Analysts de la compa√±√≠a para desarrollar y fortalecer la cultura de datos de Prima, buscando y compartiendo mejores pr√°cticas.
Dar soporte a la Head of Online Sales & Marketing en iniciativas y proyectos estrat√©gicos, como el lanzamiento de nuevos canales online, o la definici√≥n de modelos de atribuci√≥n.


¬øQu√© buscamos?

Title: Product Data Analyst

Extraer y analizar datos directamente desde fuentes como SQL y Google Analytics con un enfoque t√©cnico y proactivo.
Conocimientos en Python/R para procesamiento y an√°lisis avanzado de datos.
Capacidad para procesar y estructurar consultas.
Detectar tendencias en datos hist√≥ricos y proyectar futuros comportamientos para guiar la toma de decisiones.
Medir y validar hip√≥tesis de experimentos y pruebas A/B.
Preparar informes para responder a preguntas clave utilizando herramientas como Looker, Power BI o similares.




En definitiva, colaborar de cerca con Producto, Dise√±o y IT para identificar oportunidades de crecimiento y mejorar la experiencia del usuario con datos.

2-3 a√±os de experiencia en un rol anal√≠tico, aportando insights accionables.

S√≥lidos conocimientos de lenguajes de programaci√≥n y herramientas de an√°lisis y procesamiento de datos: SQL, Python, R.
Base en estad√≠stica y experimentaci√≥n (A/B testing, cohort analysis, modelos de segmentaci√≥n).
Habilidad para visualizar datos y comunicar insights de forma clara y accionable.
Mentalidad anal√≠tica y colaborativa, con ganas de trabajar codo a codo con Producto, Dise√±o y Tech.




¬øC√≥mo estar√°s?

Trabajar√°s en un equipo donde los datos son clave para la estrategia, no un complemento.
Tendr√°s autonom√≠a para explorar y proponer mejoras basadas en insights reales.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Talan is an international advisory group on innovation and transformation through technology, with 5000 employees, and a turnover of 600M‚Ç¨.

We offer our customers a continuum of services to support you at each key stage of your organization's transformation, with 4 main activities:



CONSULTING in management and innovation : supporting business, managerial, cultural, and technological transformations.
DATA & TECHNOLOGY to implement major transformation projects.
CLOUD & APPLICATION SERVICES to build or integrate software solutions.
SERVICE CENTERS of EXCELLENCE to support the latter through technology, innovation, agility, sustainability of skills and cost optimization.



Talan accelerates it's clients' transformation through innovation and technology. By understanding their challenges, with our support, innovation, technology and data, we enable them to be more efficient and resilient.

We believe that only a human oriented-practice of technology will make the new digital age an era of progress for all. Together let's commit!

Job Description


For our client's project, one of the largest banks in Spain, we are looking for a Data Analyst for Reconciliation to join our consultancy team. The ideal candidate will have strong experience in data analysis, backend processing, and reporting tools within an Agile environment.

What would you be doing?





Extract, process, and analyze large datasets to support reconciliation processes.




Develop and maintain data pipelines using Python and PySpark.




Create insightful reports and dashboards with QlikSense or Power BI.




Collaborate with cross-functional teams in an Agile environment (Scrum/Kanban).




Ensure data accuracy and quality while optimizing processes.






Qualifications

What we are looking for?



Education: Bachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent in a related field.




Experience: Minimum of 2 years as a Data Analyst in Delivery projects.




Technical Skills:



Strong proficiency in Python and PySpark for data processing.




Experience with QlikSense or Power BI for data visualization.




Familiarity with Agile methodologies (Scrum/Kanban).






Language: Intermediate English (B2 level).






Additional Information

What do we offer you?



Full-time contract
Smart Office Pack so that you can work comfortably from home.
Training and career development
Benefits and perks such as private medical insurance, life insurance, lunch and travel cards as part of the flexible remuneration package
Possibility to be part of a multicultural team and work on international projects
Hibrid position based in M√°laga, Spain. Realocation is mandatory
Possibility to manage work-permits.



If you are passionate about development & tech, we want to meet you!

Title: Data Analyst, Marketing Analytics
Description:
Who we are:

Want to make an impact? Join our pack and come work (and play!) with us.




We believe everyone deserves the unconditional love of a pet‚Äîand at Rover, our mission is to make it easier to experience that love. Founded in 2011, the Rover app and website connect dog and cat parents with loving pet sitters and dog walkers in neighborhoods across the US, Canada, and Europe. We empower our community of trusted pet sitters and dog walkers to run their own pet care businesses on Rover with the tools and security of a global company to back them.




Headquartered in Seattle, Washington, we work closely with our teams in Barcelona, San Antonio, Spokane, and remote locations. We‚Äôve got a reputation for being a great place to work, having been named among the 100 Best Companies to Work For in Seattle Business Magazine and Washington‚Äôs Best Workplaces in the Puget Sound Business Journal. We're an agile, fast-growing company, and our leadership comes from some of the world's most respected tech companies.




At Rover, our furry coworkers are just as important as our human ones‚Äîand we wouldn‚Äôt have it any other way. Along with making the joys of pet parenthood more accessible, we‚Äôre committed to fostering a diverse, inclusive, and welcoming community of pet people‚Äîand that starts with our employees.




Who we're looking for:

The Marketing Analytics team supports the company‚Äôs marketing efforts, while also working with teams throughout the organization. The analytics team is responsible for a number of business-critical reports and data models that our global marketing teams rely on for daily reporting, budgeting, and analysis. We measure marketing attribution to understand how people become Rover customers, provide campaign reporting to monitor trends in cost efficiency and optimization, deliver lifecycle data to action against a variety of customer behaviors, and narrate the business to identify and prioritize new opportunities.




We are looking for an Analyst to support our Growth, International Expansion, Lifecycle, and SEO stakeholders with a focus on improving our reporting and dashboard structure. The ideal candidate will have experience working closely with business stakeholders and building data-driven narratives that enable clear decision making.




Your Responsibilities:

Work closely with analytics peers and marketing teams to narrate trends and insights, with a particular focus on our customer acquisition marketing programs.
Design reports and dashboards that enable clear, data-driven decision-making for marketing and cross-functional teams.
Refine our marketing attribution models to drive optimal resource allocation across paid and organic marketing channels.
Expand your expertise by supporting experiments such as A/B testing and Market Match tests to optimize strategies across multiple marketing functions.




Your Qualifications:

At least 2 years experience working with complex datasets to support business decision making.
Fluency in SQL.
Data visualisation tool experience (e.g. Mode, Looker, Tableau, etc.)
Ability to adapt your communication style to translate complex data insights for different audiences.
You have experience in owning small-to-medium projects from design to completion with limited guidance from your manager.
You understand when you are blocked, proactively seeking out for help within the team or the organization to move the project forward.




Nice to Have:

Python or R familiarity is helpful, but we welcome candidates eager to develop these skills.
Experience evaluating results of A/B tests as well as expertise in statistical analysis.
Understanding of marketing metrics such as clicks, CPC, CTR, impressions, and unit economics like customer LTV, payback period, and CAC.




Benefits of working at Rover:

Competitive compensation
Long-term incentive plan with a company performance-based cash payout
Permanent contract
Pension Plan
Meal tickets through Cobee
Generous PTO Allowance
Hybrid schedule
Private health insurance
Discounted Gym Membership
Bring your dog to work (and unlimited puppy time)
Monetary help for adopting a dog plus yearly credit to use on our platform
Flexible work hours, sometimes you‚Äôll need to be in at certain times, but on the whole, we‚Äôre pretty flexible when it comes to managing workload and time
Grab snacks, fresh fruit, in our kitchen to keep yourself going
Regular team activities, including happy hours, game nights, and more




Rover is an equal-opportunity employer committed to promoting a diverse, inclusive, and inventive environment with the best employees. We‚Äôre driven by seeing our people succeed and grow, and we work to ensure everyone contributes to their fullest potential. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability, protected veteran status, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable laws, regulations, and ordinances.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst ‚Äì Financial Services

Madrid, Spain - office based work.

Full-Time




About the Company:




My client are a leading financial services firm based in Madrid, dedicated to providing innovative financial solutions to a diverse range of clients. We are seeking a highly motivated and skilled Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. If you are passionate about working with data in the financial sector and want to be a key part of our growth, we want to hear from you!




Key Responsibilities:

Data Analysis: Collect, clean, and analyze large datasets related to financial markets, investment portfolios, trading, and economic indicators.
Financial Insights: Provide actionable insights by analyzing market trends, financial products, and client data to support decision-making processes.
Reporting: Develop and maintain automated dashboards and reports to present key financial metrics and trends to stakeholders.
Modeling & Forecasting: Support the development of predictive models, risk assessments, and forecasting tools to enhance investment strategies.
Collaboration: Work closely with teams across trading, risk management, and finance to ensure data-driven decision-making and business alignment.
Compliance & Accuracy: Ensure data integrity and comply with industry regulations, ensuring accuracy in all reporting and analysis.




Qualifications:




Education: A Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a quantitative field such as Finance, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or Data Science from a top-tier university either globally or within Spain (e.g., Universidad de Barcelona, Universidad Aut√≥noma de Madrid, IE University, or similar).

Experience:




A minimum of 2-3 years of experience working as a Data Analyst within the financial services industry (e.g., investment banks, asset management, trading, financial technology).
Solid understanding of financial data, including equity, bonds, derivatives, and market behavior.




Skills:

Proficiency in data analysis tools such as SQL, Excel, and Python or R.
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau).
Familiarity with financial data sources like Bloomberg, Reuters, or similar platforms.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to synthesize complex financial data into clear insights.
Fluent in English (both written and spoken); proficiency in Spanish is a plus.




What We Offer:

Competitive salary and benefits package.
Opportunities for career advancement and professional development.
A collaborative and dynamic work environment.
The chance to work with cutting-edge financial technologies.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At ING we are looking for a Data analyst

Your Role And Work Environment

We are looking for a talented and enthusiastic Data Analyst to join our Human Connection Strategy Team of Human Connection tribe.

If you are passionate about turning data into actionable insights and enjoy working directly with stakeholders to influence strategic decisions, this role is for you.

We are seeking someone who, in additions to being technically proficient, can translate complex data insights into clear business recommendations, communicate effectively with non-technical audiences, and contribute to driving key initiatives within the organization.

Your Key Responsibilities

As a Data analyst you will:


Translate data into insights that inform strategic and operational decisions across the business.
Work closely with business stakeholders to understand their needs, co-create analytical approaches, and present results in a way that drives action.
Prepare and deliver high-impact presentations and data-driven narratives for senior leadership and cross-functional teams.
Bridge the gap between data and business, ensuring insights are understandable and actionable.
Collaborate with other teams in an International and agile environment, ensuring alignment and consistent communication.


What are we looking for?

Want to know if this job is made for you? These are some of the qualities that we value the most for this role. And if the shoe fits‚Ä¶ don‚Äôt hesitate to apply!

Knows About

For us, a Data analyst is someone who:


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Business, Engineering, or similar.
3-4 years of experience in data analytics, business analytics, consulting, or related roles.
Solid knowledge of SQL and data visualization tools (e.g., power BI, Tableau) python or R is a plus but not essential.
Strong experience in data storytelling and creating business presentations.
Fluent English (spoken and written)
Understanding of business strategy and kpis to connect data insights with tangible business outcomes


Can


Communicate complex data insights clearly and persuasively to non-technical stakeholders.
Proactively identify opportunities where data can add value and influence key decisions.


Loves To


Collaborate in multidisciplinary teams, contributing to both technical and strategic conversations.
Present and defend your ideas with confidence and openness to feedback.


Defines Himself/herself As a


A team player with excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
Flexible, dynamic, and eager to work in fast-paced changing environments.


What do we offer?

The time you spend at work, the challenges you face or the lessons you get are very important, but‚Ä¶ What about your personal life? At ING we want your work to fulfill you in every way, and that is why we take care of even the smallest details.

Check out what is waiting for you!

Be flexible my friend.

Our model is all about flexibility and accountability. Keeping both our customers and our colleagues‚Äô needs in mind, you determine together which days you work at home and which you come to ING MAD to offer your best self. Do your thing.

Restaurant card.

So that thinking about what to have for lunch doesn‚Äôt take up your time or your cravings.

Our house will be your home.

In our offices you can find electric mobility solutions, doctor, hairdresser, gym, The Good Service (to help you with your errands) and much more!

Health insurance.

For you and all your family (spouse/partner and children).

Life insurance.

We help you protect what matters most to you.

Flexible remuneration.

In addition, you will enjoy our flexible remuneration model, through a more tax-advantaged way, you will be able to access other services such as nursery, transport card, training aids‚Ä¶

Free Company Shuttle.

It doesn't matter where you live. We have 6 routes (North, Central, South, A5, A42 and A6) to get you to our ING office in Madrid comfortably.

Banking Benefits.

Special loans with more beneficial conditions.

Special mortgage conditions after 6 months working at the bank.

And you can benefit from our pension plan after 1 month with us!

More vitality and more belonging

360¬∫ care of the employee (physical, mental, social connection & purpose).

Physiotherapy service on site.

Clinics with professional, world-class athletes.

Gympass service.

Employee Networks: Rainbow Lions (LGBTQI+), Leonas & RI√ëG.

International Remote work program.

Get to know Us

We are a team of more than 1700 people sharing one idea: doing our bit in helping our clients create a better future for themselves, by providing them with the tools they need to get where they want to go.

A fully online bank where technology, innovation, simplicity and transparency are the main ingredients, and the first one to work with agile methodologies.

And although we are based in Spain, we are lucky to work in an international bank with presence in more than 40 countries.

We are proud to have a diverse team, and we are committed to continue developing a culture of Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging to foster a culture of collaboration and innovation that represents all collectives in the society.

And even though we look orange on the outside, we are green on the inside. Our ambition in Sustainability is Empowering (y)our Sustainability journey. We are embarking on our path, for us, but we are also there for when our clients decide to embark on this journey.

Making things happen, helping others be successful, always being one step ahead‚Äîthat‚Äôs our DNA. If you look at yourself in the mirror and your reflection matches our way of being and working‚Ä¶we are looking forward to meeting you!

___________________________________________________________

Colaborar en equipos multidisciplinarios, contribuyendo a las conversaciones t√©cnicas y estrat√©gicas.
Presente y defienda sus ideas con confianza y apertura a la retroalimentaci√≥n.


Se Define a S√≠ Mismo Como


Un jugador de equipo con excelentes habilidades interpersonales y de comunicaci√≥n.
Flexible, din√°mico y con ganas de trabajar en entornos cambiantes y de ritmo r√°pido.

El tiempo que pasas en el trabajo, los retos a los que te enfrentas o las lecciones que obtienes son muy importantes, pero... ¬øY tu vida personal? En ING queremos que tu trabajo te llene en todos los sentidos, y por eso cuidamos hasta el m√°s m√≠nimo detalle.

Nuestro modelo se basa en la flexibilidad y la responsabilidad. Teniendo en cuenta las necesidades de nuestros clientes y de nuestros compa√±eros, decid√≠s juntos qu√© d√≠as trabaj√°is en casa y cu√°les acud√≠s a ING MAD para dar lo mejor de m√≠. Haz lo tuyo.

Tarjeta restaurante.

Title: Data Analyst (Data Visualization)
Description:
Title: Data Analyst (Data Visualization)

Location: Barcelona

Length of Contract: Permanent contract




Haybury are working with a global Biotech as they seek a talented and creative Data Analyst who has experience delivery data visualization within Tableau. This is an exciting opportunity whereby you will be delivering key data visualization to global stakeholders to support the decision making process.




The ideal candidate will have experience within data analytics and working with snowflake to develop key business insights using Tableau to achieve this. Alongside this you will also have experience working with front end data to create data visualization







Responsibilities

Design, build, and maintain interactive Tableau dashboards and reports to visualize complex data in a clear, actionable way
Translate business requirements into impactful, user-friendly visualizations tailored to various stakeholder groups
Work with cross functional teams to ensure all data is accurately collected for visualization tasks
Analyze and interpret front-facing datasets to uncover trends, patterns, and insights
Act as the primary point of contact for data visualization and Tableau-related requests
Gather requirements and feedback from end-users to iterate and improve dashboard functionality and relevance
Deliver data analytics and Data visualization reports and dashboards to global stakeholders







Qualifications

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Analytics, Data Science or a closely related field
3+ years' Data Analysis experience
3+ years experience creating data Visualization within Tableau
3+ years working with snowflake
Experience in pharmaceuticals is a bonus




Feel free to reach out to Rory.Pitts@hayburysearch for a confidential conversation or feel free to reach out via LinkedIn.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Description & Requirements

Electronic Arts creates next-level entertainment experiences that inspire players and fans around the world. Here, everyone is part of the story. Part of a community that connects across the globe. A place where creativity thrives, new perspectives are invited, and ideas matter. A team where everyone makes play happen.

EA SPORTS is one of the leading sports entertainment brands in the world, with top-selling videogame franchises, award-winning interactive technology, fan programs, and cross-platform digital experiences. EA SPORTS creates connected experiences that ignite the emotion of sport through industry-leading sports video games, including EA SPORTS Madden NFL, FC, NHL, NBA LIVE, PGA TOUR and UFC.

There are millions of EA SPORTS players generating billions of events every day. We are using the high-volume data streams to detect and anticipate Security threats and issues as soon as they occur. The Game Security Data Analyst will be an essential EA SPORTS Security Team member. Reporting to the Development Director - Game Security, you will support the SOC lead and the Security Data Scientists by ensuring partners can receive and understand relevant information promptly to help keep our Sports games safe and secure.This is a hybrid role that is located in Madrid.

Responsibilities


Analyse data to support business decisions and security operations
Develop business intelligence and reporting solutions
Communicate findings, issues and trade-offs to team members
Adopt a security mindset to predict the adversary's moves and ensure the right Data is available to detect them.
Think and solve complex data problems in a maintainable and scalable fashion


Required Qualifications


2 years experience
Proficiency with SQL and no-SQL databases.
Knowledge and experience with data gathering, analysis, and visualization tools
Some knowledge and experience working with Python
Experience with data visualizations in tools such as Tableau, Power BI, Looker


About Electronic Arts

We‚Äôre proud to have an extensive portfolio of games and experiences, locations around the world, and opportunities across EA. We value adaptability, resilience, creativity, and curiosity. From leadership that brings out your potential, to creating space for learning and experimenting, we empower you to do great work and pursue opportunities for growth.

We take a holistic approach with our benefits program, focusing on physical, emotional, financial, career, and community wellness to support a balanced life with paid time off and new parent leave, plus free games and so much more. We nurture environments where our teams can always bring their best to what they do.

Electronic Arts is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will also consider employment qualified applicants with criminal records in accordance with applicable law. EA also makes workplace accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities as required by applicable law.

Description:
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, and more freedom. Since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. Our powerhouse of products ‚Äî including spending, saving, investing, exchanging, travelling, and more ‚Äî help our 50+ million customers get more from their money every day.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‚Äå 2 things are essential to our success: our people and our culture. In recognition of our outstanding employee experience, we've been certified as a Great Place to Work‚Ñ¢. So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our offices and remotely, to help us achieve our mission. And we're looking for more brilliant people. People who love building great products, redefining success, and turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. Our Data Analysts aren‚Äôt kept in the background, doomed to never see the impact of their work. They‚Äôre some of our best and brightest problem solvers, deployed to the front-lines to work in Product Teams and deliver rock star solutions.

We‚Äôre looking for a superstar Data Analysts who don't believe there's a data task that can be too hard. From digging into our complex databases, looking for the root cause of a problem to designing their own solutions and writing their own code to implement them. In this process, they never stop learning, picking up new skills, and delivering value.

Up for the challenge? Get in touch.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing


Supporting the Finance team in controlling market products, including market making and treasury investments
Analysing and optimising financial control and treasury management activities
Understanding business processes through financial data and ensuring accuracy from booking to accounting
Developing Price Verification Models to ensure accurate valuation of financial products
Automating financial controls to improve efficiency and compliance
Designing and implementing reconciliation logic for balance accuracy
Creating and maintaining dashboards to track key financial metrics
Collaborating with Market Making, Treasury, and Financial Control teams to enhance reporting and decision-making


What You'll Need


5+ years of experience working with Data Analysis and creating impactful solutions
Ability to manage a team and stakeholders
Excellent background / education in a quantitative discipline
Great skills with Python, SQL, or other programming languages
Evidence of strong mathematical and statistics knowledge


Nice to have


Advanced degree in a core STEM subject
Previous experience working on a Finance department


Building a global financial super app isn‚Äôt enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that‚Äôs why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We‚Äôre doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That‚Äôs why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Important notice for candidates:

Job scams are on the rise. Please keep these guidelines in mind when applying for any open roles.


Only apply through official Revolut channels. We don‚Äôt use any third-party services or platforms for our recruitment.
Always double-check the emails you receive. Make sure all communications are being done through official Revolut emails, with an @revolut.com domain.


We won't ask for payment or personal financial information during the hiring process. If anyone does ask you for this, it‚Äôs a scam. Report it immediately.

By submitting this application, I confirm that all the information given by me in this application for employment and any additional documents attached hereto are true to the best of my knowledge and that I have not wilfully suppressed any material fact. I confirm I have disclosed if applicable any previous employment with Revolut. I accept that if any of the information given by me in this application is in any way false or incorrect, my application may be rejected, any offer of employment may be withdrawn or my employment with Revolut may be terminated summarily or I may be dismissed. By submitting this application, I agree that my personal data will be processed in accordance with Revolut's <a class="postings-link" href="https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Candidate Privacy Notice
