Title: Data Analyst (Tableau/SQL)_ ENGLISH- PHARMA
Description:
HAYS is collaborating with the leading company in the pharmaceutical sector, TOP 10 pharma.

They create innovative medicines for people and animals, adding value through innovation for all three business areas: human pharmaceuticals, animal health, and contract manufacturing of biopharmaceuticals. Now they are growing in animal area too, it was created 3 years ago. Our client is forming a technological hub that will serve the entire group internationally. It is growing and has more than 400 specialists. This hub is located in San Cugat del Vall√©s.




We are looking for a Data Analyst (Tableau/SQL) to expand their team.




What will your duties be?




Connect with different markets around the globe and understand their data
Organize data in a way it can be used and analyzed in an efficient way across markets and stakeholders
Analyze / interpret this data to extract business value and
Clear Communication of your findings to the stakeholders
Deliver according to high standards with regards to consistency, usability and quality
Extraction, Organization, Analysis and Reporting - Data/Business




Which are the ideal requirements?




5 years progressive work experience in data management and/or data modelling
Demonstrated expertise defining KPIs to drive business performance
Highly skilled in SQL, Exasol, Tableau and data visualization techniques or similar tools.
Ability to negotiate and influence across a matrix & cross-functional organization.
Experience working with Snowflake is a big plus.
Good judgment in evaluating benefits and risks and providing sound recommendations.
English fluent
Good communication and mediation skills and Strong results orientation. Ability to plan and organize work. Observation, interviewing and listening skills.




What we offer?




Participate in international projects. Young and dynamic environment
Flexible schedule (Monday to Friday from 8 - 9 to 5 - 6).
Hybrid position. Buffet Onsite. Location: Sant Cugat del Vall√®s (Barcelona)
Contract by Hays in a long project (Indefinido)







If you like to work in global environments and a good working environment, do not hesitate to sign up for the offer!! We will contact you as soon as possible!!

Title: Analista de datos
Description:
Descripci√≥n de la entidad




Asistencia Sanitaria Colegial, SA de Seguros es una entidad cuyo objeto consiste en el ejercicio de la actividad aseguradora directa en los ramos de enfermedad, incluida la asistencia sanitaria, y accidentes. Su actividad se desarrolla en Catalunya, principalmente en la provincia de Barcelona.

Asimismo, Asistencia Sanitaria es la entidad dominante del grupo asegurador del mismo nombre.




En nuestra Entidad, como organizaci√≥n de tipo cooperativo integrada por m√©dicos, somos conscientes y nos tomamos muy en serio el encargo de hacer posible y sostenible un tipo de medicina social que permita proporcionar, por un lado, la atenci√≥n √≥ptima al paciente y, por otra, unas condiciones justas para que los profesionales de la salud puedan ejercer su vocaci√≥n.

Gesti√≥n y mantenimiento de bases de datos de la Entidad.
An√°lisis espec√≠ficos de negocio.
Reporting peri√≥dico a Direcci√≥n y otros Departamentos de la Entidad.
Definici√≥n y explotaci√≥n de KPI de negocio.
Apoyo en la explotaci√≥n de datos en otras √°reas de la Entidad.




Qu√© esperamos de ti




Titulaci√≥n m√≠nima de Licenciatura, Grado o M√°ster en Estad√≠stica, ADE u otras disciplinas relativas a la econom√≠a y / o gesti√≥n de datos.
Experiencia m√≠nima de 4 a√±os en posiciones similares.
Catal√°n y castellano nativo con un dominio perfecto tanto en escritura como en lectura.
Ofim√°tica avanzada.
Conocimiento del lenguaje SQL (MySQL).
Conocimiento de gesti√≥n de bases de datos.
Valorable conocimiento de Tableau.
Capacidad anal√≠tica.
Capacidad de aprendizaje.
Compromiso con la empresa.
Trabajar en equipo.
Habilidades ofim√°ticas.
Capacidad de comunicaci√≥n.
Iniciativa y autonom√≠a en la gesti√≥n.




Qu√© te vamos a ofrecer




Contrato indefinido, crece con nosotros.
Horario con jornada partida de lunes a jueves (con flexibilidad de 1 hora), viernes y agosto jornada intensiva.
En Asistencia Sanitaria te ofrecemos el mejor entorno para que puedas desarrollarte profesionalmente.
Tendr√°s muy buen clima laboral.
Como empresa de salud, lo primero que nos importa es la tuya, para ello, tendr√°s p√≥liza de salud para ti, tu pareja e hijos menores de 26 a√±os totalmente gratuita.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Our Organization

Dow Jones is a global provider of news and business information, delivering content to consumers and organizations around the world across multiple formats, including print, digital, mobile and live events. Dow Jones has produced unrivaled quality content for more than 130 years and today has one of the world's largest news-gathering operations globally. It is home to leading publications and products including the flagship Wall Street Journal, America's largest newspaper by paid circulation; Barron's, MarketWatch, Mansion Global, Financial News, Investor's Business Daily, Factiva, Dow Jones Risk & Compliance, Dow Jones Newswires, OPIS and Chemical Market Analytics. Dow Jones is a division of News Corp (Nasdaq: NWS, NWSA; ASX: NWS, NWSLV).

About The Team

Our Technology team drives the evolution of our Technology, Engineering, Data, Product and User Experience functions. With a keen focus on delivering cutting-edge solutions, we shape the digital landscape for our customers, readers, and users. From revolutionizing visuals to optimizing tools and harnessing the power of data, mobile, video, and social platforms, our team is committed to providing a seamless and immersive experience across all touchpoints. Collaborating closely with our newsrooms and strategic partners, we spearhead the development of groundbreaking products and technologies.

About The Role

The B2C Analytics team focuses on developing analytics solutions to help the organization make better data driven decisions. Our team is passionate about enabling others to use data and analysis to measure and monitor performance, identify risks and opportunities and find ways to continually add value.

You will primarily support the Consumer side of the business, which includes WSJ, Barron's, MarketWatch and more; but may also include exposure to other areas of the business, such as advertising and the professional information business. The ideal candidate will have previous experience in developing datasets, dashboards and data solutions that drive core insights. You will report to the Senior Manager, B2C Analytics.

You Will

Develop Stakeholder Partnerships


Develop strong partnerships with Product, Marketing, Newsroom, Finance, Data Collection, Data Engineering and other B2C Stakeholder Business teams and work across all levels and areas of the organization.
Executie data project roadmaps based on Business teams' priorities.


Understand B2C Data


Build a deep understanding of all the B2C data sources that we leverage in our Analysis projects
Partner with data engineers and data collection colleagues to collect, cleanse and organize data.


Conduct Analysis, Create Dashboards, Improve Processes & Ensure Quality


Analyze large datasets to surface trends and deliver recommendations with tangible business outcomes.
Create intuitive reports, dashboards and data solutions using visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, Looker Studio)
Continuously identify ways to improve and streamline processes around data and reporting
Ensure the quality of data and reporting, and partner with teams to improve accuracy and consistency


Clearly Communicate


Communicate technical information clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences


You Have


Team oriented and collaborative with eagerness to help others, and aspiration to be challenged and learn
Self starter able to work independently, coordinate with multiple partners and complete projects start to finish
Detail oriented with focus on assuring quality, consistency and accuracy in data and processes

HTML:
About Our Organization

Dow Jones is a global provider of news and business information, delivering content to consumers and organizations around the world across multiple formats, including print, digital, mobile and live events. Dow Jones has produced unrivaled quality content for more than 130 years and today has one of the world's largest news-gathering operations globally. It is home to leading publications and products including the flagship Wall Street Journal, America's largest newspaper by paid circulation; Barron's, MarketWatch, Mansion Global, Financial News, Investor's Business Daily, Factiva, Dow Jones Risk & Compliance, Dow Jones Newswires, OPIS and Chemical Market Analytics. Dow Jones is a division of News Corp (Nasdaq: NWS, NWSA; ASX: NWS, NWSLV).

About The Team

Our Technology team drives the evolution of our Technology, Engineering, Data, Product and User Experience functions. With a keen focus on delivering cutting-edge solutions, we shape the digital landscape for our customers, readers, and users. From revolutionizing visuals to optimizing tools and harnessing the power of data, mobile, video, and social platforms, our team is committed to providing a seamless and immersive experience across all touchpoints. Collaborating closely with our newsrooms and strategic partners, we spearhead the development of groundbreaking products and technologies.

About The Role

The B2C Analytics team focuses on developing analytics solutions to help the organization make better data driven decisions. Our team is passionate about enabling others to use data and analysis to measure and monitor performance, identify risks and opportunities and find ways to continually add value.

You will primarily support the Consumer side of the business, which includes WSJ, Barron's, MarketWatch and more; but may also include exposure to other areas of the business, such as advertising and the professional information business. The ideal candidate will have previous experience in developing datasets, dashboards and data solutions that drive core insights. You will report to the Senior Manager, B2C Analytics.

You Will

Develop Stakeholder Partnerships

  • Develop strong partnerships with Product, Marketing, Newsroom, Finance, Data Collection, Data Engineering and other B2C Stakeholder Business teams and work across all levels and areas of the organization.
  • Executie data project roadmaps based on Business teams' priorities.

Understand B2C Data

  • Build a deep understanding of all the B2C data sources that we leverage in our Analysis projects
  • Partner with data engineers and data collection colleagues to collect, cleanse and organize data.

Conduct Analysis, Create Dashboards, Improve Processes & Ensure Quality

  • Analyze large datasets to surface trends and deliver recommendations with tangible business outcomes.
  • Create intuitive reports, dashboards and data solutions using visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, Looker Studio)
  • Continuously identify ways to improve and streamline processes around data and reporting
  • Ensure the quality of data and reporting, and partner with teams to improve accuracy and consistency

Clearly Communicate

  • Communicate technical information clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences

You Have

  • Team oriented and collaborative with eagerness to help others, and aspiration to be challenged and learn
  • Self starter able to work independently, coordinate with multiple partners and complete projects start to finish
  • Detail oriented with focus on assuring quality, consistency and accuracy in data and processes
  • Undergraduate degree or equivalent in combination of training and experience, preferably in a quantitative field such as Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or related disciplines.
  • Experience working with large datasets in a fast-paced and fluid environment with the ability to understand and solve complex non-routine problems.
  • Experience with SQL and strong knowledge of Excel/Sheets required. Familiarity with Github, Python/R preferred.
  • Experience with web analytics tools (particularly Google Analytics 4 and Adobe Analytics) is a plus.
  • Experience with data visualizations tools and techniques, and using data to tell a story (e.g. Tableau, Looker)

Company Description

THE WORLD OF UBISOFT

Ubisoft‚Äôs 19,000 team members, working across more than 30 countries around the world, are bound by a common mission to enrich players‚Äô lives with original and memorable gaming experiences. Their commitment and talent have brought to life many acclaimed franchises such as Assassin‚Äôs Creed, Far Cry, Watch Dogs, Just Dance, Rainbow Six, and many more to come. Ubisoft is an equal opportunity employer that believes diverse backgrounds and perspectives are key to creating worlds where both players and teams can thrive and express themselves. If you are excited about solving game-changing challenges, cutting edge technologies and pushing the boundaries of entertainment, we invite you to join our journey and help us create the unknown.

Ubisoft Barcelona Mobile‚ÄØbrings together dedicated and experienced professionals that are focused on crafting high-quality F2P games for mobile. We strongly believe in the core values at the centre of our Ubilife, which encourage us to take ownership of our work, continually striving for excellence while promoting the sharing of knowledge across individuals and teams, without losing our sense of enjoyment and fun, while taking care for one another. We strive for a safe and respectful workplace for all team members and we‚Äôre transparent about the measures we are taking to do so. For this reason, Ubisoft‚Äôs Code of Conduct has been released publicly on our corporate website for all current and future team members.

Do you want to join us in the world of mobile gaming? If so, read on!

Job Description

YOUR DAILY ADVENTURE

Ubisoft Barcelona Mobile is currently seeking a Data Analyst to help our team on their next adventure. The Data Analyst will support insight initiatives for our BI team. This person will report to the Live Producer. Your daily adventure:



Turning data into actionable insights, by performing hands-on research, data exploration and analysis, to drive decisions and strategies for user acquisition, retention, and monetization.
Work with the game teams to provide insights into user behaviour, answer key business questions and support in AB test design and analysis.
Carry out projects on machine learning for behavioural segmentation and monetization.
Debugging and problem-solving issues to ensure the delivery of accurate and clear analysis, reports and tools.
Effectively communicate results and insights to senior stakeholders throughout the organization.
Coordinate, challenge and share the best analytical practices and methods within the organization.
Stay up to date with the latest developments in Machine Learning technologies and Data Science trends.
Contribute to the knowledge base and culture of the team.



Qualifications

YOUR SKILLS

Are you serious about fun? Do you consistently seek out learning opportunities and aim to beat your high score? Are you open to new ideas, perspectives and cultures and believe that it takes a world to build a world? At Ubisoft, you‚Äôll work alongside passionate and talented teams who are imagining the future of entertainment.



Master's degree in a quantitative field (i.e. Physics, Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science, Data Science...). PhD in any of these disciplines is a plus.
5+ years relevant work experience in similar positions, ideally in mobile gaming industry.
Highly proficient in SQL as well as Python for data exploratory analysis
Experience with cloud-based big data solutions such as Redshift, BigQuery.
Solid knowledge of data visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker, Microstrategy, etc.
Robust understanding of advanced statistics suitable for analysis of skewed populations.
Experience designing effective ways of communicating, visualising and reporting results/analysis.
Experience in predictive analytics and segmentation.
Excellent problem-solving capabilities with strong attention to details.
Work permit for Spain obtained prior to applying for the position is a must.



What can make you stand out:



Experience with Agile philosophies (e.g.: Scrum, Kanban, XP) and project management tools (e.g.: JIRA)
Software engineering skills, including best practices like CI/CD and Git.
Self-motivation, organization skills, team spirit, proactivity.
Passion for games. Interest in mobile F2P games.



Additional Information

YOUR LIFE AT UBISOFT BARCELONA MOBILE (and PERKS)



Hybrid Work Model
Possibility for new parents to work from home 80% of the time.
Flex working schedule:‚ÄØ40hrs per week with start time between 8 AM ‚Äì 10 AM and leave from 5 PM (Friday from 2 PM).
Reduced schedule‚ÄØ(35 hrs per week) in July and August, Easter, Christmas holidays, and special days like Sant Jordi and Revetlla de Sant Joan.
Personal Matters Hours:‚ÄØ24 hours paid for by Ubisoft that you can use for personal matters.
Holidays:‚ÄØ25 days per year + 1 day in your‚ÄØUbi-Birthday.
5 extra holiday‚ÄØdays‚ÄØon the year you celebrate your 5th/10th/15th/20th year with us.
Ticket Restaurant: 200‚Ç¨ per month, and‚ÄØFlexible compensation plan‚ÄØ(Ticket Transport & Ticket Nursery).
Health insurance‚ÄØwith Cigna, including‚ÄØPhysiotherapist & Psychology sessions‚ÄØwith a reduced price.
Life Insurance‚ÄØwith AXA.
Mobile Device‚ÄØGrant‚ÄØof 400 EUR‚ÄØstarting on your 1st year in the company.

Professional development training & programs, based upon request.

Locally roasted craft coffee‚ÄØby INCAPTO (it‚Äôs very, very good).

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

THE WORLD OF UBISOFT

Ubisoft‚Äôs 19,000 team members, working across more than 30 countries around the world, are bound by a common mission to enrich players‚Äô lives with original and memorable gaming experiences. Their commitment and talent have brought to life many acclaimed franchises such as Assassin‚Äôs Creed, Far Cry, Watch Dogs, Just Dance, Rainbow Six, and many more to come. Ubisoft is an equal opportunity employer that believes diverse backgrounds and perspectives are key to creating worlds where both players and teams can thrive and express themselves. If you are excited about solving game-changing challenges, cutting edge technologies and pushing the boundaries of entertainment, we invite you to join our journey and help us create the unknown.

Ubisoft Barcelona Mobile‚ÄØbrings together dedicated and experienced professionals that are focused on crafting high-quality F2P games for mobile. We strongly believe in the core values at the centre of our Ubilife, which encourage us to take ownership of our work, continually striving for excellence while promoting the sharing of knowledge across individuals and teams, without losing our sense of enjoyment and fun, while taking care for one another. We strive for a safe and respectful workplace for all team members and we‚Äôre transparent about the measures we are taking to do so. For this reason, Ubisoft‚Äôs Code of Conduct has been released publicly on our corporate website for all current and future team members.

Do you want to join us in the world of mobile gaming? If so, read on!

Job Description

YOUR DAILY ADVENTURE

Ubisoft Barcelona Mobile is currently seeking a Data Analyst to help our team on their next adventure. The Data Analyst will support insight initiatives for our BI team. This person will report to the Live Producer. Your daily adventure:



Turning data into actionable insights, by performing hands-on research, data exploration and analysis, to drive decisions and strategies for user acquisition, retention, and monetization.
Work with the game teams to provide insights into user behaviour, answer key business questions and support in AB test design and analysis.
Carry out projects on machine learning for behavioural segmentation and monetization.
Debugging and problem-solving issues to ensure the delivery of accurate and clear analysis, reports and tools.
Effectively communicate results and insights to senior stakeholders throughout the organization.
Coordinate, challenge and share the best analytical practices and methods within the organization.
Stay up to date with the latest developments in Machine Learning technologies and Data Science trends.
Contribute to the knowledge base and culture of the team.



Qualifications

YOUR SKILLS

Are you serious about fun? Do you consistently seek out learning opportunities and aim to beat your high score? Are you open to new ideas, perspectives and cultures and believe that it takes a world to build a world? At Ubisoft, you‚Äôll work alongside passionate and talented teams who are imagining the future of entertainment.



Master's degree in a quantitative field (i.e. Physics, Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science, Data Science...). PhD in any of these disciplines is a plus.
5+ years relevant work experience in similar positions, ideally in mobile gaming industry.
Highly proficient in SQL as well as Python for data exploratory analysis
Experience with cloud-based big data solutions such as Redshift, BigQuery.
Solid knowledge of data visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker, Microstrategy, etc.
Robust understanding of advanced statistics suitable for analysis of skewed populations.
Experience designing effective ways of communicating, visualising and reporting results/analysis.
Experience in predictive analytics and segmentation.
Excellent problem-solving capabilities with strong attention to details.
Work permit for Spain obtained prior to applying for the position is a must.



What can make you stand out:



Experience with Agile philosophies (e.g.: Scrum, Kanban, XP) and project management tools (e.g.: JIRA)
Software engineering skills, including best practices like CI/CD and Git.
Self-motivation, organization skills, team spirit, proactivity.
Passion for games. Interest in mobile F2P games.



Additional Information

YOUR LIFE AT UBISOFT BARCELONA MOBILE (and PERKS)



Hybrid Work Model
Possibility for new parents to work from home 80% of the time.
Flex working schedule:‚ÄØ40hrs per week with start time between 8 AM ‚Äì 10 AM and leave from 5 PM (Friday from 2 PM).
Reduced schedule‚ÄØ(35 hrs per week) in July and August, Easter, Christmas holidays, and special days like Sant Jordi and Revetlla de Sant Joan.
Personal Matters Hours:‚ÄØ24 hours paid for by Ubisoft that you can use for personal matters.
Holidays:‚ÄØ25 days per year + 1 day in your‚ÄØUbi-Birthday.
5 extra holiday‚ÄØdays‚ÄØon the year you celebrate your 5th/10th/15th/20th year with us.
Ticket Restaurant: 200‚Ç¨ per month, and‚ÄØFlexible compensation plan‚ÄØ(Ticket Transport & Ticket Nursery).
Health insurance‚ÄØwith Cigna, including‚ÄØPhysiotherapist & Psychology sessions‚ÄØwith a reduced price.
Life Insurance‚ÄØwith AXA.
Mobile Device‚ÄØGrant‚ÄØof 400 EUR‚ÄØstarting on your 1st year in the company.
Language trainings‚ÄØin English, Spanish, and French.
Professional development training & programs, based upon request.
Ubisoft games with discount‚ÄØand Uplay PC for free.
Locally roasted craft coffee‚ÄØby INCAPTO (it‚Äôs very, very good).

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About us

For more than 20 years, our global network of passionate technologists and pioneering craftspeople has delivered cutting-edge technology and game-changing consulting to companies on the brink of AI driven digital transformation. Since 2001, we have grown into a full service digital consulting company with 5500+ professionals working on a worldwide ambition. Driven by the desire to make a difference, we keep innovating. Fuelling the growth of our company with our knowledge worker culture. When teaming up with Xebia, expect in-depth expertise based on an authentic, value-led, and high quality way of working that inspires all we do.




About the Role

We are looking for a seasoned Analyst and Data Visualisation Expert to support the data science and analytics team focused on Direct To Consumer data products. The ideal candidate is a great storyteller and strong technical contributor who has experience solving business problems with data-driven tools. You will be responsible for delivering a suite of analytical products including analyses, dashboards, insights, and recommendations with especial focus on clickstream data. You will collect, analyze, and present data to improve strategic decision making and to track the benefits unlocked by the data products. You should have a high degree of curiosity about the business and the skills to discover impactful insights from data. You should be able to communicate those insights in a way that builds confidence and enables decisions that drive business value.




Responsibilities

Conduct analysis to estimate expected value of data products. Measure and track benefits created by data products, and convert them to financial or key KPI metrics
Support business stakeholders and regional data analysts by understanding their needs and providing guidance and support.
Create dashboards to track adoption and business impact of features and data product launched.
Dive deep into complex business problems and provide insights on digital features and AI model performance through hypothesis testing. Partner with cross functional teams on implementation.
Partner with data science, data analytics and product managers on planning, goal setting and prioritization.
Partner with data and engineering teams to improve instrumentation and product/models health reporting, pre/post analysis and business debugging.
Partner with A/B test team to design experiments and post-hoc analysis of results.
Bring data to life through storytelling in a clear and meaningful way to audiences with mixed levels of technical expertise and informing key strategic decisions.
Promote a culture of data driven technical excellence, ownership, collaboration.




Your background

3+ years of professional experience analysing complex data, drawing conclusions, and making recommendations.
3+ years of applied data visualization experience. Tableau and PowerBI as main visualization tools.
3+ years of experience in extracting & manipulating large data sets from various relational databases using SQL (Amazon Redshift, Oracle, Google BigQuery).
Coding skills in at least one statistical or programming language (R or Python preferred) to import, summarise, and analyse data.
Hands on experience working with big data, ideally clickstream data, in big data volume sectors such as ecommerce, gaming, social network etc. e-commerce platforms are a plus.
Ability to translate and present complex analysis in executive summaries. Clear and effective written and verbal communication and strong interpersonal skills.
Strong problem solving skills.
Bachelor's in economics, Statistics, Data, Data Science and Engineering (Masters is a plus) or equivalent experience.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:

Are you someone who gets excited about turning raw data into real impact? üìä At FERO, we're on the lookout for a Junior Data Analyst who's eager to dig deep into data, support internal reporting, investigate issues, and bring clarity to complex questions across teams‚Äîfrom ops and product to sales and customer success. You‚Äôll be a key player in driving data excellence, supporting strategic decisions, and helping us grow smarter, faster. üöÄ




Who We Are

We're FERO, a high-growth startup reinventing the checkout and payment experience üí≥ to help our customers increase conversions and revenue. Backed by top-tier VCs, we‚Äôre building our future from the heart of Madrid, combining cutting-edge tech üñ•Ô∏è with a collaborative, data-driven culture.




We offer:




üí∞ Competitive pay

ü©ª Half sponsored Private Health Insurance

‚ú® The chance to make a real difference in an environment that values curiosity, creativity, and impact




What You'll Do




üîé Investigate and Analyse: Support incident investigations and root-cause analyses with data insights and exploratory analysis.

ü§ù Enable Sales & Success Teams: Help prepare data-driven materials and insights for customer proof-of-concepts and strategic conversations.

üßπ Push Data Quality: Help monitor data pipelines, identify inconsistencies, and contribute to cleaner, more reliable datasets.

üìä Internal Reporting & Dashboards: Help design and maintain reports that provide clear visibility into key business metrics.

üîó Work Cross-Functionally: Collaborate with engineering, product, and business stakeholders to answer critical questions and support decision-making.

üìö Build Data Culture: Help foster data literacy and support the adoption of better data practices throughout the company.




What We Offer




üß† Innovative Environment: Work on cutting-edge solutions in a greenfield setting.

üå± Growth Opportunities: Join us early and grow with us professionally and personally.

ü§ó Collaborative Culture: Be part of a friendly, creative, and supportive team.

üè† Flexible Work: Hybrid model - 3 days in office, 2 days WFH.

üíº Competitive Compensation: Great pay, employee equity, and private health insurance partially sponsored by FERO.

Who You Are

üßê Analytically Curious: You love exploring messy datasets, spotting patterns, and figuring out what the data really says.

üêç Python Fluent: Comfortable using Python (e.g., Pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib, Seaborn, etc.) for data cleaning, analysis, and basic visualisations.

üó£Ô∏è Clear Communicator: Able to present findings in a structured, simple, and actionable way - both in writing and in conversation.

üîç Detail-Oriented: You have an eye for accuracy and consistency when working with data.

Ready to Join Us?

Title: Master Data Analyst
Description:
We are seeking a detail-oriented and Master Data Management (MDM) Analyst to join our dynamic team.

The ideal candidate will conduct quantitative and qualitative analysis across various projects to optimise company growth and business. You will manipulate datasets, create financial models, and summarise findings in a succinct manner for client's usage.




Responsibilities




Compile data into actionable reports
Prepare pitch and presentation materials
Work collaboratively with team members
Think strategically about improving company operations




Qualifications




Bachelor's degree in Business or Economics or related discipline 1 - 3 years of experience working with data in a related field
Fluency in Microsoft Office suite (Outlook, Excel, Word, PowerPoint, etc.)
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with attention to detail.
Ability to work with people from many different cultural backgrounds.
Autonomous and organised
Ability to deal effectively with pressure
Be an organised thinker who can create order from complex situation
Fluency in English




If you are a dedicated MDM professional with a passion for data integrity and compliance, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity. Join our team and help us achieve excellence in master data management.




-------

Title: Business Data Analyst
HTML:
Are we the best-kept secret in M√°laga?

We like to think so. Over the past year, our M√°laga hub has grown into a thriving center of excellence, where we combine innovation, collaboration, and opportunity. We are serious about finding the right people and are confident that we have a lot to offer.


The role in a nutshell

Are you passionate about leveraging data to make meaningful business improvements? As a Business Data Analyst within the Coupa Global Reporting & Governance team, you will be instrumental in enabling datadriven decision-making and fostering continuous improvement. Your goal? To turn data insights into actionable strategies that enhance contract compliance, boost supplier performance, and streamline operational efficiency. In this role, you will collaborate closely with diverse stakeholders, acting as a vital link between business needs and technical capabilities. Your responsibilities will include gathering and validating business requirements, translating them into technical specifications, and ensuring user-friendly reporting solutions meet organizational goals. You will uphold best practices in data quality, work towards impactful reporting outcomes, and create a data-driven culture across our global Coupa landscape. With opportunities for growth in a stimulating and innovative environment, you will develop cost-saving initiatives, enhance business processes, and maintain compliance with audit requirements. If you thrive on advancing improvements through data and working in a collaborative global team, this role is your next career move!


More specifically, you will be expected to:

‚Ä¢ Analyze trends and patterns in Power BI reports to identify areas for improvement, such as contract compliance and supplier performance;

‚Ä¢ Monitor catalogue growth and drive initiatives to increase on-catalogue purchasing and reduce offcatalogue spend;

‚Ä¢ Evaluate purchasing trends to enhance contract compliance and support cost-saving strategies;

‚Ä¢ Track payment schedules to maximize early payment discounts and optimize cost efficiency;

‚Ä¢ Implement initiatives to reduce cycle times for requisitions, invoice processing, and supplier onboarding;

‚Ä¢ Advocate for electronic invoicing to improve accuracy and streamline processes;

‚Ä¢ Gather, validate, and document business requirements for reporting projects;

‚Ä¢ Support data standardization efforts to enhance reporting accuracy and consistency;

‚Ä¢ Act as a liaison between business stakeholders and technical teams to ensure reporting solutions align with strategic goals;

‚Ä¢ Develop training programs and user guides to empower end users in utilizing reports effectively


Do you have what it takes?

‚Ä¢ Skilled at interpreting data and providing actionable business insights;

‚Ä¢ Advanced skills in Power BI and Excel; SAP experience is beneficial.

‚Ä¢ Solid interpersonal and communication skills to engage with and collaborate efficiently across teams;

‚Ä¢ High accuracy and a focus on maintaining data quality in reporting outputs;

‚Ä¢ Quick to identify and address operational and technical issues;

‚Ä¢ Significant experience in increasing efficiencies and optimizing workflows;

‚Ä¢ Experience working across procurement, finance, or accounts payable functions;

‚Ä¢ Ability to develop and deliver clear training materials for diverse user groups.


Language : As you will be part of a global team, you are expected to communicate fluently in English (verbal and written). Knowledge of other languages such as French, German, or Spanish is favorable but not mandatory.


Travel: Some occasional travelling will be required.


Location: This role will ideally be based at our Malaga office, but we could consider other suitable locations


Wondering what‚Äôs in it for you?

üÜô Be part of a world class organization with a mandate to identify opportunities for improvement and drive performance benefits

üè† Hybrid Work

üí∞ Competitive compensation structure

üë®‚Äçüë©‚Äçüëß‚Äçüë¶ Health Insurance coverage for you and your dependents

üõü Life Insurance

üìà Growth Opportunities (career progression, tuition assistance, language courses, training and certifications, etc.)

üõ¨ Relocation assistance


If you are ready to join our diverse team, make a difference and advance your career in a global setting, we want to hear from you.

Join us and help shape the future of data-driven procurement and finance processes! Given the global nature of the role, we ask applicants to submit their resume in English and indicate their working rights status.

Glencore encourages diversity and provides an inclusive workplace.

Accommodations are available upon request for applicants with special needs.

Interviews may start prior to the closing date.

Title: Data Analyst & Reporting Specialist
Description:
Join Openbank, the 100% digital bank of the Santander Group, where innovation meets opportunity! With over 2 million customers across Spain, Germany, the Netherlands, Portugal, we're leading the way in digital banking. From loans and mortgages to a cutting-edge, fully automated investment platform, our products are transforming the industry.

At Openbank, we pride ourselves on simplicity, agility, and security, earning us the title of the most recommended Spanish bank among our customers. Technology is in our DNA and we are constantly developing new digital solutions and products. And we're not stopping there! At Openbank we are proud to be a bank that is gaining more and more international presence, we have just landed in the United States and Mexico.




If you're passionate about digital innovation, eager to make an impact, and ready to be part of a dynamic and forward-thinking company, then we want to hear from you! Join us and be part of our journey to redefine banking for the digital age!




Mission & Role:

In this role, you will be responsible for analyzing and extracting insights from large datasets from various sources in our AWS Datalake, to solve complex business problems. You will work closely with data engineers to implement scalable solutions and ensure that the data you work with is clean and reliable. You will be expected to create actionable results through statistical analysis, data visualization, and software development, enabling decision-making across different teams. You will also play a key role in supporting the team‚Äôs efforts to use data more effectively and to automate key business processes.




You will work in a transparent environment where knowledge-sharing and open communication are encouraged. As a team player, you‚Äôll engage with others to reach common goals, making sure to balance both the big picture and fine details.




You will apply your knowledge of statistical analysis and experience with tools like Python or Spark to implement solutions and provide clear insights. Additionally, you will help design and produce efficient data pipelines, contributing to the success of the team and its projects.




To be successful in the role you must bring:

At least +3 years of experience in Statistical Analysis: Strong knowledge of basic statistical concepts and the ability to implement them in programming languages such as Python or Spark. You know when to use different statistical indicators and have experience summarizing insights from data.
Experience with Large Datasets: Familiarity with working on large datasets and implementing scalable solutions. You understand data cleaning, and you know how to collaborate effectively with data engineers.
Problem-Solving with Data: Ability to break down complex problems into manageable analytical components and reuse existing solutions from previous projects.
Software Development Knowledge: Understanding of software development practices, including using Git, writing and testing your code, and leveraging it to produce meaningful results. If you're an open-source enthusiast, we'd love to see your GitHub contributions!
Proficiency in Data Visualization: Experience with tools like ggplot, matplotlib, Tableau, or similar. Bonus points for experience with Microstrategy or QuickSight.
SQL Expertise: You are an SQL ninja, and writing both exploratory and efficient queries is second nature to you.
STEM Background: A degree in a STEM field (Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics) is highly desired due to the strong software development component of the role.
Emotional resilience: You can give and take criticism well. You don‚Äôt get defensive when your ideas are challenged, and you‚Äôre polite enough to challenge others‚Äô ideas when necessary.
Confidence without arrogance: You are confident but not arrogant. You ask for help when needed and openly admit when you don‚Äôt know something. You value and celebrate the contributions of others.
Exceptional communication skills: You explain your ideas clearly and succinctly, ask for input, and listen carefully. You build on the ideas of others, and your presentations are impactful without being overwhelming.
Transparency: You value transparency, always willing to share your knowledge and ideas with the team.
Team collaboration: You are a strong team player, supporting and collaborating with others to achieve common goals.




What do we offer?

Joining a dynamic and agile company undergoing international expansion.
Working in start-up mode with the support of the Santander Group.
Competitive remuneration and attractive benefits package.
Possibility of growth within the company and the Group.
Collaborating on international projects in different countries.
Excellent work environment, social clubs and frequent events.




Would you like to grow with us? Join our team!

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
Your mission

As a Data Analyst Intern at Livo, you will work closely with Product and Business teams, your responsibilities will be:


Conduct analyses on customer usage, engagement, and feature effectiveness
Build dashboards and reports to monitor product performance and user behavior
Define and track Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) for Product and Business initiatives
Present findings and recommendations clearly to both technical and non-technical stakeholders


Your profile


Currently finishing a degree in Data, Computer Science or a related field
Proactive mindset with a strong eagerness to learn in a fast-paced environment
Proficiency in SQL and familiarity with data visualization tools (e.g. Metabase, Tableau, Looker Studio, etc.)
Comfortable communicating data-driven insights clearly and collaborating with cross-functional teams
Bonus points for experience with Product or Web Analytics tools (e.g. Amplitude, Mixpanel, PostHog, etc.)


About Us

Livo was born with the mission to improve healthcare globally through cutting edge technology and that has always been our North Star since we deeply believe health is the most important asset we all have as individuals. We launched last year in Spain our nursing shift marketplace whose aim is to support health care institutions with their nurse staffing needs, by matching institutions with healthcare professionals that are interested in extra work, adding transparency, flexibility and convenience to both stakeholders and its traction has been outstanding. Our vision is to radically transform the way healthcare institutions hire, retain and manage talent nowadays whilst empowering healthcare staff with more tools, flexibility, money, and recognition.

Why us?

Title: Analyst, Advanced Data & Insights
Description:
Company Description

Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose ‚Äì to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.

Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.

Job Description

The Global Business Optimisation (GBO) team mission, as part of the Client Services (CS) organization, is to turn massive amounts of data into actionable insights that drive business value while working closely with Visa‚Äôs stakeholders to build creative solutions. Our Advance Data Analytics and Insights analysts are experts in data, coding, payment processing (including authorization and authentication), and creative thinking. We couple in-depth analysis of cardholder behaviour with Visa‚Äôs world-class products to address meaningful business problems.

In this role the analyst interprets and manage data to solve complex problems utilizing skills in data extraction, pre-processing, cleaning, visualization, and the use of tools like python, and Tableau. They are actively involved with all other teams in CS, supporting and developing new insights that help create, manage, and deliver actionable insights to both internal and external stakeholders.

Specific activities may include:


Data extraction: using your payment knowledge you will be responsible for extracting the correct data from numerous databases.
Data cleaning: perform data preprocessing, including cleaning and transforming data into usable information.
Data analysis: apply payments knowledge to interpret data and generate actionable insights.
Data validation: validate data extracted by you and others in the team to control data quality/ reliability.
Data visualization: develop visualizations to make complex analyses accessible to a broad audience.
Provide analytical and support about platforms, tools and data to internal stakeholders including delivering SME training.
Maintain highly strategic reports.
Work with a pan-European team and contribute to local and global projects across Visa.
Work in a Big Data environment with its technical challenges.
Be an out-of-the-box thinker who is passionate about brainstorming and implementing innovative ways to use our unique data to answer business problems.
Keen interest in working with a team of expert‚Äôs data analysts to create Advance Analytics, e.g.: training and deploying Machine Learning models, developing statistical analysis, etc.


This is a hybrid position. Expectation of days in office will be confirmed by your hiring manager.

Qualifications

A genuine passion for data, and about the payment‚Äôs ecosystem.

Intermediate to advance level skills in using data analysis tools and software. Excel, SQL, Python, and Tableau.

Proficient in all MS Office applications.

Confidence working in a high pace and dynamic environment, following several

work streams at the same time.

Experience in a corporate environment with data-based decision-making or quantitative analysis.

Ability to turn complex data subjects into easily understandable concepts.

Desirable

Strong verbal, written, and interpersonal skills (fluency in English is required while knowledge of an additional European language is a plus).

Experience of creating business value from data.

Knowledge of authorisation and/ or authentication processing.

Additional Information

Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

Title: Data Analyst (Product)
Description:
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, and more freedom. Since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. Our powerhouse of products ‚Äî including spending, saving, investing, exchanging, travelling, and more ‚Äî help our 50+ million customers get more from their money every day.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‚Äå 2 things are essential to our success: our people and our culture. In recognition of our outstanding employee experience, we've been certified as a Great Place to Work‚Ñ¢. So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our offices and remotely, to help us achieve our mission. And we're looking for more brilliant people. People who love building great products, redefining success, and turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. Our Data Analysts aren‚Äôt kept in the background, doomed to never see the impact of their work. They‚Äôre some of our best and brightest problem solvers, deployed to the front-lines to work in Product Teams and deliver rock star solutions ü§ò

We‚Äôre looking for a superstar Data Analyst who does not believe there is a data task that can be too hard ü¶¨ From digging into our complex databases, looking for the root cause of a problem to designing their own solutions and writing their own code to implement them. In this process they never stop learning, picking up new skills and delivering value.

Up for the challenge? Get in touch üëá

What You‚Äôll Be Doing

We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. Title: Junior Analytic Consultant
Description:
Job Description

You will MAKE A DIFFERENCE by helping some of the largest FMCG manufacturers make the right choices for their growth strategies. You will partner with our clients and use data to explain what is happening with their brands and what they should do to improve business performance. Simply put, you will transform data into compelling stories. Working with your NIQ colleagues you will build partnerships that allow you to better understand your clients‚Äô business priorities and information needs. You'll use this knowledge to develop in-depth analytics and create insights to drive business growth.

Our Delivery Consultants team combines data and expertise to help our clients become more competitive and efficient through stronger, faster analytics.

With your numerical confidence and ability to translate numbers into insights, you can create a strong aptitude in understanding the needs of clients and build strong relationships with internal and external stakeholders. You have excellent time management and prioritizing skills that will help you be more effective and efficient.

Responsabilities


Earning client trust and building relationships by delivering meaningful analysis
Understanding the business needs of our client and applying solutions, with specific focus on the assortment on the store
Analyzing information creating value stories to help our clients in their daily work
Understanding our tools and systems as well as the NIQ product portfolio
Working closely with all teams to ensure work is connected to meet client business issues


Qualifications


University education in Mathematics, Statistics or ADE (Econometrics / Quantitative Methods for Business) or Business school/Management
High Office management (Excel, Power Point)
Eager to further develop presentations skills
Able to analyze data and summarize into a story
Performs work accurately and effectively with attention to detail
Interest towards FMCG environment


Fluent English: strong verbal and written communication skills in English. French & Spanish will be valuable.

Additional Information

Our Benefits


Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)


About NIQ

NIQ is the world‚Äôs leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights‚Äîdelivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms‚ÄîNIQ delivers the Full View‚Ñ¢. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world‚Äôs population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Want to keep up with our latest updates?

Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion

Title: Data Analyst (Tableau/SQL)_ ENGLISH- PHARMA
Description:
HAYS is collaborating with the leading company in the pharmaceutical sector, TOP 10 pharma.

They create innovative medicines for people and animals, adding value through innovation for all three business areas: human pharmaceuticals, animal health, and contract manufacturing of biopharmaceuticals. Now they are growing in animal area too, it was created 3 years ago. Our client is forming a technological hub that will serve the entire group internationally. It is growing and has more than 400 specialists. This hub is located in San Cugat del Vall√©s.




We are looking for a Data Analyst (Tableau/SQL) to expand their team.




What will your duties be?




Connect with different markets around the globe and understand their data
Organize data in a way it can be used and analyzed in an efficient way across markets and stakeholders
Analyze / interpret this data to extract business value and
Clear Communication of your findings to the stakeholders
Deliver according to high standards with regards to consistency, usability and quality
Extraction, Organization, Analysis and Reporting - Data/Business




Which are the ideal requirements?




5 years progressive work experience in data management and/or data modelling
Demonstrated expertise defining KPIs to drive business performance
Highly skilled in SQL, Exasol, Tableau and data visualization techniques or similar tools.
Ability to negotiate and influence across a matrix & cross-functional organization.
Experience working with Snowflake is a big plus.
Good judgment in evaluating benefits and risks and providing sound recommendations.
English fluent
Good communication and mediation skills and Strong results orientation. Ability to plan and organize work. Observation, interviewing and listening skills.




What we offer?




Participate in international projects. Young and dynamic environment
Flexible schedule (Monday to Friday from 8 - 9 to 5 - 6).
Hybrid position. Buffet Onsite. Location: Sant Cugat del Vall√®s (Barcelona)
Contract by Hays in a long project (Indefinido)







If you like to work in global environments and a good working environment, do not hesitate to sign up for the offer!! We will contact you as soon as possible!!

Title: Business Intelligence Data Analyst
Description:
GROUP BNP PARIBAS

BNP Paribas Group is the top bank in the European Union and a major international banking establishment. It has close to 185,000 employees in 65 countries. In Spain we are more than 5,100 employees within 13 business lines.




Spain IT Production




Spain IT Production organization consists of CIB ITO & ITG IT Platforms and is responsible for providing IT Production services to our Clients in EMEA, ensuring a Digital Market evolution, in a secured and performant environment, and with a reliable quality. IT Production organisation includes Infrastructure services, Telecom & Workspace, Production Security and Application Production domains and associated transversal services (CTO Office, Control Tower, PMO and IT Continuity). In Spain, IT Production relies on a Platform with over 400 experts that provide full-stack support services ensuring a secure, stable, standardized, and efficient production.




ABOUT THE JOB




MISSION




For the Security Dashboard activities, we are looking for Data Security & Business Intelligence Engineer to support and coordinate the deployment of the Security Dashboard within the security productions of the BNPPARIBAS group




RESPONSIBILITIES




¬∑ Needs analysis for evolution of the current BI solution

¬∑ Provision of solutions in accordance with the company‚Äôs strategy based on (Cyber security Group requirements

¬∑ Coordinate the redesign and Dashboard transformation

¬∑ Deploy the solution within the group‚Äôs ProdSec entities of the group

¬∑ Ensure comitology with stakeholders (Technical Experts, Functional Experts, Product Owner, and customers.)

¬∑ Report to the manager and Team lead on the achievements progress.

¬∑ Ensuring the updating of the documentary heritage corpus




REQUIREMENTS




Studies




Bachelor‚Äôs in computer science or equivalent




Experience




Minimum 5 to 10 years of experience in cybersecurity and production environments




Languages




Fluent English written and spoken. Strong written, oral, and interpersonal communications skills.

French speaking is a plus.




SKILLS




Technical




o PowerBI, SQL, MS SSIS/ SSAS/ SSRS

o Python, PHP/ Symfony

o Systems: architecture, security, etc. to support monitoring and steering actions- d√©finition, production et mise en place de KPI de pilotage et de suivi

o The methodology for monitoring Cybersecurity Control Projects;

o Vulnerability & Patch Management

o Qualys, Tanium is plus




Transversal & Behavioral




o Strong situational analysis and needs identification.

o Proposal force for the most relevant solutions

o Ability to collaborate with different types of profiles. Technical, Functional, Project Leadership. Team leader, etc.

o Ability to share and transmit.

o Rigor, organization and method with a spirit of analysis and synthesis

o Customer orientation: listening, support and understanding of needs.

o Transverse vision to anticipate data correlations / Impacts.

o Good Cyber Security Culture.




BENEFITS

‚Ä¢ Training programs, career plans and internal mobility opportunities, national and international thanks to our presence in different countries.

‚Ä¢ Diversity and Inclusion Committee that ensures an inclusive work environment. In recent years, several employee communities have been created to organize diversity and inclusion awareness actions (PRIDE, We Generations and MixCity).

‚Ä¢ Corporate volunteering program (1 Million Hours 2 Help) in which employees can dedicate time out of their working hours to volunteer activities.

‚Ä¢ Flexible compensation plan.

‚Ä¢ Hybrid telecommuting model (50%).

‚Ä¢ 31 vacation days.







Diversity and inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas Group in Spain is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Our Organization

Dow Jones is a global provider of news and business information, delivering content to consumers and organizations around the world across multiple formats, including print, digital, mobile and live events. Dow Jones has produced unrivaled quality content for more than 130 years and today has one of the world's largest news-gathering operations globally. It is home to leading publications and products including the flagship Wall Street Journal, America's largest newspaper by paid circulation; Barron's, MarketWatch, Mansion Global, Financial News, Investor's Business Daily, Factiva, Dow Jones Risk & Compliance, Dow Jones Newswires, OPIS and Chemical Market Analytics. Dow Jones is a division of News Corp (Nasdaq: NWS, NWSA; ASX: NWS, NWSLV).

About The Team

Our Technology team drives the evolution of our Technology, Engineering, Data, Product and User Experience functions. With a keen focus on delivering cutting-edge solutions, we shape the digital landscape for our customers, readers, and users. From revolutionizing visuals to optimizing tools and harnessing the power of data, mobile, video, and social platforms, our team is committed to providing a seamless and immersive experience across all touchpoints. Collaborating closely with our newsrooms and strategic partners, we spearhead the development of groundbreaking products and technologies.

About The Role

The B2C Analytics team focuses on developing analytics solutions to help the organization make better data driven decisions. Our team is passionate about enabling others to use data and analysis to measure and monitor performance, identify risks and opportunities and find ways to continually add value.

You will primarily support the Consumer side of the business, which includes WSJ, Barron's, MarketWatch and more; but may also include exposure to other areas of the business, such as advertising and the professional information business. The ideal candidate will have previous experience in developing datasets, dashboards and data solutions that drive core insights. You will report to the Senior Manager, B2C Analytics.

You Will

Develop Stakeholder Partnerships


Develop strong partnerships with Product, Marketing, Newsroom, Finance, Data Collection, Data Engineering and other B2C Stakeholder Business teams and work across all levels and areas of the organization.
Executie data project roadmaps based on Business teams' priorities.


Understand B2C Data


Build a deep understanding of all the B2C data sources that we leverage in our Analysis projects
Partner with data engineers and data collection colleagues to collect, cleanse and organize data.


Conduct Analysis, Create Dashboards, Improve Processes & Ensure Quality


Analyze large datasets to surface trends and deliver recommendations with tangible business outcomes.
Create intuitive reports, dashboards and data solutions using visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, Looker Studio)
Continuously identify ways to improve and streamline processes around data and reporting
Ensure the quality of data and reporting, and partner with teams to improve accuracy and consistency


Clearly Communicate


Communicate technical information clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences


You Have


Team oriented and collaborative with eagerness to help others, and aspiration to be challenged and learn
Self starter able to work independently, coordinate with multiple partners and complete projects start to finish
Detail oriented with focus on assuring quality, consistency and accuracy in data and processes
Undergraduate degree or equivalent in combination of training and experience, preferably in a quantitative field such as Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or related disciplines.
Experience working with large datasets in a fast-paced and fluid environment with the ability to understand and solve complex non-routine problems.
Experience with SQL and strong knowledge of Excel/Sheets required. Familiarity with Github, Python/R preferred.
Experience with web analytics tools (particularly Google Analytics 4 and Adobe Analytics) is a plus.
Experience with data visualizations tools and techniques, and using data to tell a story (e.g. Tableau, Looker)


Our Benefits


Comprehensive Healthcare Plans
Paid Time Off
Retirement Plans
Comprehensive Insurance Plans
Lifestyle programs & Wellness Resources
Education Benefits
Family Care Benefits & Caregiving Support
Commuter Transit Program
Subscription Discounts
Employee Referral Program


\

Reasonable accommodation: Dow Jones, Making Careers Newsworthy - We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. EEO/AA/M/F/Disabled/Vets. We strongly encourage applications from all qualified individuals, including women, people with disabilities, and those from underrepresented groups. Dow Jones is committed to providing reasonable accommodation for qualified individuals with disabilities, in our job application and/or interview process. If you need assistance or accommodation in completing your application, due to a disability, email us at talentresourceteam@dowjones.com. Please put "Reasonable Accommodation" in the subject line and provide a brief description of the type of assistance you need. This inbox will not be monitored for application status updates.

Business Area: Dow Jones - Data & AI

Job Category: Data Analytics/Warehousing & Business Intelligence

Union Status

Non-Union role

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

THE WORLD OF UBISOFT

Ubisoft‚Äôs 19,000 team members, working across more than 30 countries around the world, are bound by a common mission to enrich players‚Äô lives with original and memorable gaming experiences. Their commitment and talent have brought to life many acclaimed franchises such as Assassin‚Äôs Creed, Far Cry, Watch Dogs, Just Dance, Rainbow Six, and many more to come. Ubisoft is an equal opportunity employer that believes diverse backgrounds and perspectives are key to creating worlds where both players and teams can thrive and express themselves. If you are excited about solving game-changing challenges, cutting edge technologies and pushing the boundaries of entertainment, we invite you to join our journey and help us create the unknown.

Ubisoft Barcelona Mobile‚ÄØbrings together dedicated and experienced professionals that are focused on crafting high-quality F2P games for mobile. We strongly believe in the core values at the centre of our Ubilife, which encourage us to take ownership of our work, continually striving for excellence while promoting the sharing of knowledge across individuals and teams, without losing our sense of enjoyment and fun, while taking care for one another. We strive for a safe and respectful workplace for all team members and we‚Äôre transparent about the measures we are taking to do so. For this reason, Ubisoft‚Äôs Code of Conduct has been released publicly on our corporate website for all current and future team members.

Do you want to join us in the world of mobile gaming? If so, read on!

Job Description

YOUR DAILY ADVENTURE

Ubisoft Barcelona Mobile is currently seeking a Data Analyst to help our team on their next adventure. The Data Analyst will support insight initiatives for our BI team. This person will report to the Live Producer. Your daily adventure:



Turning data into actionable insights, by performing hands-on research, data exploration and analysis, to drive decisions and strategies for user acquisition, retention, and monetization.
Work with the game teams to provide insights into user behaviour, answer key business questions and support in AB test design and analysis.
Carry out projects on machine learning for behavioural segmentation and monetization.
Debugging and problem-solving issues to ensure the delivery of accurate and clear analysis, reports and tools.
Effectively communicate results and insights to senior stakeholders throughout the organization.
Coordinate, challenge and share the best analytical practices and methods within the organization.
Stay up to date with the latest developments in Machine Learning technologies and Data Science trends.
Contribute to the knowledge base and culture of the team.



Qualifications

YOUR SKILLS

Are you serious about fun? Do you consistently seek out learning opportunities and aim to beat your high score? Are you open to new ideas, perspectives and cultures and believe that it takes a world to build a world? At Ubisoft, you‚Äôll work alongside passionate and talented teams who are imagining the future of entertainment.



Master's degree in a quantitative field (i.e. Physics, Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science, Data Science...). PhD in any of these disciplines is a plus.
5+ years relevant work experience in similar positions, ideally in mobile gaming industry.
Highly proficient in SQL as well as Python for data exploratory analysis
Experience with cloud-based big data solutions such as Redshift, BigQuery.
Solid knowledge of data visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker, Microstrategy, etc.
Robust understanding of advanced statistics suitable for analysis of skewed populations.
Experience designing effective ways of communicating, visualising and reporting results/analysis.
Experience in predictive analytics and segmentation.
Excellent problem-solving capabilities with strong attention to details.
Work permit for Spain obtained prior to applying for the position is a must.



What can make you stand out:



Experience with Agile philosophies (e.g.: Scrum, Kanban, XP) and project management tools (e.g.: JIRA)
Software engineering skills, including best practices like CI/CD and Git.
Self-motivation, organization skills, team spirit, proactivity.
Passion for games. Interest in mobile F2P games.



Additional Information

YOUR LIFE AT UBISOFT BARCELONA MOBILE (and PERKS)



Hybrid Work Model
Possibility for new parents to work from home 80% of the time.
Flex working schedule:‚ÄØ40hrs per week with start time between 8 AM ‚Äì 10 AM and leave from 5 PM (Friday from 2 PM).
Reduced schedule‚ÄØ(35 hrs per week) in July and August, Easter, Christmas holidays, and special days like Sant Jordi and Revetlla de Sant Joan.
Personal Matters Hours:‚ÄØ24 hours paid for by Ubisoft that you can use for personal matters.
Holidays:‚ÄØ25 days per year + 1 day in your‚ÄØUbi-Birthday.
5 extra holiday‚ÄØdays‚ÄØon the year you celebrate your 5th/10th/15th/20th year with us.
Ticket Restaurant: 200‚Ç¨ per month, and‚ÄØFlexible compensation plan‚ÄØ(Ticket Transport & Ticket Nursery).
Health insurance‚ÄØwith Cigna, including‚ÄØPhysiotherapist & Psychology sessions‚ÄØwith a reduced price.
Life Insurance‚ÄØwith AXA.
Mobile Device‚ÄØGrant‚ÄØof 400 EUR‚ÄØstarting on your 1st year in the company.
Language trainings‚ÄØin English, Spanish, and French.
Professional development training & programs, based upon request.
Ubisoft games with discount‚ÄØand Uplay PC for free.
Locally roasted craft coffee‚ÄØby INCAPTO (it‚Äôs very, very good).

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Sant Cugat del Vall√®s, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
At Roche you can show up as yourself, embraced for the unique qualities you bring. Our culture encourages personal expression, open dialogue, and genuine connections, where you are valued, accepted and respected for who you are, allowing you to thrive both personally and professionally. This is how we aim to prevent, stop and cure diseases and ensure everyone has access to healthcare today and for generations to come. Join Roche, where every voice matters.

The Position

Are you passionate about transforming raw data into powerful insights? As a Data Analyst, you'll navigate through complex data ecosystems from sources like SalesForce Sales & Service and ERP systems, seamlessly integrating them to create a unified data landscape. You'll spearhead the development of scalable data processes, collaborate with cross-functional teams to incorporate cutting-edge analytics tools, and craft insightful dashboards and reports that drive strategic business decisions.

We are seeking an experienced Data Analyst with a minimum of 5 years of experience to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in Business Intelligence (BI) development within a Microsoft SQL environment.

Your role will be critical in partnering with finance, sales, service, and IT teams to align data initiatives with business goals, acting as a data management expert and effectively communicating your findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Additionally, your dedication to data protection and privacy compliance will ensure our business information remains secure and trustworthy.

Your Key Responsibilities

Create, implement, and manage data integration workflows using SQL Integration Services
Develop multidimensional cubes and tabular models in SQL Analysis Services
Generate and distribute reports using SQL Reporting Services
Perform in-depth data analysis and generate insights to support business decisions
Develop and maintain reports and dashboards using Tableau
Work with large datasets and ensure data integrity and quality
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and provide solutions
Create comprehensive documentation and reports to communicate insights and recommendations
Ensure data integrity, accuracy, and security across all BI systems
Continuously improve BI processes and methodologies to enhance efficiency and effectiveness



Who You Are

Minimum of 5 years of experience in a data analysis role
Proven experience with Microsoft SQL Server (SSAS, SSRS, SSIS)
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to manage multiple projects concurrently and meet deadlines
Excellent communication and collaboration skills
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Statistics, or a related field
Preferred: Experience with Snowflake database
Preferred: Experience developing reports and dashboards using Tableau
Preferred: Familiarity with data structures in SAP


Who we are

A healthier future drives us to innovate. Together, more than 100‚Äô000 employees across the globe are dedicated to advance science, ensuring everyone has access to healthcare today and for generations to come. Our efforts result in more than 26 million people treated with our medicines and over 30 billion tests conducted using our Diagnostics products. We empower each other to explore new possibilities, foster creativity, and keep our ambitions high, so we can deliver life-changing healthcare solutions that make a global impact.

Let‚Äôs build a healthier future, together.

Roche is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Finsolutia intends to reinforce its Information Technology (IT) team with a Data Analyst (M/F).

We are looking for talented and self-motivated individuals for a broad and interesting role working as part of a team based in Lisbon.

Responsibilities


Design and develop Microsoft Power BI reports and Dashboards (Operational, Strategic & Analytical) including data set ingestion and transformation, Data Modeling, Data Analysis Expressions (DAX) using the appropriate report templates depicting status of key performance indicators (KPIs) and other important business metrics for an organization to make data driven decisions
Work with cross-functional teams to gather and document reporting requirements to meet business needs
Build data models, technical and functional documentation with business partners
Review and interpret ongoing business report requirements;
Writing optimized SQL queries for integration with other applications
Designing database tables and related objects;
Transition developed reports and dashboards to interactive/automated dashboards using Power BI
Use T-SQL to develop and implement procedures and functions;
Provide support as required to ensure the availability and optimal performance of developed reports and dashboards for both external and internal users
Design and implement technology best practices, guidelines and repeatable processes
Extract and analyze data using PowerQuery, PivotTables, MS Excel, Power BI and DAX.
Design, develop, update, and optimize Power BI dashboards, reports and scorecards to meet business requirements.


Hard Skills


Understanding of T-SQL programming (Microsoft SQL Server )
Knowledge of data modeling following the best practices
2+ years of experience in creating reports, dashboards using Power BI Desktop and Server and maintaining Power BI dashboards on servers.
Understanding of tuning of Power BI reports, data sets, and SQL to deliver maximum report performance.
Experience with ETL Processes Experience with Python and C# (nice to have)
Fluent in English


Soft Skills


Proactivity and constant technological evolution;
Team work and result oriented;
Good communication and interpersonal / facilitation skills.


We‚Äôd like to inform you that personal data collected here are exclusively destined to the management of the recruitment process in question and will be processed and storage by Finsolutia, SA, or another Group company, in accordance with Personal Data Protection Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of 27 April 2016 during a period of 5 years, after which they will be definitively eliminated.

We Further Inform You That The Holder Will Have Free Access To Its Personal Data, And May Request Its Updating, Rectification Or Removal By Simply Sending The Request In Writing To

Bernardo Cabral

Data Protection Officer

dpo@finsolutia.com
Show more
