Procuramos profissionais com algumas das val√™ncias abaixo:

  • Licenciatura/ Mestrado nas √°reas de Engenharia Inform√°tica, Engenharia Eletrot√©cnica e de Computadores, Matem√°tica ou √°reas similares;
  • Experi√™ncia profissional entre 1 e 6 anos em projetos de Data;

  • Experi√™ncia profissional em solu√ß√µes ETL (exemplos: Azure Data Fabric, AWS Glue, FiveTran, DBT, Talend, Matillion, Databricks);
  • Conhecimentos em Python, PySpark;
  • Experi√™ncia em solu√ß√µes da Data Visualization (exemplo: Power BI, Tableau, Microstrategy, Looker, Grafana, Qlik);
  • Valorizamos experi√™ncia profissional com Data Warehouses / Data Lakes / Data Lakehouses;
  • Conhecimento de solu√ß√µes Cloud (AWS, Azure, GCP, Alibaba Cloud) orientadas a arquiteturas de dados distribu√≠dos;
  • Valorizamos experi√™ncia profissional em solu√ß√µes/tecnologias Real-time (exemplos, Kafka, Apache Flink, Apache Spark, Amazon Kinesis, Azure Data Stream, MongoDB, outras);
  • Valorizamos experi√™ncia previa em projetos com metodologias Agile;
  • Dom√≠nio da l√≠ngua inglesa falado e escrito (obrigat√≥rio);
  • Valorizamos tamb√©m profissionais que tenham conhecimentos de l√≠ngua francesa e alem√£.
  • Valorizamos certifica√ß√µes orientadas aos projetos de dados;

Desenvolve uma carreira √† tua medida

  • Participando em projetos nacionais e internacionais, com dimens√£o e impacto relevante nesta √°rea de especializa√ß√£o;
  • Acesso ilimitado √†s maiores plataformas de aprendizagem online (Linkedin Learning e Udemy);
  • Oportunidade de forma√ß√µes e certifica√ß√µes nas mais recentes tecnologias, nomeadamente em tecnologias Cloud.


Vive uma cultura de uni√£o

  • Uma cultura de inova√ß√£o e excel√™ncia que nos torna l√≠deres e precursores de tend√™ncias;
  • Um ambiente amig√°vel, de respeito, confian√ßa, transpar√™ncia e informalidade;
  • Uma rede para a vida que te faz estar ligado ao melhor conhecimento ao lado de l√≠deres e especialistas;
  • Uma oportunidade para fazeres parte das nossas comunidades (de Tech, inova√ß√£o, desporto e outros interesses) e para participares ativamente em projetos de responsabilidade social.


Sobre a Deloitte

Na Deloitte nunca trabalhar√°s sozinho. Ter√°s a oportunidade de integrar diversos projetos de transforma√ß√£o e fazer parte de uma equipa que te vai inspirar e ajudar a desenvolver solu√ß√µes diferenciadoras, num ambiente din√¢mico e colaborativo, onde podes dar o melhor de ti e beneficiar das nossas iniciativas de bem-estar e flexibilidade. Somos mais de 5.500 pessoas em Portugal, das quais mais de 2.600 trabalham em √°reas tecnol√≥gicas, a partir de escrit√≥rios e Digital Studios em Lisboa, Porto, Braga, Viseu, Coimbra e Faro e de polos tecnol√≥gicos em Braga. Al√©m disso, as nossas equipas em Portugal t√™m proje√ß√£o internacional, o que demonstra a nossa forte lideran√ßa global em low code/no code, em engenharia de redes de telecomunica√ß√µes, em plataformas tecnol√≥gicas de transforma√ß√£o organizacional (ServiceNow e Apptio) e na ind√∫stria de servi√ßos financeiros (Finastra, TIA e Guidewire).

Se tens interesse em explorar e desenvolver as tuas compet√™ncias nalguma destas √°reas em solu√ß√µes tecnol√≥gicas ‚Äì engenharia de software, cloud, integra√ß√£o de sistemas, data analytics & data science, cyber risk, engenharia de redes telecomunica√ß√µes, UX design - e gostarias de trabalhar com tecnologias como AWS, Google, Oracle, Salesforce, SAP, Mulesoft, Feedzai e SAS, entre outras, ent√£o est√°s no lugar certo!

Title: Knowledge Analyst - Energy Solutions
Description:
Who You'll Work With

You will be based in our Dusseldorf, Madrid, or London office, joining the Energy Solutions team within McKinsey‚Äôs Global Energy & Materials practice.

As a global leader in energy intelligence and analytics, Energy Solutions leverages distinctive market perspectives, cutting-edge data and technology to empower organizations across the entire energy value chain. Our team of world-class consultants, analysts and data scientists transform data into actionable insights, enabling clients to make well-informed strategic, tactical, and operational decisions. We help organizations capture opportunities, manage risks, and enhance performance.

Your Impact

As a Knowledge Analyst with Energy Solutions, you will help clients in the energy sector and beyond to improve operations and make strategic decisions for the future.

In this role, you will provide daily problem-solving, structuring, modeling, and analytical support for our Energy Solutions tools and analyses. You will gather information to develop these tools/benchmarks and synthesize findings into McKinsey-formatted products, such as complex models, summary reports, and standalone presentations for internal and external audiences.

You will collaborate with other experts to solve client problems, deepening your knowledge and refining your analytical and thought-partnership skills.

You‚Äôll have the opportunity to gain new skills and build on the strengths you bring to the firm. You will receive exceptional training as well as frequent coaching and mentoring from colleagues.

Your Qualifications and Skills


University degree in management, engineering, economics or other discipline with a quantitative focus
Experience, internships and/or full-time, in the energy sector (oil & gas, power, sustainable fuels, conventional power plants, solar grids, etc.) or the industrial sector (chemical engineering, process engineering, systems optimization, etc.)
Strong interest in energy transition, energy markets, industrial processes and sustainability topics (such as decarbonization, CCS, DAC etc.)
Proven ability to collaborate effectively in a team environment and engage with individuals at all organizational levels
Capacity to excel in a fast-paced, results-driven team setting, demonstrating a steep learning curve and a strong commitment to coaching and development
Advanced problem-solving skills with a strong aptitude for working with numbers and quantitative models
Experience with modeling capability tools such as Python, R, or VBA are a plus
Proficiency in Excel and familiarity with Tableau
Ability to effectively communicate complex ideas in English and local office language, both verbally and in writing

Title: Product Analyst
Description:
About Air Apps

At Air Apps, we believe in thinking bigger‚Äîand moving faster. We‚Äôre a family-founded company on a mission to create the world‚Äôs first AI-powered Personal & Entrepreneurial Resource Planner (PRP), and we need your passion and ambition to help us change how people plan, work, and live. Born in Lisbon, Portugal, in 2018‚Äîand now with offices in both Lisbon and San Francisco‚Äîwe‚Äôve remained self-funded while reaching over 100 million downloads worldwide.

Our long-term focus drives us to challenge the status quo every day, pushing the boundaries of AI-driven solutions that truly make a difference. Here, you‚Äôll be a creative force, shaping products that empower people across the globe.

Join us on this journey to redefine resource management‚Äîand change lives along the way.

The Role

As a Product Analyst at Air Apps, you will analyze both internal and external products to identify potential new functionalities, uncover bottlenecks, and provide data-driven insights to enhance user experience. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to interpret product performance, optimize features, and support strategic decision-making through actionable recommendations.

Responsibilities


Analyze product usage data to identify trends, friction points, and opportunities for improvement.
Evaluate competitor products to benchmark functionalities and propose innovative solutions.
Develop reports and dashboards to track key performance metrics.
Collaborate with product managers, designers, and engineers to enhance product features based on data insights.
Conduct A/B testing and experimentation to validate new functionalities and improve user engagement.
Provide actionable insights to support product roadmap decisions.
Identify and address bottlenecks in user flows and product performance.


Requirements


Around 3+ years of experience in product analytics, business intelligence, or a related field.
Strong analytical skills with experience in SQL, Python, or R for data analysis.
Proficiency with analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics, Mixpanel, Amplitude).
Understanding of A/B testing methodologies and statistical analysis.
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Looker, Power BI).
Strong communication skills to present insights clearly to technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Ability to work in a fast-paced, data-driven environment.


What benefits are we offering?


Apple hardware ecosystem for work.
Flexible Paid Time Off (PTO) to support work-life balance.
Annual Bonus.
Top-tier Health Insurance for peace of mind.
Public Transportation Pass to support your commute needs.
Coverflex benefits package for meal allowances, well-being, and more.
Air Conference 2025 in Las Vegas ‚Äì an opportunity to meet the team, collaborate, and grow together


Diversity & Inclusion

At Air Apps, we are committed to fostering a diverse, inclusive, and equitable workplace. We enthusiastically welcome applicants from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We celebrate diversity in all its forms and believe that varied voices and experiences make us stronger.

Application Disclaimer

At Air Apps, we value transparency and integrity in our hiring process. Applicants must submit their own work without any AI-generated assistance. Any use of AI in application materials, assessments, or interviews will result in disqualification.

Title: Senior Analyst - Protective Intelligence
Description:
Job Description

The Position

The Protective Intelligence function as part of Organon Security and Resilience (OSR) organization, supports corporate security programs in collaboration with the OSR CoEs and Regional teams. The function is responsible for the Organon Security & Resilience Center with 24/7 coverage.

We are currently recruiting for a Senior Analyst - Protective Intelligence. This role will support the Insider Risk program, Strategic Intelligence program, Travel Risk Management program and All-hazard threat intelligence monitoring (such as natural disasters, security incidents, geopolitical situations) and collection in order to proactively inform on and mitigate risks that could impact business operations, facilities and personnel.

This role will report to the Associate Director of Protective Intelligence, who oversees a team of analysts who monitor intelligence feeds and open-source channels, assess potential impact, and report to stakeholders in a timely manner. The team also services the company‚Äôs 24/7 crisis management contact point, triaging to the appropriate Security & Resilience leaders to provide business critical support during incidents.

Responsibilities


Participates as a team member to ensure coverage of 24/7 emergency telephone line that escalates external and internal events that have the potential to negatively impact Organon employees, facilities, operations, cause physical or environmental damage, or threaten financial standing, reputation, or property.
Conducts proactive reviews to determine if threats exist to Organon Executives, travelers or events.
Alert Security & Resilience members about threats to Organon.
Manage tools and technologies that ensure founders‚Äô wellbeing and support Country Incident Management Teams, Corporate Incident Assessment Team and Corporate Crisis Management Team, as warranted.
Report Cyber Security Incidents and Product Integrity incidents.
Provide strategic analysis of threat events to senior managers.
Provide tactical assessments and support.
Data scraping in open source and vendors to identify security deteriorations and trends.
Drive best practices and provide guidance.
Includes shift work (after hours, weekends and holidays).


Education Minimum Requirement

Qualifications, Skills & Experience Required -

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in in Security Studies, Political Science, International Relations or related field.

Required Experience And Skills


3 - 4 years‚Äô relevant experience in a security operations center, or similar environment with analytical, investigative, emergency response, security or geopolitical assessment experience
Expertise in multi-source intelligence collection, assessment and dissemination.
Knowledge of the intelligence cycle, including analytic methodologies and techniques.
Strong oral and written communication skills, especially in preparing clear and concise summaries of critical events in a timely manner.
Excellent attention to detail.
Demonstrated experience synthesizing large amounts of information from multiple sources into concise, analytic assessments.
Demonstrated ability to maintain confidentiality with sensitive information.
Action oriented with a passion for getting things done quickly, efficiently, and properly.
Ability to maintain professional composure when dealing with unusual and stressful circumstances
English language fluency
Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite to include Teams.


Others


Advanced degree and / or relevant certifications is a plus
Other languages a plus.


Secondary Job Description

Who We Are:

Organon delivers ingenious health solutions that enable people to live their best lives. We are a $6.5 billion global healthcare company focused on making a world of difference for women, their families and the communities they care for. We have an important portfolio and are growing it by investing in the unmet needs of Women‚Äôs Health, expanding access to leading biosimilars and touching lives with a diverse and trusted portfolio of health solutions. Our Vision is clear: A better and healthier every day for every woman.

As an equal opportunity employer, we welcome applications from candidates with a diverse background. We are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all our applicants.

Search Firm Representatives Please Read Carefully

Organon LLC, does not accept unsolicited assistance from search firms for employment opportunities. All CVs / resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at our company without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of our company. No fee will be paid in the event a candidate is hired by our company as a result of an agency referral where no pre-existing agreement is in place. Where agency agreements are in place, introductions are position specific. Please, no phone calls or emails.

Annualized Salary Range

Annualized Salary Range (Global)

Annualized Salary Range (Canada)

Please Note: Pay ranges are specific to local market and therefore vary from country to country.

Employee Status

Regular

Relocation:

No relocation

VISA Sponsorship

Travel Requirements: Organon employees must be able to satisfy all applicable travel and credentialing requirements, including associated vaccination prerequisites

Shift

Flexible Work Arrangements:

Valid Driving License

Hazardous Material(s):

Number Of Openings

1

Requisition ID:R533044

Title: Capital Portfolio Management Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job


The Resource & Portfolio Management (RPM) Team is part of the Securitised Product Group (SPG), which combines all securitisation and other risk distribution activities within Global Banking EMEA ‚Äì Capital Markets
The Securitisation Trade Manager is responsible for the booking of transactions and the management of their cash flows (calculation, monitoring of payments, etc.) and for their correct regulatory Capital calculation in the systems, to achieve optimum Capital savings for the bank
Acting as a point of contact with investors during the life of the transaction, as well as for regulatory reporting, the Securitisation Trade Manager will develop expertise in transaction management (Securitisation, SRT, Credit Default Swap, Credit Insurance) and most importantly in regulatory Capital of the Bank
The Candidate will work with data to assess the Capital savings on the transactions under management and should have an interest in learning Python/SQL languages. The Candidate will also be key to ensure that all the contractual commitments related to Resources & Portfolio Management transactions are fulfilled


Your Main Activities Are


Advisory role in pre-trade phase by actively liaising with the Origination and Structuring team, to assess the feasibility of a transaction
Booking of transactions in Front-Office systems
Perform monitoring and payment of invoices to Third Parties (Investors, Brokers and Insurers)
Calculate the correct Capital savings by ensuring the right Risk-Weighted Assets (RWA) are calculated during the quarterly Capital process
Perform quarterly updates of the capital structure of existing programs and quarterly coupon computation and validation, following instructions of underlying flow of funds
Identify claims based on rating triggers in underlying portfolios
Perform reporting to Validation Agent, Investors, Regulators, and internal stakeholders, acting as a point of contact for questions related to existing portfolios


Profile And Skills To Success


Master's degree in Engineering, Finance, Maths or Economics
Up to 3 years of relevant experience
Interest in VBA, Python, or data analytics tools such as SQL
Fluency in English both oral and written (mandatory)
Advanced knowledge of Office package (Excel)


#Hybrid

Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centers providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Real Time Analyst (WFM)
Description:
Navan is looking for a Real-Time Analyst (RTA) to support Workforce Management (WFM) for our 24/7/365 Travel Experience team. In this role, you will collaborate with cross-functional teams and leadership to optimize productivity and performance across multiple contact centers.

You will be responsible for managing real-time support volumes, making short-term scheduling adjustments, and ensuring data accuracy within our systems. This role requires a proactive, analytical, and detail-oriented professional who can effectively balance business needs with delivering an exceptional customer experience.

What You‚Äôll Do


Monitor real-time volume across multiple contact center channels and skills.
Utilize WFM software and historical data to manage intra-day staffing levels.
Implement effective staffing adjustments to maintain service levels.
Identify emerging trends and assess their impact on business operations.
Translate data into actionable insights and recommendations.
Evaluate availability for training, special projects, and other initiatives.
Process and track time-off requests and schedule exceptions for agents.
Communicate tailored messaging to various teams and stakeholders.
Maintain and update WFM profiles to ensure accurate time tracking.
Investigate data anomalies and uncover root causes.
Foster a positive work environment that supports team success.
Continuously enhance personal skills and proficiency with WFM systems.
Perform additional duties as needed.


What We‚Äôre Looking For


1+ year of Workforce Management (WFM) experience as a Real-Time Analyst (RTA) ‚Äì mandatory.
Experience in a multi-channel contact center environment.
Hands-on experience with workforce systems such as Aspect eWFM, Avaya CMS, IEX, Genesys, Teleopti, Calabrio, and/or Verint/Blue Pumpkin. (Genesys required for most cases)
Strong proficiency in Google Sheets and Microsoft Excel (e.g., advanced VLOOKUPs, pivot tables, complex formulas, and data analysis).
Ability to work a flexible schedule, including nights, weekends, and holidays as needed.
Strong quantitative, analytical, and problem-solving skills.
Proactive mindset to identify challenges, analyze business impact, and provide data-driven solutions.
Ability to build strong relationships across different levels of the organization.
High level of integrity and confidentiality when handling sensitive employee information.
Show more
HTML:
Navan is looking for a Real-Time Analyst (RTA) to support Workforce Management (WFM) for our 24/7/365 Travel Experience team. In this role, you will collaborate with cross-functional teams and leadership to optimize productivity and performance across multiple contact centers.

You will be responsible for managing real-time support volumes, making short-term scheduling adjustments, and ensuring data accuracy within our systems. This role requires a proactive, analytical, and detail-oriented professional who can effectively balance business needs with delivering an exceptional customer experience.

What You‚Äôll Do

  • Monitor real-time volume across multiple contact center channels and skills.
  • Utilize WFM software and historical data to manage intra-day staffing levels.
  • Implement effective staffing adjustments to maintain service levels.
  • Identify emerging trends and assess their impact on business operations.
  • Translate data into actionable insights and recommendations.
  • Evaluate availability for training, special projects, and other initiatives.
  • Process and track time-off requests and schedule exceptions for agents.
  • Communicate tailored messaging to various teams and stakeholders.
  • Maintain and update WFM profiles to ensure accurate time tracking.
  • Investigate data anomalies and uncover root causes.
  • Foster a positive work environment that supports team success.
  • Continuously enhance personal skills and proficiency with WFM systems.
  • Perform additional duties as needed.

What We‚Äôre Looking For

  • 1+ year of Workforce Management (WFM) experience as a Real-Time Analyst (RTA) ‚Äì mandatory.
  • Experience in a multi-channel contact center environment.
  • Hands-on experience with workforce systems such as Aspect eWFM, Avaya CMS, IEX, Genesys, Teleopti, Calabrio, and/or Verint/Blue Pumpkin. (Genesys required for most cases)
  • Strong proficiency in Google Sheets and Microsoft Excel (e.g., advanced VLOOKUPs, pivot tables, complex formulas, and data analysis).
  • Ability to work a flexible schedule, including nights, weekends, and holidays as needed.
  • Strong quantitative, analytical, and problem-solving skills.
  • Proactive mindset to identify challenges, analyze business impact, and provide data-driven solutions.
  • Ability to build strong relationships across different levels of the organization.
  • High level of integrity and confidentiality when handling sensitive employee information.

Title: Data Understanding Specialist - (Third Party Associate) - Portuguese: Market- Portugal
Description:
Responsibilities

Important Note: Please be advised that this job posting is for informational purposes only. This is a 6 month temporary assignment managed by HYLegal. All contractual terms, including payroll and benefits, will be handled by HYLegal. By applying, you agree that the information provided in your application may be processed for recruitment purposes, shared with the third-party agency, and other purposes in accordance with ByteDance's Applicant Privacy Notice https://sf16-sg.tiktokcdn.com/obj/eden-sg/uvyloeh7vhonuhf/privacy/ByteDance_Global_Applicant_Privacy_Notice.pdf

The Global Monetization Integrity team ensures safe and quality experiences for Advertisers to enable TikTok in its mission to inspire joy and creativity. The team is responsible for creating scalable and reliable solutions that allow TikTok Advertisers and businesses to interact in a trustworthy manner, always working to anticipate and protect against threats. They will do so by creating ad policies, managing content review processes, and more.

This position will be responsible for meeting the Risk and Moderation demands. This means, as Global Operations Specialist, you will review & moderate advertisements entering the TikTok platform. By doing so, this will mitigate any risk to our community by supporting advertisers proactively, and effectively addressing violations of MI Policies.

Main Responsibilities


SOP Clarification and Training:
Work with the BPs to clarify and eliminate ambiguities in the requirements/SOPs
Provide simplified and straightforward tasks to labellers
Deliver training to labellers for complex requirements
Quality Improvement and Assurance:
Constantly monitor and review the quality of the labelled data
Identify the root cause of any issues and take appropriate remedial actions such as simplify or disambiguate the - - SOPs or provide additional training
Identify opportunities or areas for improvement for key metrics and propose experiments to support initiatives
Project Management:
Ensure timely delivery of projects
Coordinate effectively with key stakeholders
Provide project visibility and progress updates to stakeholders through data


Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:


Fluent in written and spoken required language plus business level English
1-3 years experience in operation for a tech or social media company data analytic experience
Proficiency in data interpretation and analysis; Understanding of AI and Machine Learning concepts, particularly as they relate to data labelling is a plus
Excellent verbal and written communication skills for clear and effective communication with both requestors and labellers
Strong abilities in simplifying complex instructions and requirements, along with robust experience in training in a technical context
Experience in project management with strong organizational skills to manage multiple tasks concurrently, preferably in a data-intensive environment


Preferred Qualifications


Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to identify and resolve issues
Strong technical skills in SQL and scripting languages (Python, R) are a plus
Fluency in English (written and verbal) and an additional language


Job Information

About TikTok

TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok's global headquarters are in Los Angeles and Singapore, and we also have offices in New York City, London, Dublin, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.

Why Join Us

Inspiring creativity is at the core of TikTok's mission. Our innovative product is built to help people authentically express themselves, discover and connect ‚Äì and our global, diverse teams make that possible. Together, we create value for our communities, inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we work towards every day.

We strive to do great things with great people. We lead with curiosity, humility, and a desire to make impact in a rapidly growing tech company. Every challenge is an opportunity to learn and innovate as one team. We're resilient and embrace challenges as they come. By constantly iterating and fostering an "Always Day 1" mindset, we achieve meaningful breakthroughs for ourselves, our company, and our users. When we create and grow together, the possibilities are limitless. Join us.

Diversity & Inclusion

TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Role Overview

We are seeking a talented and experienced Data Engineer to join our growing data team. In this role, you will be instrumental in building, maintaining, and optimizing our data infrastructure, with a strong emphasis on DataOps principles. You will work closely with data analysts, and other engineers to ensure the reliability, scalability, and security of our data pipelines.

Key Responsibilities


Translate the business requirements into technical specifications, in cooperation with the data product owner.
Design, develop, and maintain robust and scalable data pipelines using Airflow.
Utilize dbt for data transformation and modeling, ensuring data quality and consistency.
Employ Terraform for infrastructure as code (IaC), automating the provisioning and management of our data infrastructure.
Implement and maintain CI/CD pipelines for data engineering workflows.
Monitor and troubleshoot data pipeline performance, identifying and resolving bottlenecks.
Implement data quality checks and monitoring to ensure data accuracy and reliability.
Contribute to the development of data engineering best practices and standards.
Manage and maintain data repositories using Git.
Automate data-related tasks to improve efficiency and reduce manual effort.
Cooperate with the support teams and provide L3 support to comply with predefined SLA‚Äôs


Key Qualifications


University degree in computer science, engineering, or comparable field.
3-5 years of experience as a Data Engineer or in a similar role.
Experience with data warehousing concepts and technologies.
Hands-on experience with Google Cloud Platform (GCP) data services (e.g., BigQuery, Cloud Storage)
Knowledge of dbt and version management tools (e.g. Git).
Experience with infrastructure as code (IaC) using Terraform.
Experience with workflow orchestration tools such as Airflow.
Strong proficiency in Python and SQL.
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.


Preferred Qualifications


Experience with CI/CD pipelines.
Experience working with SAP platforms as data sources (e.g., SAP ECC, SAP S/4HANA, SAP BW, SAP Datasphere).
Knowledge of SAP data structures and extraction methods.
Knowledge of data visualization tools (e.g. Looker).
Scrum methodology.

Title: IT Business Analyst
Description:
Introduction to role

We are looking for hardworking Business Analysts with substantial experience in the business analysis capability, likely having several years‚Äô business analysis experience within a global business including significant transformation. The role will include undertaking hands-on business analysis responsibilities on significant programmes, working with senior stakeholders from across our business to produce deliverables of the highest quality to delight our stakeholders.

You will also participate in the Core Functions business analysis capability through networking with peers from other functions in a broader capability network and undertaking professional development as appropriate. The Business Analyst role will report to the Business Analysis Lead and will be based in our Lisbon office.

Typical Accountabilities



Business Needs Identification - Operates at an enterprise level in assessing and defining business need and areas for improvement. Proactively seeks out opportunities to enhance and improve in line with strategic goals. Actively monitors and identifies capability gaps and proposes potential solutions through research internally and externally.
Business Analysis Planning - Selects the appropriate analysis approach to a piece of work depending on its complexity, level of risk, known assumptions, constraints, and dependencies. Proficient in scoping and recommending appropriate approaches. Capable of planning and managing their own and other team member‚Äôs activities to meet deliverables and deadlines. Accountable for performance and quality of analytical work delivered, both their own and the work of others.
Stakeholder Analysis & Change - Effectively identifies stakeholders from the Core Functions (primarily HR) and actively builds and maintains relationships according to individual stakeholder needs and levels of influence. Contributes to communication plans and change management for project and stakeholders.
Requirements Analysis and Design Definition - Responsible and accountable for requirements management plans including elicitation, approvals, processes, RAID, and scope impacts. Highly responsive to changing business priorities with the ability to plan ahead, accounting for potential changes and corrective actions. Advanced requirements elicitation and management skill-set; including traceability, testing, and validation. Leads the work with the business to identify functional and technical requirements, translating the requirements into design specifications reflecting Functional Design, User Interface Design, and Business Process Design. Closely partnering with the Architecture team, ensuring the technical solution will deliver the agreed business benefits.
Business Case Definition - Shapes and defines the business case, producing detailed business justification for investment including ROI and benefits realization.
Solution Evaluation - Highly proficient in analyzing and assessing solution proposals and able to articulate supporting reasoning. i.e., assessing business readiness, maximizing value vs. spend.
Work collaboratively with business stakeholders, IT Business Partners, business customers, process owners, IT Architecture, delivery, Test Lead and Change Management/Communication Lead.



Essential Skills/Experience



Degree in relevant discipline or formal certification in business analysis practice.
Proven experience of successfully deploying a variety of business analysis tools/techniques to enable business change.
Proven experience of working with complex integrated systems, using creative and strategic thinking to deliver exceptional results.
Strong engagement, communication, and stakeholder management skills, including excellent presentation and influencing skills.
Business acumen; challenge, negotiation, and influence.
Presentation, Communication & Facilitation skills.
Customer Focus; Stakeholder Management; Networking.
Benefits Management and Realisation.
Planning; Business Process Management; Requirements Management.
Experience of virtual collaboration to lead, shape, and develop innovative solutions.
Experience of mentoring, coaching or developing others.
Experience of working with and managing third-party suppliers/vendors.



Desirable Skills/Experience



Lean SIGMA training; Practical usage of Agile Methodology.
Experience of working in a global organisation with complex/geographical context.
Pharmaceutical business awareness/business domain knowledge.
HR business awareness/business domain knowledge including HR systems (e.g., Workday HCM, payroll, talent acquisition SaaS products).
User Centred Design (User Experience, User Interface Design, and Business Process Design).
Experience of working in a regulated environment.

Title: Data Engineer Internship
Description:
Keywords: Data Analytics, ETL, Oriented programming, SQL, Tableau, git, python

Your Main Activities Are


Development, maintenance, and support of data processing and analytical stacks
Ensure architecture meets business requirements
Recommend ways to efficiently provide quality data
Develop data ETL processes in production environment
Leverage large volumes of data from internal sources
Help global markets to achieve digital transformations
Proof of concept data projects with innovative methods or tools


Profile And Skills To Success


Master in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Electronic, Biomedical or similar Engineering Master
Knowledge with Python programming language (Java/C++/C# will be considered)
Proficient understanding of code versioning tools such as Git
Knowledge of SQL
Knowledge of Tableau
Knowledge and interest in financial markets
Strong communication and presentation skills both verbal and written
Effective problem solver and consensus builder
Team work and collaborative mind-set
Fluency in English


About The Team

The Global Client Analytics (GCA) team is responsible for providing data, insights and analysis to Global Markets front office on client activity. The team aims to build a solid database from various sources and develop analysis, reports and dashboards to provide valuable insight to the Front Office in a rapid, agile manner. The team in Lisbon is comprised of 9 members. The consumers of this data and analysis are over 1000 global Front Office users including Sales, Trading, Research and Senior Management. We are a global team, with presence in Europe, America, and Asia.

Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centers providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Quant Research AI
Description:
Your Main Activities Are


Collaborate with our GM Data and AI Lab teams to design, implement, and optimize AI solutions for various projects
Conduct independent research to identify opportunities for leveraging AI technology within the Markets 360 investment research domain
Contribute to the development of systematic and industrialized AI solutions to enhance investment strategies
Work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration of AI technologies into our existing infrastructure
Stay updated on the latest AI advancements and industry trends to continuously improve our Markets 360 research efforts


Profile And Skills To Success


Master‚Äôs degree in a numeric subject with understanding of economics and markets (eg.: Economics with a speciality in Econometrics, Finance, Computer Science, Applied Maths, Engineering, Physics)
Knowledge of key concepts in Statistics and Mathematics such as Probability Theory, Inference, and Linear Algebra
Programming skills‚ÄØin Python‚ÄØand knowledge of common numerical and machine-learning packages (NumPy,‚ÄØscikit-learn, pandas,‚ÄØKeras, TensorFlow,‚ÄØPyTorch)
Demonstrated experience in developing and implementing AI solutions, with a focus on large language models and natural language processing
Excellent teamwork and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
Ability to manage projects efficiently, including planning, execution, and monitoring
Understanding of the financial industry and investment research, including relevant regulations and compliance requirements


About The Team

Markets 360 is made up of around 100 economists, strategists and analysts across the Americas, Western Europe, CEEMEA and Asia Pacific, who work closely together to create cross-asset perspectives.

With a focus on value-added research and thought leadership, the aim is to publish clear, timely and thought-provoking pieces on topics ranging from financial and economic forecasts to in-depth analysis of particular assets, economies and themes.

The GM Data and AI Lab team is a small team of data scientists applying the latest techniques in Artificial Intelligence, Data modelling and Natural Language Processing to strategic projects for the business.

This role will be in Portugal, working alongside the AI Lab and the Markets 360 teams based across the globe.

About Global Markets

Global Markets is BNP Paribas‚Äô capital markets business within Corporate & Institutional Banking (CIB), delivering solutions across asset classes, and industry-leading services for clients including Institutional, corporate, private banks and retail distribution networks. Our Portugal Platform (Porto and Lisbon) is a major HUB in Europe and certainly unique in the country by its size and its scope of activity, with all Front Office roles present (Trading, Sales, Research, Structuring, Quant & Engineering, Business Dev and Support, Marketing & Client Support, Risk Management, Data Analytics and Machine Learning‚Ä¶)

Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Noesis Is Looking For Candidates With The Following Profile

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree or higher in Mathematics, Computer Science, Management Informatics or equivalent;
  • Minimum 2 years of professional experience mining data as a Data Analyst;
  • Good analytics skills, including mining, modelling logical and conceptual, evaluation and data visualization;
  • Strong Power BI, SQL or Excel skills, with aptitude for learning other analytics tools;
  • Dynamism, proactivity and ability to work in a team;
  • Customer oriented;
  • Fluency in English will be valued.

If you meet these conditions and would like to join an innovative organization that continuously invests in training its talents, send us your application.

Join us. Let's innovate together!

All our recruitment and selection processes are based on equal opportunities, valuing the competence and potential of each person and ensuring that no candidate is discriminated on the grounds of gender, ethnicity, sexual orientation, age, religion or physical condition.

Title: Web Data Analyst
Description:
Position Snapshot

‚ÄØ

Location: Braga/Lisbon (Portugal)

Company: Nestl√© Business Services (NBS)

Full-time/Hybrid mode

Fluent in English

Position Summary

The Web Data Analyst will be responsible for collecting, analyzing, and interpreting data from various web sources to help inform business decisions. They will work with cross-functional teams to identify key performance indicators (KPIs) and develop dashboards, reports, and presentations to communicate insights and recommendations.

‚ÄØ

About Us

‚ÄØ

Nestl√© Business Services (NBS) is at the heart of the Nestl√© Group. We provide Supply Chain, Financial, HR, Digital & Social Media, CRM and Consumer Engagement services to enable Nestl√© to engage with millions of consumers worldwide. We are a multicultural and diverse team of professionals. We are passionate about digital innovation and driving continuous improvement processes with colleagues across the world.

We are looking for talents who are eager to learn, team player, digitally-savvy, with an entrepreneurial mindset, and who can flourish in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.

If this describes you and you are looking to join a business where you can really add value, it is time to consider joining NBS!‚ÄØ

‚ÄØ

At Nestl√© Business Services (NBS), diversity and inclusion are core values. If you have any special needs, count on us to adapt your position.

A Day in the life of...


Collect and analyze data from web analytics tools (such as Google Analytics) and other data sources to identify trends and patterns.
Work with cross-functional teams to develop KPIs and establish benchmarks for website performance.
Project Management for data tracking implementation across multiple web properties
Build dashboards and reports to present data-driven insights and recommendations to stakeholders.
Conduct A/B testing and other experiments to evaluate the impact of changes to the website.
Collaborate with web developers and other stakeholders to ensure accurate data tracking and reporting.
Monitor website performance and provide regular reports on key metrics to stakeholders.
Stay up-to-date with emerging trends and technologies in web analytics and data analysis.


What Will Make You Successful


University Degree ideally specialized in Marketing, Public Relations, and/or Computer Science, Maths or any other related fields
2+ years of experience in Digital Technologies and Data & Analytics fields (focused in Website and Mobile Apps analytics)
Deep understanding of using data visualisation tools (Google Data studio, Power BI), product analytics dashboarding is a plus.
Basic SQL knowledge
Deep knowledge of Google Analytics (Universal Analytics and GA4)
Project Management skills and knowledge of agile methodologies (Scrum, Kanban)
Knowledge of Google Optimize and experience doing A/B testing
Basic understanding of Google Tag Manager
Proven Web Analytics experince (previous projects and experience)
Excel advanced knowledge (analyze & structure data)
Basic understanding on how website data layer works in Drupal CMS
High mathematical/analytical skills
Understanding marketing processes
High communication skills and coordination of multiple stakeholders in complex and fast changing environments


Data warehouse and cloud solutions basic understanding (GCP, BigQuery, Azure)

What We Offer

Here at NBS Lisbon we care about our Talents, and we continuously work to have our teams engaged and our people achieving their best professional performance, without forgetting personal development and work-life balance. Joining NBS Lisbon will bring you:


Development of expertise in Nestl√©‚Äôs Shared Services Business
Immersion in a culturally diverse team
Local and International Exposure
Flexible working environment
Engagement and wellbeing activities
Competitive salary and annual bonus according to your performance
Meal Card
Flex Benefits - At NBS Lisbon you can chose what benefit is more suitable to you
Make part of the Nestl√© Club and get discount in several partners
Free coffee (and good coffee)
Company laptop and other equipment according to professional needs
Medical Support available at the Office
E-learning courses and training program to get you where you aim to be
Career progression and possibilities for International Career

What Will Make You Successful

Data warehouse and cloud solutions basic understanding (GCP, BigQuery, Azure)

What We Offer

  • Flex Benefits - At NBS Lisbon you can chose what benefit is more suitable to you
  • Make part of the Nestl√© Club and get discount in several partners
  • Free coffee (and good coffee)
  • Company laptop and other equipment according to professional needs
  • Medical Support available at the Office
  • E-learning courses and training program to get you where you aim to be
  • Career progression and possibilities for International Career

Title: Analytic Consultant
Description:
Job Description

ABOUT THE ROLE

We are currently searching for a Consultant for the Revenue Growth Management team.

You will work together with some of the largest FMCG companies, helping them to make the right choices for their price and promo strategy, considering the impact on sales and P&L.

You will manage the Price and Promo projects, working together with the executive teams, analyzing the outputs of the projects, and providing insightful price and promo recommendations.

Your insights will influence decisions for some of today‚Äôs leading global companies.

Responsibilities


To be part of an international project team that helps FMCG clients optimizing their pricing and promotion activities
Use NielsenIQ tools and methodologies to build answers to business questions based on the market data and revenue management analysis
To convert analytical results into a business-focused and actionable client report
To deliver insights and recommendations to the client during formal or informal meetings
Coordinate project execution between experts‚Äô teams


a Little Bit About You

Curiosity drives your interest in what impacts the market. Managing time, deadlines and different projects comes naturally to you. You enjoy working with a good team spirit and you‚Äôre known for your organization and good communication. Connecting with clients matters to you, and that motivates you to sift through data to search for new angles. You can identify business potential and build a narrative behind numbers, and you are always looking for what‚Äôs next.

Qualifications


2 - 3 years of experience in a similar position/ business area
Previous experience in FMCG sector, preferably trade marketing, consumer insights, key account/category management, in which price, promo and revenue management figures are familiar variables
High level of business relationship skills
Strong analytical mindset and excellent numerical skills
Strong communication & visualization skills ‚Äì interested in storytelling techniques
Comfortable working in a digital-enabled environment
Experience working with PowerBI would be an asset
Ability to work independently
Knowledge of Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint;
Strong organizational & interpersonal skills;
University degree or equivalent experience;


What we can offer:


Work in dynamic environment engaging with local and global companies.
Benefits & flexible working hours, hybrid work options.
Internal trainings will be provided together with detailed onboarding agenda.
Access to learning platforms
Staff and team events


Our Benefits


Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)


#Hybrid

Additional Information

Our Benefits


Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)


About NIQ

NIQ is the world‚Äôs leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights‚Äîdelivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms‚ÄîNIQ delivers the Full View‚Ñ¢. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world‚Äôs population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Want to keep up with our latest updates?

Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion

HTML:
Job Description

ABOUT THE ROLE

We are currently searching for a Consultant for the Revenue Growth Management team.

You will work together with some of the largest FMCG companies, helping them to make the right choices for their price and promo strategy, considering the impact on sales and P&L.

You will manage the Price and Promo projects, working together with the executive teams, analyzing the outputs of the projects, and providing insightful price and promo recommendations.

Your insights will influence decisions for some of today‚Äôs leading global companies.

Responsibilities

  • To be part of an international project team that helps FMCG clients optimizing their pricing and promotion activities
  • Use NielsenIQ tools and methodologies to build answers to business questions based on the market data and revenue management analysis
  • To convert analytical results into a business-focused and actionable client report
  • To deliver insights and recommendations to the client during formal or informal meetings
  • Coordinate project execution between experts‚Äô teams

a Little Bit About You

Curiosity drives your interest in what impacts the market. Managing time, deadlines and different projects comes naturally to you. You enjoy working with a good team spirit and you‚Äôre known for your organization and good communication. Connecting with clients matters to you, and that motivates you to sift through data to search for new angles. You can identify business potential and build a narrative behind numbers, and you are always looking for what‚Äôs next.

Qualifications

  • 2 - 3 years of experience in a similar position/ business area
  • Previous experience in FMCG sector, preferably trade marketing, consumer insights, key account/category management, in which price, promo and revenue management figures are familiar variables
  • High level of business relationship skills
  • Strong analytical mindset and excellent numerical skills
  • Strong communication & visualization skills ‚Äì interested in storytelling techniques
  • Comfortable working in a digital-enabled environment
  • Experience working with PowerBI would be an asset
  • Ability to work independently
  • Knowledge of Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint;
  • Strong organizational & interpersonal skills;
  • University degree or equivalent experience;

What we can offer:

  • Work in dynamic environment engaging with local and global companies.
  • Benefits & flexible working hours, hybrid work options.
  • Internal trainings will be provided together with detailed onboarding agenda.
  • Access to learning platforms
  • Staff and team events

Our Benefits

  • Flexible working environment
  • Volunteer time off
  • LinkedIn Learning
  • Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)

#Hybrid

Additional Information

Our Benefits

  • Flexible working environment
  • Volunteer time off
  • LinkedIn Learning
  • Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)

About NIQ

NIQ is the world‚Äôs leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights‚Äîdelivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms‚ÄîNIQ delivers the Full View‚Ñ¢. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world‚Äôs population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Want to keep up with our latest updates?

Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Title: Fraud Reporting Data Analyst (Power BI)
HTML:
Your connection with Aubay starts in the following lines:

Aubay Portugal is a multinational French company, in Portugal since 2007. We have offices in Lisbon and Oporto and we are a specialized consultant in Management, Implementation, Development and Maintenance of Information Systems. We have more than 150 active partners and we operate in sectors such as banking, insurance, telecommunications, services, energy and transports.


What are we looking for?

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field;
  • Previous experience in analytical roles with a strong ability to interpret data;
  • Hands-on experience developing reports and dashboards with Power BI and other Microsoft tools;
  • Proficiency in SQL and DAX;
  • Solid experience in designing, developing, and maintaining ETL processes;
  • Fluent in English.


What do we have to offer you?

  • Health Insurance;
  • Feedback&Coffee ‚Äì the system that includes Aubay‚Äôs Performance Management Cycle, with regular moments of feedback and the Career Progression Model;
  • Working model: Remote;
  • A Training Academy designed to think of you and your needs. You can count on technical and behavioural training sessions (e-Learning and classroom), Meet&Techs, Webinars and Mentoring;
  • Events and Teambuildings.


What makes us different?

  • Our organizational culture is based on values such as transparency, team spirit, regular feedback and continuous learning;
  • Reference prizes and birthday present;
  • Lounge;
  • We don‚Äôt have a dress code;
  • We know your name and all address each other informally;
  • Coffee and varied snacks at your disposal;
  • You will grow in good company.Isn‚Äôt this one of the ways in which to develop professionally?


If we got your attention, we now hope to spark your enthusiasm. Ready for the first phase?

We are waiting for you at lpaulo@aubay.pt.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Mission

Job Description

Quantitative Data Intelligence (QDI) team is responsible for providing data, insights, and analysis to Global Markets front office.

The team aims to build a solid database from various sources and develop analysis, reports and dashboards to provide valuable insight to the Front Office in a rapid, agile manner.

Our team is responsible for multiple steps regarding data processing: Data Feeds industrialization, ETL, Data Warehousing and Data Visualization. We are in direct contact with business sponsors, sales, and traders.

We seek to shape the technologies available to the client‚Äôs needs - we plan in processing the data using Python and SQL, while delivering the final product in Tableau, Power BI, APIs, and Chat bots.

Main Tasks


To be part of an international and diverse team who helps Global Markets Front Office to get to know their clients better and identify opportunities and trends through what data can tell.
As a Data Analyst, you will play a vital role in our team. Working directly with one or more of the bank's business areas, you will provide valuable insights to drive business growth, understanding their needs, proposing and implementing data-driven solutions (analysis, visualization and automation). You will exercise a lot of problem identification and problem solving
You will have the opportunity to take ownership of business essential analytical projects that involve retrieving, preparing and analysing complex datasets using data/statistical models and best practices in data visualization for the reporting creation, with the goal to produce insights and automated tools that will guide strategic
You will move between technical and non-technical areas and should be able to communicate well with different types of professionals. It is very important to be able to clearly and concisely understand stakeholder‚Äôs‚Äô needs and translate these to our technical team, as well as present the results of complex analysis
You will move between technical and non-technical areas and should be able to communicate well with different types of professionals. It is very important to be able to clearly and concisely understand stakeholder‚Äôs‚Äô needs and translate these to our technical team, as well as present the results of complex analysis


Perfil

Technical Skills


Academic background in Engineering, Economics, Computing, Mathematics, Statistics or related fields
Experience in any data visualization tool such as Tableau or Power BI
Experience in data analysis with programming, preferably Python (Pandas)
Proficiency in SQL
Knowledge of descriptive statistics and hypothesis testing is a plus
Knowledge in Big Data technology such as Pyspark, Presto and Airflow is a plus
Knowledge of Power Query and DAX is a plus


Language Skills


Fluency in English


Soft Skills


Be driven, enthusiastic and dynamic in search of improving processes, controls & procedure
Be pro-active, enthusiastic and able to work well in a team

Title: Business Intelligence
Description:
Mutual Respect, Empathy, Innovation, and Professional Pride. Do you see yourself within these values?




Founded in 2006 with the mission "To Challenge Complexity", Closer Consulting is a Data Science company specializing in Business Intelligence, Advanced Analytics, and Artificial Intelligence.

Developing projects in the most diverse industries ‚Äì Banking, Telecommunications, Healthcare, Retail, Energy, Insurance, and Aviation, among others ‚Äì, we have created an environment where the brightest enquiring minds feel at home, providing our people with the means, opportunities and support they need to thrive and innovate.




We seek a Business Intelligence Consultant willing to accept new challenges in our Closer team in a hybrid/remote model (*Lisboa - must live in Portugal - mandatory).




Are you the one?




Design data schemas, modeling data structures and perform data migrations.
Design high-performance data pipelines & ETL processes.
Business Intelligence Professional ‚Äì Key Qualifications.
Minimum of 3 years of experience with SQL.
Hands-on experience with SSIS (SQL Server Integration Services).
Proficient in Power BI (DAX) for data visualization and reporting.
Preferred knowledge of Databricks, Microsoft Fabric, and Python.
Strong interest and enthusiasm for consultancy work.




We believe we are the ones to, by:

Providing a multidisciplinary Team.
Giving a home office kit with everything you need to perform remotely.
Ensuring a career plan alongside professional growth.
Providing you with a custom training plan.
Helping you reach happiness.




Oh‚Ä¶ and by the way, we also have:

Several challenging complex projects.
Stimulating teams and leaders.
World-class Clients and Partners.




If you believe in this match as much as we do, send us your CV to joana.ferreira@closer.pt and reach the closer side of life.

Title: Data Analyst (Internship)
Description:
About greenmetrics.ai




greenmetrics.ai is a Lisbon-based startup at the forefront of climate adaptation and environmental sustainability. We develop cutting-edge technological solutions using smart sensors, IoT connectivity and data analytics to collect and process environmental data, enabling our users to improve resilience against extreme weather events like floods, droughts and biodiversity loss.




We envision a future in which technology and human ingenuity are allies of the natural world, a future where data guides us on the path to a more sustainable, balanced and resilient way of living, preserving the delicate balance of our planet for future generations.




We are a bootstrapped, independent, profitable startup, with proven technology and systems operating in +15 cities in Portugal. We are starting our international expansion to Europe, Brazil and Latin America and we need your contribution to help us accelerate towards our goals.




The Role




As a Data Analyst Intern, you‚Äôll work closely with our analytics and strategic teams, collecting and examining environmental data, applying Python-based tools to uncover trends, and crafting compelling visualizations that drive effective climate adaptation strategies. You'll enjoy the freedom to propose creative data analytics approaches and generate actionable insights that help shape climate policies and develop state-of-the-art risk assessment tools.

Whether you‚Äôre developing data-driven solutions to tackle climate challenges, scaling our current analytics capabilities, or pioneering fresh visualization strategies, your work will deepen our understanding of climate change and enhance our ability to navigate an increasingly uncertain world. Join us, and be a catalyst for change as we empower communities to make informed, impactful decisions for a sustainable future.




You will be responsible for:




Implementing innovative data analytics frameworks that account for future climate scenarios to conduct climate vulnerability analyses and improve adaptation efforts.
Collecting data from environmental datasets to perform climate resilience assessments.
Performing comprehensive analyses to identify patterns, trends and correlations using statistical methods and Python libraries and tools.
Creating visualizations to communicate assessment results and conclusions effectively.
Participating in strategic projects that influence the definition of adaptation actions.
Documenting findings and conclusions through structured reports.
Supporting the development of data visualization platforms and tools.




Your profile:




A strong background in Data Analytics, Data Engineering or any related field that provides a solid foundation for the role's responsibilities.
Proven practical experience working with data analytics or data engineering in previous positions or personal projects.
Proficiency with Python libraries and tools (e.g. Jupyter notebooks, NumPy, Plotly, Pandas) to explore, transform and load datasets and develop analyses.
A proactive and resourceful attitude to engage with stakeholders in obtaining new datasets.
Comfort in obtaining data from API sources and working with Git for version control.
Excellent capacity to communicate complex data insights verbally and in writing in Portuguese and English.
Experience using GIS or GeoPandas for geospatial data analysis is a plus.




Learning Outcomes:




Gain hands-on experience in developing and applying data analytics frameworks within the climate tech sector.
Enhance your ability to perform detailed data analyses and create visualizations that effectively communicate complex insights.
Develop a strong understanding of climate vulnerability assessments and resilience strategies through real-world projects.
Build proficiency in using advanced Python libraries and tools for data analysis and visualization.
Strengthen your collaborative skills by working alongside experts in data science and climate research on impactful projects.




Position Details:




Workload: Full-time Paid Internship

Duration: 6 months

Preferred Model: Hybrid (Based in Portugal)

Application Start: 06/apr

Application Deadline: 27/apr

Planned Start Date: 01/may




Application Process:




No need to prepare a cover letter for this application but we will need a couple of things from you:

Linkedin profile
Updated CV
Answers to 5 application questions

Ôªø

We know you are busy and we respect your time, so we prepared a short application form with the purpose of knowing you better, understanding your skills, strengths and interests so we can guarantee that we‚Äôre a match!




We want to make sure that you will feel motivated and excited about taking part on this journey. So we ask you to answer confidently and consider that there are no right or wrong answers to these questions.




This application form should take you less than 30 minutes to complete.
