Title: Reporting & Analytics Application Specialist
HTML:
Company Description

As one of the leading automotive suppliers worldwide, we develop solutions to fulfill people¬¥s dreams of mobility on a daily basis. Driver safety, sustainability and industrialization of future tech¬≠nology are just some of our key fields where we already make a meaningful difference in the every¬≠day life of people. Knowing our technology helps to make the world a better and safer place is what drives us.

Job Description

The Tires Purchasing team is looking for a team member, located in Lousado (Portugal). This professional will report to the area of Purchasing Data Management in Hanover (Germany) and locally to the Local Coordinator of Tires Sector Purchasing Controlling & Analytics. The main purpose of this position is to define and provide, from business side, solutions and the required information to ensure and track strategic purchasing decisions and transparency on purchasing contribution for Tires Sector of Continental. More detailed activities consist on:

Projects related:

  • Adjustment and optimization of existing Business Intelligence applications based e.g. SAP BW, MS Power BI, etc;
  • Development of new reports according to requirements of Tire Purchasing (including training of users);
  • Ensure consistent and efficient usage of data across different system platforms for reporting and decision making within Tire Purchasing;
  • Automation of data management processes related to reporting / monitoring of KPIs;

Operations and General level related:

  • Assure availability, correctness and quality of data content and applications in cooperation with IT;
  • Take full business ownership of reporting & analytics applications;
  • Communication with internal stakeholders;
  • Support users in Purchasing community (centrally, plant level, business areas;
  • Develop ideas to enhance the usability and effective usage of data within the organization.

Qualifications

  • University degree preferentially in Business Administration/ Information Management or similar;
  • Minimum 2 years of experience in Systems design & implementation / Experience in Purchasing or Controlling;
  • Experience and ability to work in international environment;
  • Advanced analytical skills (Methodical & Technical);
  • Knowledge about SAP MM/BI/SRM and Cloud Technology (Data Lake/Power BI)
  • Understanding about Purchasing Process (for RM and NPM);
  • Basic Knowledge of Project Management Skills;
  • Good communication skills;
  • Good English capabilities (minimum B2 European level)
  • Other valuable competencies: Stakeholder & Customer Focus; Quality Orientation; Taking Initiative; Planning and Organizing; Problem Solving.

Additional Information

Ready to drive with Continental? Take the first step and fill in the online application.

Title: Traded Risk Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job

The mission of RISK Market & Financial Institutions (‚ÄúRISK MFI‚Äù) is to provide the Senior Management of the Group, of the RISK Function and of Global Markets (‚ÄúGM‚Äù) and of Securities and Services with full transparency and dynamic analysis and monitoring of market, counterparty, valuation and liquidity risks originated and managed by CIB and of credit risks on Financial Institutions in order to assist them in their risk decision making and monitoring.

The Digital team within RISK MFI review processes and develops light IT solutions to automate the many risk management processes and analysis dashboards of the RISK MFI department.

Each project is undertaken in a predefined environment and withing specific guidelines built in coordination with the RISK IT department.

There is a strong focus in improving the user experience and exploiting efficiently and timely the vast amount of available data.

An understanding of the risk management purpose behind those processes is therefore key.

Past projects have focused on automation of processes in Python, app development with interactive visualisations, BOT development, APIs, etc.

The role encompasses the maintenance and support of existing tools, taking the lead on new developments, the close collaboration with the risk managers to shape an efficient visualisation of the data and related workflow of decisions.

The Digital team works in close collaboration with the RISK IT department, making sure best coding practices are followed. It allows for a smooth the path to production of the tools developed by the team. For many projects, the Digital team directly codes in the official production systems under the guidance of RISK IT colleagues.

The team uses a variety of technologies but specialises in Python, with some exposure to HTML, CSS, JavaScript, etc.

The team is based in London, Lisbon and Porto and operates following Agile principles . The team works alongside around 500 people focusing on Market, Counterparty and Liquidity risk topics.

Your Main Activities Are


Inquisitive with a strong willingness to understand financial risk management, with a strong attention to detail.
Ability to gather, integrate, process and simplify large amounts of information
Ability to ensure the relevancy of the work done, the correct presentation of details and the full accomplishment of tasks
Value and integrate client's feedback to improve products, services and processes.
Aims at increasing client satisfaction and anticipating their needs.
Ability to anticipate and takes initiative to answer a particular situation, to learn from experiences and to deploy curiosity about topics outside their immediate scope.
Ability to manage time, to plan, structure, prioritise and coordinate activities and resources effectively to reach objectives.


Profile And Skills To Success


A strong appetite to working in the financial industry and understanding of financial risk management,
An experience related to financial markets and risk management is an advantage
Master‚Äôs degree in Finance, Mathematics, Science or Engineering.
2 to 5 years of working experience in a relevant data analysis field.
On programming skills, a solid working knowledge of Python is required, with a strong understanding of numpy, pandas, etc


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.

  • International reach

Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions

  • Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
  • Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
  • Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
  • Diversity and Inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

  • Commitment towards work/life balance

At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.

  • Remote Working Conditions

At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal

  • Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
  • In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Data Analyst (Alteryx Developer)
Description:
Company Description

Natixis in Portugal is part of the Global Financial Services division, where it applies technology for the development of financial expertise in its two global business lines ‚Äì Corporate & Investment Banking and Asset & Wealth Management ‚Äì and, transversally, for the entities of Groupe BPCE.

The Centre of Expertise, based in Porto, currently has more than 2,400 employees from over 30 nationalities, organised in three main departments: Information Technology, Banking Support Activities and Compliance. These teams work in an integrated, inclusive and transversal way, supporting and creating value for all the business lines and platforms of the group. The project in Porto is one of the biggest investments in Human Resources ever made by Groupe BPCE worldwide.

A disruptive mindset and a culture of proximity and agility identify Natixis in Portugal Team and reflect the company's mission to transform traditional banking at a global scale: a perfect match in the Portuguese dynamics and entrepreneurial ecosystem.

In 2024, Top Employers Institute has awarded Natixis in Portugal the Top Employer Portugal accreditation for the second time. This certification recognizes excellence in people practices, following the example of our head office, in France, who was certified Top Employer France for the eight year in a row.

Job Description

As an Data Analyst, you will work alongside our Data Analysts, Data Engineers, BI Engineers, Business Analysts, Software Engineers, and others in the Application teams, from the specification to the implementation phase to improve our applications and business lines decisions. In addition, promote Data Centric mindset & Data Driven company.

Context / Team / Project:


Integrate into our Data Team (ETL, Data Management, BI), working together with Paris and Porto team members, as a unique team, and help Porto to upskill on this practice.
Bring a differentiating expertise to our clients and stakeholders with integrity and responsibility. (Sustainable impact)
Be agile, accountable, and resilient, according to the circumstances (Entrepreneurial mindset)
Purposely striving to succeed together, Porto and Paris, as one team with openness and confidence to improve knowledge, practice, framework, ecosystem (Collective intelligence).
Contribute on local initiative and project from awareness, assessment, use case identification, data preparation, implementation, industrialization‚Ä¶
Contribute to data community.


Main Tasks & Responsibilities:


Work closely with business users to understand their requirements to solve business problems.
Translate these requirements into an Alteryx workflow, working with other IT teams, local and otherwise, to make data processed and available for users.
Develop the workflows following the IT software development governance rules.
Analyze, estimate, and define tasks necessary deliver the data projects.
Maintain and do the evolution of created assets during the projects.


Qualifications


4 Years of experience;
BS/MS Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Applied Math, or a similar area;
Experience in data preparation and data reconciliation
Proven Alteryx experience: + 2 years


Other Requirements:


Good communication.
Able to be quickly autonomous, proactive.
Good level of English - minimum B2 (mandatory)
A real passion for learning, doing things better and helping others, and an ability to turn ideas into realities.
Availability to travel abroad for short periods of time, as required.


Nice to Have / Plus:


Other low code/no code tools like Power BI, Dataiku & Knime
SQL and VBA
Previous experience on financial area.
Knowledge in agile methodologies and tools (Scrum/Kanban)
French


Additional Information

At Natixis, we are committed to fostering a working environment where each and every one of our people is treated with dignity and respect and where every voice is heard. Our differences make us collectively stronger and are a source of fulfilment, innovation and performance.

In the framework of its Diversity, Equity & Inclusion policy, Natixis in Portugal has implemented a Blind CV Screening process, with the purpose of reducing hiring bias. A blind CV excludes any personal details which refer to the applicant‚Äôs gender, age or ethnicity. When applying for our positions, please submit a blind CV, that is, with no picture, name, gender, age, nationality, ethnicity and address. Your personal statement, work experience, courses and certifications, education, skills and contact information is what matters to us.

#MuchMoreThanJustAJob

Early morning. Campo 24 de Agosto. In 4 minutes, you are clocking in at the office. Start your day having breakfast with the Team and grab fresh fruit on the way to your seat, in one of Porto‚Äôs most typical neighborhoods. This Purple Day is going to be a busy one: daily meeting ensuring all team members are on the same page regarding work status, priorities and blockers, language class and, just after, a Talent Management meeting with your manager, discussing your career path.

Lunch break. Today, your Team is onboarding newcomers, but also welcoming French colleagues: the perfect excuse to walk downtown and bond over a francesinha. When returning, inhale nature and peace of mind in Natixis Urban Garden (look at the crops; ready to harvest!).

Back inside. Brainstorming session on a new, exciting project in our disruptive and immersive Manaus Village. The afternoon went flying (tasks, meetings, some jokes with your teammates). End it on a high note: celebrating cultural diversity with a Diwali, the Indian festival of lights.

Tomorrow, you attend a conference led by influential speakers in your industry and, the day after, you will work from home, benefitting from some focus time to complete that report and soft skills course on LinkedIn Learning. Once you are done with your work for the day, strike the right note playing with Natixis band or be part of a board games session. If that is too steady for you, meet your colleagues to catch some waves or sail the Douro river during golden hour.

If that is too steady for you, meet your colleagues to catch some waves or sail the Douro river during golden hour.

Title: Data & Reporting Analyst
Description:
Responsibilities

Ensure the regular production of KPIs.

Ensure the quality of the produced KPIs.

Guarantee that KPIs are adequately commented on by the right stakeholders.

Reporting

Reports directly to the transversal IT structure.

Your future duties and responsibilities

Main Functions

Coordinate data collection, analysis, and transformation (ETL) and produce the necessary data for reports.

Create and produce periodic or on-demand reports on processes and data.

Ensure data quality and continuous improvement.

Manage evolution topics.

Work closely with the corporate IT organization with global contact.

Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role

Main Skills

Academic degree in IT, Cybersecurity, or another relevant area.

Proficiency in English (French is a plus).

At least 5 years of professional experience in data analysis.

Strong expertise in Excel, Python, and ETL tools.

Expertise in Power BI is mandatory.

Ability to work autonomously.

Commitment to job and team objectives.

Systematic, critical, and logical thinking.

Strong commitment, demand for quality, and pedagogical skills.

Continuous focus on delivering high-quality results.

Adherence to procedures, methodologies, and directives.

Capacity to manage stress and conflicts effectively.

Good listening and questioning skills.

Ability to plan ahead and prioritize tasks.

Strong team spirit.

Together, as owners, let‚Äôs turn meaningful insights into action.

Life at CGI is rooted in ownership, teamwork, respect and belonging. Here, you‚Äôll reach your full potential because‚Ä¶

You are invited to be an owner from day 1 as we work together to bring our Dream to life. That‚Äôs why we call ourselves CGI Partners rather than employees. We benefit from our collective success and actively shape our company‚Äôs strategy and direction.

Your work creates value. You‚Äôll develop innovative solutions and build relationships with teammates and clients while accessing global capabilities to scale your ideas, embrace new opportunities, and benefit from expansive industry and technology expertise.

You‚Äôll shape your career by joining a company built to grow and last. You‚Äôll be supported by leaders who care about your health and well-being and provide you with opportunities to deepen your skills and broaden your horizons.

Come join our team‚Äîone of the largest IT and business consulting services firms in the world.

Title: Sustainability Analyst (f/m/div)
Description:
Are you passionate about sustainability, forward-thinking reporting, and shaping the future of corporate responsibility in a dynamic, international company? Then, this is the perfect opportunity for you! Join us as a Sustainability Analyst and contribute to Infineon‚Äôs global initiatives that make a difference.

Job Description

As a Sustainability Analyst, you will support key sustainability reporting and compliance efforts in a dynamic and international environment. You will help drive transparency, align with regulatory standards, and contribute to impactful initiatives across the organization.

In your new role, you will:


Assist in conducting the Double Material Assessment
Actively contribute to the preparation of non-financial reporting and collaborate on the development and implementation of concepts to meet future reporting requirements
Provide support for the overall reporting process and documentation
Conduct benchmarking activities and perform analyses
Coordinate effectively with internal interface partners
Coordinate legislative matters within the relevant field of activity
Participate in projects with a primary focus on non-financial reporting and related topics
Contribute to the EU Taxonomy assessment and classification by analyzing legal requirements and regulatory changes
Support global projects across the entire field of activity


Your Profile

You bring a sharp analytical mindset along with strong communication skills. You are solution-oriented, thrive in fast-paced environments, and enjoy working across cultures and departments to drive impactful results.

You are best equipped for this task if you have:


A degree in Sustainability, Natural Sciences or Economics, Business Law, or a similar field of studies
At least 2 years of professional experience in the field of sustainability or non-financial reporting in a company or auditing firm, preferably in an international and multicultural environment
Strong MS Office knowledge, especially Word, PowerPoint, and Excel
Good analytical skills, strong communication, teamwork mindset, and highly solution-oriented approach
Fluency in English ‚Äì proficiency in German would be an advantage


Please send us your CV in English.

Contact:

Carla Almeida, LinkedIn

#WeAreIn for driving decarbonization and digitalization.

As a global leader in semiconductor solutions in power systems and IoT, Infineon enables game-changing solutions for green and efficient energy, clean and safe mobility, as well as smart and secure IoT. Together, we drive innovation and customer success, while caring for our people and empowering them to reach ambitious goals. Be a part of making life easier, safer and greener.

Are you in?


Welcome at Infineon Technologies Business Solutions in Porto! -


Infineon Technologies Business Solutions is a vibrant global hub, driven by diverse talents and an operational culture of excellence, in a privileged geographic location. The team of more than 25 nationalities works together in a dynamic, diverse and inclusive environment. We lead innovation and digital transformation, shaping the future of Infineon Technologies. At the heart of everything we do, people matter most. Our ultimate goal is to craft a unique experience for both our customers and employees.

At our site you will find a range of diverse teams that have built a reputation for delivering high-quality services for all Infineon in Finance, Procurement, Human Resources, IT, Audit, Legal, Compliance, Business Continuity and Sustainability, Cyber Security, Communication, Corporate Supply Chain Logistics and Sales & Marketing. Porto is a powerhouse of ideas and solutions, a key player in the global company‚Äôs puzzle, delivering specialized services and innovative solutions.

Together, Infineon Technologies Business Solutions will continue to shape the future, driving innovation and excellence for years to come.

We are on a journey to create the best Infineon for everyone.

This means we embrace diversity and inclusion and welcome everyone for who they are. At Infineon, we offer a working environment characterized by trust, openness, respect and tolerance and are committed to give all applicants and employees equal opportunities. We base our recruiting decisions on the applicant¬¥s experience and skills.

We look forward to receiving your resume, even if you do not entirely meet all the requirements of the job posting.

Please let your recruiter know if they need to pay special attention to something in order to enable your participation in the interview process.

Click here for more information about Diversity & Inclusion at Infineon.

Title: Data Analyst (0 Experience Required)
Description:
For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.




At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.




As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.




With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.




So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!




Benefits

Work up to 20 hours per week.
Earn a competitive rate of pay.
Develop your research skills.
Avoid the long commute.
Work from the comfort of your home office.
Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!




Ideal Candidate

Fluent in English and Portugese.
Excellent research skills.
Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Portugal.
Analytical mindset.




Job Requirements

Must be living in Portugal for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
All work must be of an independent nature.







T&C's apply*




Apply Online Today!

Title: Data Analyst | Retail
Description:
Make an impact by working for sectors where technology is the enabler, everything is ground-breaking and there‚Äôs a constant need to be innovative.

Create and enhance projects in Java, Pyhton, Angular, PHP, .NET and so much more while diving in the world of Blockchain, Artificial Intelligence, Data Science, Security and Internet of Things.

Be part of the team that combines business knowledge, technological edge and a design experience. Our different backgrounds and know-how are key in developing solutions and experiences for digital clients.

Face challenges and learn other ways of thinking and seeing the world - there‚Äôs always room for your energy and creativity.

About The Role

A Data Analyst is responsible for examining and interpreting complex data sets to derive meaningful insights and support business decision-making. Focused on descriptive and diagnostic analytics to answer questions of where your company has been, where it is now, why things are the way they are now and support the decision about what are the next steps.

Their mission involves organizing data, conducting statistical analysis, creating data models, and collecting data requirements from Business.

Data analysts collaborate with different teams to understand their analytical requirements, identify key metrics, and communicate data-driven findings to stakeholders effectively.

As a part of your job, you will:


Gathering and analyzing business requirements to determine the best solution for data reporting and analysis.
Designing data solutions such as data warehousing, data marts, dashboards, and reporting systems.
Developing and maintaining data models, reports, and visualizations.
Collaborating with IT teams to ensure proper data integration and management.
Assisting stakeholders in interpreting data insights and making informed business decisions.



What are we looking for?


Retail experience;
At least 8 years of experience in data analysis, with a demonstrated track record of delivering actionable insights and driving business impact;
Proficiency in SQL for data querying and analysis;
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, or matplotlib);
Knowledge of statistical analysis techniques and tools (e.g., R, Python libraries like pandas);
Ability to interpret and analyze complex data sets;
Familiarity with data cleansing and preparation techniques.



Personal traits


Ability to adapt to different contexts, teams, and Clients;
Teamwork skills but also a sense of autonomy;
Motivation for international projects and ok if travel is included;
Willingness to collaborate with other players;
Strong communication skills.



At Celfocus, we are committed to cultivate a diverse and inclusive workplace. As an equal-opportunity employer, we welcome applicants of all backgrounds, gender identities, and abilities. We are dedicated to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with specific needs. If you require any adjustments during the selection process, please inform our Talent Acquisition Team.

Come join the Team!

Celfocus is a European high-tech system integrator, providing leading edge professional services focused on creating business value through Analytics and Cognitive solutions ‚Äì addressing Telecommunications, Financial Services, Retail, Energy & Utilities, Pharmaceutical, and other markets' strategic opportunities.

As a highly specialised engineering company, Celfocus helps clients undergo their innovation path, providing technological solutions to extract value from data and make it actionable.

Serving clients in +25 countries, Celfocus delivers solutions that boost customer experience and enhance operational efficiency, via our Cognitive Automation, Data & Analytics and Digital offers.

Title: Data Analyst | ETL Developer
HTML:
Dellent is a consulting company focused in System Information and Telecommunications. Our goal is to help our candidates and consultants to take a step forward in their careers through projects that meet their needs and expectations.

This project is part of the business investment banking and financial services area, and currently has its technological hub in Porto and is working on the development of innovative solutions and support for all operations related to the business.

We are looking for a Data Analyst | ETL Developer to work in this project in Porto (Hybrid).

Requirements

  • Between 3 to 6 years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or a related role;
  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field;
  • Proven experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role (+ 3 years);
  • Knowledge of SQL for data extraction and manipulation;
  • Familiarity with ETL processes; experience with Stambia is a plus;
  • Experience with Google Cloud Platform (GCP) is a plus;
  • Proficiency in Power BI for data visualization and reporting is a plus;
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills;
  • Excellent communication skills in both French and English;
  • Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment;
  • Must be french-speaker, at least C1.

We Offer

  • Health insurance;
  • A personalized training plan, with a budget to spend on the training and technical books you find necessary;
  • Constant feedback so you can grow professionally;
  • Remote onboarding process;
  • Team events every semester so you can live new adventures;
  • Culture of proximity and transparency. Your ideas and needs are heard and valued by us!

Apply

If the above sounds like the kind of job opportunity you would want to get involved with, then please do not hesitate to apply here. You can also explore our content about the job market here.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Back in 1966, in Marseilles, when the world was talking about Start Trek üöÄ, Sodexo was serving its first customers, initiating our journey in the Quality-of-Life Services leaded by the bold Pierre Bellon.




Since then, we continued our adventure of offering everyday need solutions, improving the life of our users across the globe üåé supported by more than 400 thousand dedicated and brave colleagues, in 64 countries, that lead us to where we are today.




üáµüáπ Portugal is no exception and 5 years ago, our shared service center ‚Äì Sodexo Business Services ‚Äì SBS, was born! In here, you will have the chance to be part of several üìäüßæFinancial teams like Record to Report, Order to Cash, Purchase to Pay, Financial Analysis, Master Data, among others, that support European markets, making sure the business continues to growth.




üí• Are you bold enough to join our crew, with your unique character and ideas, and make us even bigger?




üíº We are waiting for you! And so, your career!




In the meantime, check the opportunity below:







SENIOR DATA ENGINEER




‚öô What will you do?

1.Tech Lead

Privileged technical point of contact for the Product Owner and business sponsors
Ability to take data engineering responsibility of a data project
Listening skills and very good communication skills
Ability to manage technical debt (variable according to use cases)
Technical architect, lead design meetings and tech breakdowns
Ability to mentor, guide the work of a more junior Data Engineer




2.Data Ingestion & Processing:

Design and implement batch and real-time data ingestion pipelines.
Use Databricks (with PySpark) for big data processing tasks.
Use DBT to transform data.
Cleanse, transform, and enrich raw data to make it analytics ready.
Optimize queries and data processing for speed and cost efficiency.




3.Data Storage & Management:

Design and implement database schemas, tables, and views.
Optimize storage formats for querying, such as Parquet or Delta Lake.
Enforce data quality checks and data lineage documentation.
Implement partitioning, bucketing, and indexing strategies for efficient data retrieval.




4.Collaboration with data experts (data analyst, data scientists):

Work closely with data scientists to provide data in appropriate formats for machine learning and advanced analytics.
Collaborate with Platform Engineer teams to comply with Platform good practices and escalate common needs
Assist data analysts with SQL queries, views, and report generation.
Collaborate on the deployment of machine learning models to production.




5.Security & Compliance (with Azure security experts):

Implement role-based access controls and data encryption (at-rest and in-transit).
Comply with industry and organizational data standards, privacy regulations, and best practices.
Regularly audit data access and usage.




6.Infrastructure & Configuration (with Azure infrastructure experts):

Set up and maintain Azure cloud infrastructure.
Configure and optimize Azure Data Lake Storage, Blob Storage, and other Azure storage solutions.
Deploy and manage Databricks clusters for processing tasks.
Implement and maintain data pipelines using Azure Data Factory.
Monitor and troubleshoot infrastructure-related issues.




7.Documentation & Training:

Onboard new team members, providing access and initial training on tools.
Create documentation and knowledge bases for data pipelines, best practices, and tooling.




8.Continuous Improvement:

Stay updated with the latest advancements in data engineering technologies.
Propose and implement optimizations for current workflows and systems.
Proactively identify areas of improvement and automation.
Regularly update team on new features or changes in Azure, Databricks, or related technologies.




ü§ô What you'll need to succeed?:

Engineering Master‚Äôs degree or PhD
5 years+ experience in a Data engineering role into large corporate organizations
Experience in a Data/AI environment into a Cloud ecosystem
Python & Data Manipulation experience (Panda libraries and Python ecosystem)
Familiar with Software Engineering Practices
Advanced SQL Skills and Database Management and Architecture
Data integration and Data modelling and ETL experience
Big Data Processing knowledge
Cloud Platforms & Azure Services proficiency
Performance Optimization skills:
Data Security & Compliance knowledge
DevOps & Automation experience
Monitoring & Troubleshooting familiarity
Leadership & Initiative
Empathy & Accountability
Communication & Collaboration
Problem Solving & Analytical Thinking
Attention to Detail
Adaptability & Continuous Learning




üéâ What we have to offer you?

Hybrid working model;
Flexible working hours;
Health & Life Insurance;
Attractive Meal allowance paid in Meal Card;
Additional Days off: extra vacation day, employee‚Äôs birthday, volunteering day;
More than 6000 free online courses;
Opportunity to grow professionally inside the Company;
Possibility to participate in multicultural projects;
Several internal activities aiming to promote our team¬¥s wellbeing.




We are waiting for you!




Send us your CV to our email Recruitment.SBS.Portugal@sodexo.com with the title of the role on the subject and check all the opportunities on our career website (https://www.sodexo.com/en/contact-us/sbs-porto/porto-jobs)




Find out more about Sodexo: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XX7PoE9kazU




Sodexo is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment.

At Sodexo we believe in Privacy and your Privacy is very important to us that¬¥s why your personal data will only be used for the purpose of managing our recruitment process, will be processed in accordance to the GDPR and treated confidentially. For further information about how we process your personal data please reach out to privacy.sbs@sodexo.com.

Title: Research Building Analyst
Description:
About Bandora:¬†

At Bandora, we are shaping the future of building operations. Buildings are among the largest consumers of energy, accounting for nearly one-third of global CO2 emissions. Maintaining optimal indoor conditions in commercial buildings, especially those with multiple tenants, is a significant challenge. Bandora‚Äôs cloud-based platform leverages real-time IoT data to provide intelligent dashboards, analytics, anomaly detection, and automation to eliminate energy waste and enhance occupant comfort. Our mission is to create autonomous, greener, and more comfortable buildings.¬†




The Role:¬†

As a Research Building Analyst, you will be at the forefront of the company‚Äôs innovation. Your work will be crucial in the development of cutting-edge methods to control and automate building systems. You will collaborate closely with data/AI scientists to analyse complex datasets, develop models, and provide actionable insights. Your contributions will have a direct impact on how our cross-functional team makes decisions and innovates.¬†




Key Responsibilities:¬†

Analyse the energy consumption patterns of buildings and HVAC systems using historical data, simulations, and real-time production environments.¬†
Collaborate with data scientists to improve existing algorithms or develop innovative solutions for optimizing building energy performance and comfort.¬†
Create digital twins and simulation models, and investigate automated calibration methods.¬†
Actively contribute to team discussions and data-driven decision-making.¬†
Create clear and engaging data visualizations to effectively communicate findings.¬†
Document results, experiments, processes, methodologies, and interpretations in a structured and accessible manner.¬†




Required Skills:¬†

Msc in Mechanical Engineering or a related field.¬†
Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities, coupled with a proactive mindset.¬†
Good understanding of building equipment, especially HVAC systems and how they function.¬†
Expertise in building simulation tools, like EnergyPlus and OpenStudio.¬†
Experience with developing¬†digital twins.¬†
Ability to design, execute, and analyse experiments following robust scientific methodologies.¬†
Ability to create clear and insightful research documentation and reports.¬†
Proficiency in English, both written and verbal.¬†

¬†

Nice-to-Have:¬†

Knowledge in the behavior of building energy consumption, such as patterns and relationships with climate data.¬†
Understanding of BIM systems.¬†
Experience with advanced data analysis, statistical modeling or data mining.¬†
Skills with Python and Git.¬†
Experience with digital twin calibration.¬†

¬†

Why Join Us?¬†

This is an exciting opportunity to see your work making a real-world impact. You‚Äôll thrive in a collaborative and supportive environment, continuously grow your skills, and contribute to making the world a greener place.¬†

HTML:
About Bandora: 

At Bandora, we are shaping the future of building operations. Buildings are among the largest consumers of energy, accounting for nearly one-third of global CO2 emissions. Maintaining optimal indoor conditions in commercial buildings, especially those with multiple tenants, is a significant challenge. Bandora‚Äôs cloud-based platform leverages real-time IoT data to provide intelligent dashboards, analytics, anomaly detection, and automation to eliminate energy waste and enhance occupant comfort. Our mission is to create autonomous, greener, and more comfortable buildings. 


The Role: 

As a Research Building Analyst, you will be at the forefront of the company‚Äôs innovation. Your work will be crucial in the development of cutting-edge methods to control and automate building systems. You will collaborate closely with data/AI scientists to analyse complex datasets, develop models, and provide actionable insights. Your contributions will have a direct impact on how our cross-functional team makes decisions and innovates. 


Key Responsibilities: 

  • Analyse the energy consumption patterns of buildings and HVAC systems using historical data, simulations, and real-time production environments. 
  • Collaborate with data scientists to improve existing algorithms or develop innovative solutions for optimizing building energy performance and comfort. 
  • Create digital twins and simulation models, and investigate automated calibration methods. 
  • Actively contribute to team discussions and data-driven decision-making. 
  • Create clear and engaging data visualizations to effectively communicate findings. 
  • Document results, experiments, processes, methodologies, and interpretations in a structured and accessible manner. 


Required Skills: 

  • Msc in Mechanical Engineering or a related field. 
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities, coupled with a proactive mindset. 
  • Good understanding of building equipment, especially HVAC systems and how they function. 
  • Expertise in building simulation tools, like EnergyPlus and OpenStudio. 
  • Experience with developing digital twins. 
  • Ability to design, execute, and analyse experiments following robust scientific methodologies. 
  • Ability to create clear and insightful research documentation and reports. 
  • Proficiency in English, both written and verbal. 

 

Nice-to-Have: 

  • Knowledge in the behavior of building energy consumption, such as patterns and relationships with climate data. 
  • Understanding of BIM systems. 
  • Experience with advanced data analysis, statistical modeling or data mining. 
  • Skills with Python and Git. 
  • Experience with digital twin calibration. 

 

Why Join Us? 

This is an exciting opportunity to see your work making a real-world impact. You‚Äôll thrive in a collaborative and supportive environment, continuously grow your skills, and contribute to making the world a greener place.

Title: Data Engineer
HTML:

Ent√£o a Deloitte √© para ti. Aqui, vais ter a possibilidade de potenciar a tua carreira e de refor√ßar as tuas compet√™ncias no nosso universo tecnol√≥gico.

Procuramos profissionais com algumas das val√™ncias abaixo:

  • Licenciatura/ Mestrado nas √°reas de Engenharia Inform√°tica, Engenharia Eletrot√©cnica e de Computadores, Matem√°tica ou √°reas similares;

  • Experi√™ncia em solu√ß√µes da Data Visualization (exemplo: Power BI, Tableau, Microstrategy, Looker, Grafana, Qlik);
  • Valorizamos experi√™ncia profissional com Data Warehouses / Data Lakes / Data Lakehouses;
  • Conhecimento de solu√ß√µes Cloud (AWS, Azure, GCP, Alibaba Cloud) orientadas a arquiteturas de dados distribu√≠dos;
  • Valorizamos experi√™ncia profissional em solu√ß√µes/tecnologias Real-time (exemplos, Kafka, Apache Flink, Apache Spark, Amazon Kinesis, Azure Data Stream, MongoDB, outras);
  • Valorizamos experi√™ncia previa em projetos com metodologias Agile;
  • Dom√≠nio da l√≠ngua inglesa falado e escrito (obrigat√≥rio);
  • Valorizamos tamb√©m profissionais que tenham conhecimentos de l√≠ngua francesa e alem√£.
  • Valorizamos certifica√ß√µes orientadas aos projetos de dados;

  • Boas capacidades de comunica√ß√£o, relacionamento interpessoal e trabalho em equipa;
  • Sentido de responsabilidade, sentido cr√≠tico, curiosidade.


Desenvolve uma carreira √† tua medida

  • Num contexto de trabalho diverso que permite um desenvolvimento e aprendizagem cont√≠nuos;
  • Atrav√©s de um plano de desenvolvimento de carreira personalizado (skills/ oportunidades t√©cnicas e funcionais), adequado ao momento, √†s tuas necessidades e objetivos;
  • Participando em projetos nacionais e internacionais, com dimens√£o e impacto relevante nesta √°rea de especializa√ß√£o;
  • Acesso ilimitado √†s maiores plataformas de aprendizagem online (Linkedin Learning e Udemy);
  • Oportunidade de forma√ß√µes e certifica√ß√µes nas mais recentes tecnologias, nomeadamente em tecnologias Cloud.


Vive uma cultura de uni√£o

  • Uma cultura de inova√ß√£o e excel√™ncia que nos torna l√≠deres e precursores de tend√™ncias;
  • Um ambiente amig√°vel, de respeito, confian√ßa, transpar√™ncia e informalidade;
  • Uma rede para a vida que te faz estar ligado ao melhor conhecimento ao lado de l√≠deres e especialistas;
  • Uma oportunidade para fazeres parte das nossas comunidades (de Tech, inova√ß√£o, desporto e outros interesses) e para participares ativamente em projetos de responsabilidade social.


Sobre a Deloitte

Na Deloitte nunca trabalhar√°s sozinho. Ter√°s a oportunidade de integrar diversos projetos de transforma√ß√£o e fazer parte de uma equipa que te vai inspirar e ajudar a desenvolver solu√ß√µes diferenciadoras, num ambiente din√¢mico e colaborativo, onde podes dar o melhor de ti e beneficiar das nossas iniciativas de bem-estar e flexibilidade. Somos mais de 5.500 pessoas em Portugal, das quais mais de 2.600 trabalham em √°reas tecnol√≥gicas, a partir de escrit√≥rios e Digital Studios em Lisboa, Porto, Braga, Viseu, Coimbra e Faro e de polos tecnol√≥gicos em Braga. Al√©m disso, as nossas equipas em Portugal t√™m proje√ß√£o internacional, o que demonstra a nossa forte lideran√ßa global em low code/no code, em engenharia de redes de telecomunica√ß√µes, em plataformas tecnol√≥gicas de transforma√ß√£o organizacional (ServiceNow e Apptio) e na ind√∫stria de servi√ßos financeiros (Finastra, TIA e Guidewire).

Se tens interesse em explorar e desenvolver as tuas compet√™ncias nalguma destas √°reas em solu√ß√µes tecnol√≥gicas ‚Äì engenharia de software, cloud, integra√ß√£o de sistemas, data analytics & data science, cyber risk, engenharia de redes telecomunica√ß√µes, UX design - e gostarias de trabalhar com tecnologias como AWS, Google, Oracle, Salesforce, SAP, Mulesoft, Feedzai e SAS, entre outras, ent√£o est√°s no lugar certo!

Title: Databank Operations Specialist
Description:
We are seeking a talented individual to join our Databank/Style team at Mercer. This role will be based in Lisbon. This is a hybrid role that has a requirement of working at least three days a week in the office.

The Databank/Style Team works as a close partner of the Wealth Consulting teams worldwide. We manage the content of Mercer‚Äôs proprietary database storing index values, economic data, as well as the content for Style Analytics ‚Äì global source of Style and Research Analysis for equity funds for Mercer Researchers and Consultants on a global scale.

The team works daily with Mercer users worldwide, ensuring they are provided with accurate, up to date investment data from our platforms. Daily work involves communication with a variety of colleagues from Mercer offices, teams and seniority all over the world (from Canada to Japan or Australia). Although strong communication skills are needed, there is a significant part of the work that involves troubleshooting and strong problem-solving skills, all while providing close contact with the platforms internal users and managing expectations.

We will count on you to:


Resolve and troubleshoot field queries.
Manage internal client‚Äôs expectations.
Monitoring requests efficiently.
Enhancing project guidelines and focusing on project optimization.
Support the greater use of Databank within the business (e.g.: Delegated Solutions content).
Liaise with other Mercer teams to resolve outages or delayed refreshes.


What are we looking for?


Bachelors or Master‚Äôs in Finance, Economics, Management, Engineering or similar (desirable but not mandatory).
Understanding of Investments and Finance concepts (desirable but not mandatory).
Fluent in English (C1/C2 level, verbal and written).
Ability to work along different cultures and create strong relationships with colleagues.
Proactivity.
Strong Communication skills ‚Äì clear and assertive.


What makes you stand out?


Lean mindset.
Strong Microsoft Office skills, including Word, Excel and Powerpoint.
Customer Service mindset.
Problem-solver, presenting capacity to identify and propose solutions.
Organizational skills.


Why join our team:


We help you be your best through professional development opportunities, interesting work and supportive leaders.
We foster a vibrant and inclusive culture where you can work with talented colleagues to create new solutions and have impact for colleagues, clients and communities.
Our scale enables us to provide a range of career opportunities, as well as benefits and rewards to enhance your well-being.


Mercer, a business of Marsh McLennan (NYSE: MMC), is a global leader in helping clients realize their investment objectives, shape the future of work and enhance health and retirement outcomes for their people. Marsh McLennan is a global leader in risk, strategy and people, advising clients in 130 countries across four businesses: Marsh, Guy Carpenter, Mercer and Oliver Wyman. With annual revenue of $24 billion and more than 90,000 colleagues, Marsh McLennan helps build the confidence to thrive through the power of perspective. For more information, visit mercer.com, or follow on LinkedIn and X.

Marsh McLennan is committed to creating a diverse, inclusive and flexible work environment. We aim to attract and retain the best people and embrace diversity of age, background, disability, ethnic origin, family duties, gender orientation or expression, marital status, nationality, parental status, personal or social status, political affiliation, race, religion and beliefs, sex/gender, sexual orientation or expression, skin color, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

Marsh McLennan is committed to hybrid work, which includes the flexibility of working remotely and the collaboration, connections and professional development benefits of working together in the office. All Marsh McLennan colleagues are expected to be in their local office or working onsite with clients at least three days per week. Office-based teams will identify at least one ‚Äúanchor day‚Äù per week on which their full team will be together in person.

Title: Data & Reporting Analyst
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:




DECSKILL TALENT: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.
DECSKILL BOOST: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.
DECSKILL CONNECT: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.




At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.




We are searching for an Data & Reporting Analyst!




Requirements:

Academic degree in IT, Cybersecurity, or other relevant area for the position.
Very good professional practice of English (French is a plus).
At least 5 years of professional experience in data analysis.
Very good Expertise in Excel, Python and other ETL tools.
Expertise in Power Bi is mandatory.
Ability to be autonomous.
Commitment to the job and the team objectives.
Systematic, critical, and logical thinking.
Be committed, demanding and pedagogue.
Strive continuously for customer satisfaction.
Aim to deliver very high-quality results.
Respect the procedures, methodologies, and directives.
Good capability of managing stress and conflicts.
Good listening and questioning ability.
Ability to plan work ahead and to prioritize workload.
Good team working ability.
Rigorous.
Client oriented.
Collaborative working skills.
Adaptation capacity.
Analytical skills.
Very Good level of english.




If you‚Äôre interested in this job, please send your CV in to cesaltina.abreu@decskill.com with reference ‚ÄúCA/Data&Reporting‚Äù.




Thank You!




Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About The Opportunity

We are seeking a skilled data analyst with expertise in data integration and modeling, as well as proficiency in SQL and DAX. The successful candidate will be pivotal in transforming raw data into new insights, enabling informed decision-making across the organization, specifically focusing on building, maintaining, and improving data models and business reports. We are looking for someone with a business-orientated mindset, able to adapt to different business realities and provide solutions to several customer lifecycle scenarios.

¬†

Academic background

Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Information systems, Management, Engineering or similar

¬†

Technical skills:

SQL, Python, Power BI

¬†

How You Will Make An Impact

Transform raw data into structured information, analyze data to drive strategic decisions, enhance analytical and reporting functions, and supervise performance and quality assurance processes.

¬†

1. Data Source Integration:

a. Establish connections to various data sources, including databases, monitoring tools, CRM systems, and cloud platforms using API or custom connectors.

b. Configure API connections to extract, transform, and load data from external sources into internal databases.

c. Experience setting up,‚ÄØbuilding, and‚ÄØmaintaining‚ÄØproduction data pipelines.

¬†

2. Data Modeling and Transformation:

a. Design and implement robust data models to support analytical reporting requirements.

b. Utilize Power Query and M language to perform data transformations, cleansing, and enrichment.

c. Understanding and experience in developing Descriptive, Prescriptive, and Predictive models

¬†

3. Data Visualization and Analysis:

a. Developing datasets through ETL processes and ensuring they are clean, accurate, and ready for analysis.

b. Translate complex data sets into clear, concise visualizations to communicate insights effectively.

c. Design and build interactive and visually compelling reports and dashboards, namely in Power BI.

¬†

4. Advanced Skills:

a. Implementing appropriate role-based access controls and data protection measures

d. Write and optimize complex DAX queries to ensure efficient data retrieval and analysis.

c. Develop automated workflows and macros to streamline data management and processing tasks.

About The Opportunity

We are seeking a skilled data analyst with expertise in data integration and modeling, as well as proficiency in SQL and DAX. The successful candidate will be pivotal in transforming raw data into new insights, enabling informed decision-making across the organization, specifically focusing on building, maintaining, and improving data models and business reports. We are looking for someone with a business-orientated mindset, able to adapt to different business realities and provide solutions to several customer lifecycle scenarios.

 

Academic background

Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Information systems, Management, Engineering or similar

 

Technical skills:

SQL, Python, Power BI

 

How You Will Make An Impact

Transform raw data into structured information, analyze data to drive strategic decisions, enhance analytical and reporting functions, and supervise performance and quality assurance processes.

 

1. Data Source Integration:

a. Establish connections to various data sources, including databases, monitoring tools, CRM systems, and cloud platforms using API or custom connectors.

b. Configure API connections to extract, transform, and load data from external sources into internal databases.

c. Experience setting up,‚ÄØbuilding, and‚ÄØmaintaining‚ÄØproduction data pipelines.

 

2. Data Modeling and Transformation:

a. Design and implement robust data models to support analytical reporting requirements.

b. Utilize Power Query and M language to perform data transformations, cleansing, and enrichment.

c. Understanding and experience in developing Descriptive, Prescriptive, and Predictive models

 

3. Data Visualization and Analysis:

a. Developing datasets through ETL processes and ensuring they are clean, accurate, and ready for analysis.

b. Translate complex data sets into clear, concise visualizations to communicate insights effectively.

c. Design and build interactive and visually compelling reports and dashboards, namely in Power BI.

 

4. Advanced Skills:

a. Implementing appropriate role-based access controls and data protection measures

d. Write and optimize complex DAX queries to ensure efficient data retrieval and analysis.

c. Develop automated workflows and macros to streamline data management and processing tasks.

As the founding entity of RAINBOW PARTNERS, Quanteam is a consulting firm specializing in the fields of Banking, Finance, and Financial Services. Guided by our core values of closeness, teamwork, diversity, and excellence, our team of 980 expert consultants, representing 35 different nationalities, collaborates across 12 international offices: Paris, Lyon, New York, Montreal, London, Brussels, Geneva, Lisbon, Porto, Casablanca, Madrid and Singapore. Committed to sustainability (Ecovadis Gold), diversity (gender index: 92%), and quality of work life (Best Workplace Experience), Quanteam is a forward-thinking enterprise.




üöÄ Our Expertise




With a dual expertise in both business and IT, Quanteam supports its corporate clients (investment banks, asset management companies, private and retail banks, custodians, etc.) across the entire Front-to-Back spectrum in evolving their business activities and transformation projects.




Our teams are organized into 5 expertise areas:

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Imagine your career taking you to the depths of innovation and the heights of impact. Our people enable continuous progress. Their commitment, collective expertise, and unique capabilities are the engine room behind SBM Offshore‚Äôs True. Blue. Transition. - shaping the future of energy, and beyond.

About Us:

SBM Offshore is the world‚Äôs deepwater ocean-infrastructure expert. Our work is already resulting in cleaner, more efficient energy production. True. Blue. Transition. is our promise to enable that into the future while at the same time using our expertise to support new and existing markets in the blue economy. It starts with Advancing our Core: continuing to advance the decarbonization of traditional energy production. While Pioneering More: helping to enable the energy transition and using our unique capabilities in ocean infrastructure to support more industries to grow sustainably. Sharing our experience for a better blue tomorrow.

Role & Main Responsibilities

The Data Analyst specializes in transforming complex datasets into actionable insights by creating and delivering dashboards and reports. Using Power BI as the primary tool and leveraging the Data Lakehouse and Data Warehouse, the analyst provides comprehensive analytics solutions to support informed decision-making across the organization.

Key Responsibilities:



Develop, maintain, and optimize Power BI dashboards and reports to communicate insights effectively.
Design and create interactive visualizations that empower stakeholders to explore data independently and derive meaningful insights.
Extract, consolidate, transform, and analyse data from various systems, including SuccessFactors, ServiceNow, IFS, and other platforms, ensuring accuracy and relevance.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify business needs and translate them into actionable analytical solutions.
Ensure data integrity and consistency while working with Data Lakehouse and Data Warehouse as primary data sources.
Perform descriptive and exploratory data analysis using tools like SQL or Python to uncover trends, patterns, and correlations.
Continuously improve reporting processes to enhance efficiency, accuracy, and the timely delivery of insights.
Document analytical workflows, methodologies, and processes to ensure clarity and reproducibility.



Job Requirements



Experience with ETL processes and data integration workflows.
Proven experience in creating advanced dashboards and reports using Power BI.
Strong knowledge of Data Lakehouse and Data Warehouse architecture and functionality.
Familiarity with systems such as SuccessFactors, ServiceNow, IFS, and other enterprise applications.
Proficiency in SQL and experience extracting data from relational databases.
Solid understanding of data visualization principles and storytelling through data.
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Data Analytics, Computer Science, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
Understanding of KPI development and reporting frameworks.



GENERAL INFORMATION

SBM Offshore N.V. is a listed holding company that is headquartered in Amsterdam. It holds direct and indirect interests in other companies that collectively with SBM Offshore N.V. form the SBM Offshore Group (‚Äúthe Company‚Äù). For further information, please visit our website at www.sbmoffshore.com. The companies in which SBM Offshore N.V., directly and indirectly, owns investments are separate entities.

SBM Offshore is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. SBM Offshore does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status, or any other basis covered by appropriate law. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need.

Title: Data Analyst (0 Experience Required)
Description:
For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.




At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.




As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.




With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.




So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!




Benefits

Work up to 20 hours per week.
Earn a competitive rate of pay.
Develop your research skills.
Avoid the long commute.
Work from the comfort of your home office.
Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!




Ideal Candidate

Fluent in English and Portugese.
Excellent research skills.
Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Portugal.
Analytical mindset.




Job Requirements

Must be living in Portugal for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
All work must be of an independent nature.







T&C's apply*




Apply Online Today!

Title: Data Analyst | Retail
Description:
Make an impact by working for sectors where technology is the enabler, everything is ground-breaking and there‚Äôs a constant need to be innovative.

Create and enhance projects in Java, Pyhton, Angular, PHP, .NET and so much more while diving in the world of Blockchain, Artificial Intelligence, Data Science, Security and Internet of Things.

Be part of the team that combines business knowledge, technological edge and a design experience. Our different backgrounds and know-how are key in developing solutions and experiences for digital clients.

Face challenges and learn other ways of thinking and seeing the world - there‚Äôs always room for your energy and creativity.

About The Role

A Data Analyst is responsible for examining and interpreting complex data sets to derive meaningful insights and support business decision-making. Focused on descriptive and diagnostic analytics to answer questions of where your company has been, where it is now, why things are the way they are now and support the decision about what are the next steps.

Their mission involves organizing data, conducting statistical analysis, creating data models, and collecting data requirements from Business.

Data analysts collaborate with different teams to understand their analytical requirements, identify key metrics, and communicate data-driven findings to stakeholders effectively.

As a part of your job, you will:


Gathering and analyzing business requirements to determine the best solution for data reporting and analysis.
Designing data solutions such as data warehousing, data marts, dashboards, and reporting systems.
Developing and maintaining data models, reports, and visualizations.
Collaborating with IT teams to ensure proper data integration and management.
Assisting stakeholders in interpreting data insights and making informed business decisions.



What are we looking for?


Retail experience;
At least 8 years of experience in data analysis, with a demonstrated track record of delivering actionable insights and driving business impact;
Proficiency in SQL for data querying and analysis;
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, or matplotlib);
Knowledge of statistical analysis techniques and tools (e.g., R, Python libraries like pandas);
Ability to interpret and analyze complex data sets;
Familiarity with data cleansing and preparation techniques.



Personal traits


Ability to adapt to different contexts, teams, and Clients;
Teamwork skills but also a sense of autonomy;
Motivation for international projects and ok if travel is included;
Willingness to collaborate with other players;
Strong communication skills.



At Celfocus, we are committed to cultivate a diverse and inclusive workplace. As an equal-opportunity employer, we welcome applicants of all backgrounds, gender identities, and abilities. We are dedicated to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with specific needs. If you require any adjustments during the selection process, please inform our Talent Acquisition Team.

Come join the Team!

Celfocus is a European high-tech system integrator, providing leading edge professional services focused on creating business value through Analytics and Cognitive solutions ‚Äì addressing Telecommunications, Financial Services, Retail, Energy & Utilities, Pharmaceutical, and other markets' strategic opportunities.

As a highly specialised engineering company, Celfocus helps clients undergo their innovation path, providing technological solutions to extract value from data and make it actionable.

Serving clients in +25 countries, Celfocus delivers solutions that boost customer experience and enhance operational efficiency, via our Cognitive Automation, Data & Analytics and Digital offers.
Show more
HTML:
Make an impact by working for sectors where technology is the enabler, everything is ground-breaking and there‚Äôs a constant need to be innovative.

Create and enhance projects in Java, Pyhton, Angular, PHP, .NET and so much more while diving in the world of Blockchain, Artificial Intelligence, Data Science, Security and Internet of Things.

Be part of the team that combines business knowledge, technological edge and a design experience. Our different backgrounds and know-how are key in developing solutions and experiences for digital clients.

Face challenges and learn other ways of thinking and seeing the world - there‚Äôs always room for your energy and creativity.

About The Role

A Data Analyst is responsible for examining and interpreting complex data sets to derive meaningful insights and support business decision-making. Focused on descriptive and diagnostic analytics to answer questions of where your company has been, where it is now, why things are the way they are now and support the decision about what are the next steps.

Their mission involves organizing data, conducting statistical analysis, creating data models, and collecting data requirements from Business.

Data analysts collaborate with different teams to understand their analytical requirements, identify key metrics, and communicate data-driven findings to stakeholders effectively.

As a part of your job, you will:

  • Gathering and analyzing business requirements to determine the best solution for data reporting and analysis.
  • Designing data solutions such as data warehousing, data marts, dashboards, and reporting systems.
  • Developing and maintaining data models, reports, and visualizations.
  • Collaborating with IT teams to ensure proper data integration and management.
  • Assisting stakeholders in interpreting data insights and making informed business decisions.


What are we looking for?

  • Retail experience;
  • At least 8 years of experience in data analysis, with a demonstrated track record of delivering actionable insights and driving business impact;
  • Proficiency in SQL for data querying and analysis;
  • Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, or matplotlib);
  • Knowledge of statistical analysis techniques and tools (e.g., R, Python libraries like pandas);
  • Ability to interpret and analyze complex data sets;
  • Familiarity with data cleansing and preparation techniques.


Personal traits

  • Ability to adapt to different contexts, teams, and Clients;
  • Teamwork skills but also a sense of autonomy;
  • Motivation for international projects and ok if travel is included;
  • Willingness to collaborate with other players;
  • Strong communication skills.


At Celfocus, we are committed to cultivate a diverse and inclusive workplace. As an equal-opportunity employer, we welcome applicants of all backgrounds, gender identities, and abilities. We are dedicated to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with specific needs. If you require any adjustments during the selection process, please inform our Talent Acquisition Team.

Come join the Team!

Celfocus is a European high-tech system integrator, providing leading edge professional services focused on creating business value through Analytics and Cognitive solutions ‚Äì addressing Telecommunications, Financial Services, Retail, Energy & Utilities, Pharmaceutical, and other markets' strategic opportunities.

As a highly specialised engineering company, Celfocus helps clients undergo their innovation path, providing technological solutions to extract value from data and make it actionable.

Serving clients in +25 countries, Celfocus delivers solutions that boost customer experience and enhance operational efficiency, via our Cognitive Automation, Data & Analytics and Digital offers.

Title: Data Analyst | ETL Developer
HTML:
Dellent is a consulting company focused in System Information and Telecommunications. Our goal is to help our candidates and consultants to take a step forward in their careers through projects that meet their needs and expectations.

This project is part of the business investment banking and financial services area, and currently has its technological hub in Porto and is working on the development of innovative solutions and support for all operations related to the business.

We are looking for a Data Analyst | ETL Developer to work in this project in Porto (Hybrid).

Requirements

  • Between 3 to 6 years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or a related role;
  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field;
  • Proven experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role (+ 3 years);
  • Knowledge of SQL for data extraction and manipulation;
  • Familiarity with ETL processes; experience with Stambia is a plus;
  • Experience with Google Cloud Platform (GCP) is a plus;
  • Proficiency in Power BI for data visualization and reporting is a plus;
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills;
  • Excellent communication skills in both French and English;
  • Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment;
  • Must be french-speaker, at least C1.

We Offer

  • Health insurance;
  • A personalized training plan, with a budget to spend on the training and technical books you find necessary;
  • Constant feedback so you can grow professionally;
  • Remote onboarding process;
  • Team events every semester so you can live new adventures;
  • Culture of proximity and transparency. Your ideas and needs are heard and valued by us!

Apply

If the above sounds like the kind of job opportunity you would want to get involved with, then please do not hesitate to apply here. You can also explore our content about the job market here.
